about_property:
Five bedrooms
Edwardian residence
An elite style of presentation
Four receptions
Meticulous gardens
Gated sweeping driveway
Exquisite kitchen
Laundry and Utility
Three bathrooms
Exceptional and large gardens
A beautifully imposing Edwardian detached residence, magnificently set within its own grounds, and quite possibly being one of the finest homes within the area.
The Old Vicarage is nicely nestled at the end of St Barnabas Drive with meticulously prepared gardens, gated sweeping driveway and a 'tip of the hat' to some amazing views of the local and surrounding countryside.
This is undoubtedly a gorgeous family home, where perhaps anyone who has business in Manchester or indeed Leeds, can easily 'return home' to a place that sits within the countryside and yet boasts a positioning that enjoys a convenient connection to the highly desirable centre of Littleborough Village where boutique clothes and coffee shops await. The countryside is also quite literally on the doorstep making a quick escape into the hills very easy indeed, and if commuting is your thing, the train links from here are superb.
This enigmatic dwelling has a style and an elite quality that seems to lavishly exude from everywhere and it is clearly evident that every detail from 'décor' to 'flow' has been immensely and professionally considered.
A brief insight into this exceptional and individual home further includes:
Ground floor – As you enter the property the large vestibule with original doors and ornate windows instantly welcomes you. There is a traditional cloaks room to the side. The reception hall has a returning stair case with a spindled balustrade to the first floor gallery style landing. The receptions are perfectly designed and decorated to enhance a function for each room as each one echoes its own personality. The study is already set for business as you will see. The sitting room is somewhere to put your feet up, and enjoy the roaring fire. The day lounge is again a place where the family may gather to catch up after the evening meal, still enjoying the sumptuous theme and with perhaps a more modern flair. From this lounge is access into the sun room with bi-folding doors, which is perfect if you are entertaining or is just the best place for an early morning coffee. The breakfast kitchen which is accessed from the hall and the sun room, is beautifully fitted with a breath taking selection of wall and base units, in-built appliances and matching Corian work surfaces. From here is access into the Utility and Laundry Room and personal access into the large double garage. Within here is a separate gym and a separate w.c.
First floor – the spacious and light galleried landing leads very nicely into each of the five double bedrooms and the two family bathrooms. As with the ground floor every detail has certainly been brushed with a professional eye. The Master Bedroom has been tastefully fitted with an exceptional level of quality furniture with a window seat to the bay. Bedroom number two enjoys its own en-suite bathroom and the house bathroom comprises of a luxury four piece suite. The guest bathroom is slightly smaller and still enjoys a sumptuous three piece suite.
Externally – at the front is the gravelled sweeping driveway with electronic security gated entrance. The gardens are meticulous and range from the traditional lawn with mature shrubbery borders, to a Zen style area. There is composite decking just from the garden room that currently leads to the large hot tub.
Please note the property has solar panels and our client informs that there is a saving of approximately £2,500 per year.
EPC Rating: D

A traditional semi-detached home set in the heart of popular Grotton. Viewing is considered essential. EPC: D.
Although requiring some cosmetic upgrading, this wonderful and deceptively spacious home would prove ideal for families looking for additional space both internally and externally.
Personal viewing will reveal an entrance hall with guest WC just off, a bright and spacious lounge with feature multi-fuel stove and a dining room with double doors leading out to the rear garden.
The kitchen is fitted with range of modern matching units and breakfast bar, perfect for more casual dining. An integrated garage can be accessed off the kitchen area.
To the first floor viewers will find three bedrooms, two of which are large double rooms and the accommodation is completed by a modern shower room comprising of a low-level WC, hand wash basin and walk-in shower unit.
Warmed by a gas central heating system with recently installed (2024) 'Worcester Bosch' combination boiler, the economy and comfort are enhanced further by uPVC double glazed windows.
Externally the property is set back from the road by a mature garden at the front, whilst to the rear there is an enclosed garden with both lawn and patio areas.
Off-road parking for two vehicles is available via a driveway which leads to the garage, which benefits from and electric 'up & over' door.
Oldham Road is one of the main arterial roads joining Oldham and the Saddleworth villages. Ideally located for excellent local amenities and services including schools, transport links and local walks, this would prove an ideal choice.

about_property:
Modern detached house
Superbly presented
Sought development
Four bedrooms
Large family kitchen
Generous gardens, parking & garage
Croft End Place, Ramsbottom is a beautifully presented, modern, four bedroom detached house set at the entrance to this recently built cul-de-sac of homes from Eccleston Homes. The house has a stylish and contemporary interior ideally suited to the modern family and with potential wfh options, set in generously sized, walled gardens with spacious landscaped patio and lawns. The house has the usual benefits of gas fired central heating sand is PVC double glazed. The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with stairs to the first floor and guests wc/cloaks, living room, dining room, spacious family kitchen, utility room, first floor, four bedrooms main with an ensuite shower room and additional family bathroom. Outside there is a garden forecourt, and long side driveway leading to a detached garage with remotely operated door and to the rear generously sized gardens with stylish large patio and lawn.
Council Tax Band E/Freehold Property there is a management company as the address is a private road costing £28pm.
Hallway
 (4.29 x 1.96 m)
This welcoming hallway features neutral décor complemented by wood-effect flooring and a carpeted staircase leading to the first floor. The space is bright and airy, with clean lines and modern touches, offering access to other rooms on the ground floor.
Wc
 (1.03 x 1.66 m)
The downstairs cloakroom is thoughtfully designed with white sanitary ware including a wall-mounted sink and a close-coupled toilet. A window allows natural light to brighten the space, which is finished with light-coloured flooring and pale walls for a fresh feel.
Living Room
 (5.86 x 3.63 m)
The living room is a comfortable and inviting space, carpeted throughout and decorated in soft neutral tones. It boasts a stylish, contemporary wall-mounted fireplace below a large flat-screen TV, flanked by bespoke grey cabinetry. A bay window with white shutters fills the room with natural light, enhancing the cosy, relaxed atmosphere.
Dining Room
 (3.04 x 2.73 m)
This elegant dining room features a round dining table surrounded by upholstered chairs. The room is softly carpeted with a large window dressed with neutral curtains and blinds, allowing plenty of natural light to fill the space. It offers a quiet and intimate space for meals and gatherings.
Family Kitchen
 (5.60 x 5.73 m)
The family kitchen is a bright, spacious area with a modern design and an open plan layout extending into a casual dining space. It features a central island with seating for three, sleek cabinetry in soft tones, and integrated appliances including an oven and extractor above the hob, fridge, freezer and dishwasher. Large windows and bi-fold doors open to the garden, flooding the space with natural light and providing a pleasant view of the outdoors. Wood-effect flooring adds warmth and practicality.
Utility Room
 (2.92 x 1.86 m)
The utility room is a practical space fitted with base cabinets and boiler cupboard, a work surface, and plumbing for washing and drying appliances. A door offers convenient garden access, while a window brings in daylight, making it an efficient and useful addition to the home.
Landing
 (0.97 x 3.00 m)
The first-floor landing is bright and airy, featuring white woodwork and balustrades with a striking dark grey feature wall. This space provides access to all bedrooms and bathrooms on the first floor.
Bedroom 1
 (4.16 x 2.75 m)
The master bedroom is spacious and carpeted, decorated in soft green tones with large windows dressed in neutral curtains. It benefits from an ensuite shower room and offers plenty of space for bedroom furniture, creating a calm and restful retreat.
Ensuite
 (1.47 x 1.98 m)
The ensuite shower room adjacent to the master bedroom features a tiled floor with a white suite including a shower cubicle, toilet, and basin with a heated towel rail. The room is finished in light neutral tones with a window providing ventilation and natural light.
Bedroom 2
 (4.67 x 3.70 m)
Bedroom 2 is a well-proportioned, carpeted room with a large window dressed with grey curtains. The light walls and simple furnishings create a comfortable space suitable for a double bed and additional furniture.
Bedroom 3
 (2.98 x 2.75 m)
Bedroom 3 offers a cosy space with neutral décor and carpeting. A window provides natural light, and there is enough room for a double bed and furniture, making it a versatile room for family or guests.
Bedroom 4
 (2.93 x 2.61 m)
This bedroom is carpeted and decorated in soft grey tones, with a window dressed in light curtains. It offers a peaceful sleeping space with enough room for a double bed and storage.
Bathroom
 (1.73 x 2.14 m)
The family bathroom is finished with tiled flooring and part-tiled walls. It includes a white suite comprising a bath, wall-mounted basin, and toilet. The neutral décor and window add to the light and airy feel of this room.
Rear Garden
The rear garden is a private, enclosed space featuring a mix of lawn and paved patio areas. Surrounded by a stone wall and wooden fencing with mature shrubs and plants, it provides a peaceful outdoor setting. There is a seating area with garden furniture and umbrella, perfect for relaxing or entertaining in the sunshine.
Garage
 (6.01 x 3.21 m)
This detached garage offers a secure space for vehicle parking or storage. It measures just over 6 metres in length and 3 metres in width, providing useful additional space to the property.

No Chain – Modern Apartment with Balcony Views of Manchester & Salford
Situated in the heart of Salford’s vibrant and rejuvenated Crescent area, this stylish one-bedroom apartment offers modern city living with superb on-site amenities and stunning views. Just a ten-minute walk from Manchester City Centre, and within easy reach of Salford University, Salford Central Train Station, and MediaCityUK, it’s ideal for professionals, students, or investors seeking a prime location.
Step into a bright, modern kitchen fitted with white cupboards, ample storage, an integrated washer, dishwasher, electric oven, electric hob, and cooker hood, plus space for a freestanding fridge-freezer. The kitchen flows seamlessly into the main living space, decorated with cream carpets, where patio doors flood the room with natural light and open onto a private balcony overlooking the surrounding cityscape.
The spacious bedroom benefits from built-in storage and offers “Jack and Jill” access to the bathroom, which is decorated floor-to-ceiling in white tiles for easy maintenance and features a step-in bath with overhead shower.
Local Crescent is a modern purpose-built development by prestigious developers Salboy, designed with a high-end finish, thoughtful layouts, and premium fixtures. Residents enjoy an exceptional range of facilities including a heated swimming pool, cinema room, gymnasium, solarium, sauna and spa, laundry area, landscaped courtyard garden, and a rooftop terrace with panoramic views.
With no onward chain, excellent transport links, and an unbeatable location, this apartment combines convenience, style, and comfort in one of Salford’s most sought-after neighbourhoods

about_property:
Freehold four-bedroom home
Fully owned solar panel system
Driveway parking for up to three cars
Bright and spacious open-plan living room
Modern kitchen-diner
Master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room
Large family bathroom
Prime location
Spacious Four-Bedroom Freehold Home with Driveway, Solar Panels & Prime Worsley Location
Tucked away in a peaceful cul-de-sac in Worsley, this beautifully presented four-bedroom freehold home offers modern living, excellent energy efficiency, and superb transport links. With solar panels, a driveway for up to three cars, and generous living spaces throughout, this is a property that perfectly balances comfort and practicality.
Step inside to a bright and spacious hallway, complete with storage space under the stairs and light grey flooring that flows seamlessly through the ground floor. The neatly positioned downstairs WC features striking floor-to-ceiling blue tiling for a splash of colour and easy maintenance.
The main living room is impressively large, with a bay window at the front and patio doors at the rear flooding the space with natural light. A dining area sits at the back, creating a perfect setting for family meals and entertaining. The contemporary kitchen-diner boasts grey high-gloss cupboards, white marble-effect countertops, and integrated appliances including an electric oven, grill, hob, and cooker hood as well as a dishwasher. There’s also space for a washer/dryer and freestanding fridge freezer, along with excellent storage. To the rear, an additional seating area with patio and large windows offers a lovely garden outlook and could easily serve as a second dining space.
Upstairs, the master bedroom is bright and generously sized, with fitted wardrobes spanning one wall. Its en-suite bathroom combines blue and white tiling with a walk-in shower. Two further double bedrooms provide plenty of space for family or guests, while the fourth bedroom works perfectly as a home office or dressing room. The large family bathroom features both a bath and a separate shower, with floor-to-ceiling stone-coloured tiling for a sleek, low-maintenance finish. An internal storage area offers the perfect hideaway for laundry.
The rear garden is a secure, private space with both paved and lawned areas, enclosed by fencing.
One of the property’s standout features is its fully owned solar panel system, which significantly reduces electricity bills and improves overall energy efficiency. Not only does this provide immediate savings, but it also offers long-term financial and environmental benefits, making this home both cost-effective and eco-friendly.
Perfectly situated just moments from Parr Fold Park and the scenic Roe Green Loopline, this home is within walking distance of Mesne Lea Primary School, Co-op Academy Walkden, and local shops. Excellent road and rail links via the A580, M60, and Walkden Station ensure fast access to Manchester city centre, Salford Quays, and Bolton. The rhs Bridgewater Gardens, charming pubs, cafés, and further amenities are also just minutes away.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a spacious, energy-efficient home in a highly desirable location – early viewing is strongly recommended.

about_property:
Delph
Substantial terraced cottage
Approx 1,450 square feet
Two receptions & three bedrooms
Mature garden with fruit trees, bushes & herbs
Off-road parking for three vehicles
Close to local amenities
Freehold
Council tax band 'E'
EPC: Tbc
A deceptively spacious mid-terraced cottage set in an enviable position just a short walk to the sought-after village of Delph. An ideal family home, viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: Tbc.
Set behind beautifully tended and substantial gardens, this charming home offers almost 1,500 square feet of accommodation, making it an ideal choice for family purchasers looking for additional space both internally and externally.
Easily accessible from both the front & rear, where there is ample off road parking, personal viewing of the ground floor will reveal an entrance hall which opens into a multi-use room, previously used as a home office. A farmhouse style kitchen features a composite sink, range cooker and ample worktop space, and the large dining room features double doors leading out the well-stocked and mature garden.
The large and welcoming lounge features mullion windows, exposed stone & brick fireplace and 'parquet' style wooden flooring, all helping to blend tradition into modern living.
To the first floor viewers will find three bedrooms, all of which are good-sized double rooms, and a family bathroom comprising of a hand-wash basin and panelled bath with shower over. The WC is adjacent to bathroom, and a useful storage room containing the boiler and plumbed for a washing machine completes the accommodation.
Benefitting from Smart heating controls, the property is warmed by an 'Ideal Logic+' combination boiler and well-maintained hardwood double glazed windows enhance the economy and comfort further.
Externally to the rear there is off-road parking for up to three vehicles, two storage sheds and steps to an upper seating area with further shed and wood store. No public access across the property makes it private and pleasant enhancement.
To the front, the mature and substantial enclosed garden benefits from both lawn and patio areas, including a multitude of shrubs and plants ensuring almost year-round colour. A growers paradise, the vegetable garden features a variety of plants, herbs and fruit trees, including gooseberry & blueberry bushes, apple & pear trees, rhubarb, strawberries and lemon balm. The owners have also been able to grow a wide variety of herbs and vegetables in the raised beds, including brassicas, pulses, garlic, onions and potatoes, whilst using a greenhouse to produce tomatoes, coriander and other herbs.
Delph Lodge can be located just off Huddersfield Road on the fringes of the popular village of Delph in Saddleworth. With trendy pubs, cafés and wine bars within walking distance, the property is also ideal for easy access to neighbouring villages including Dobcross, Diggle and Uppermill and as such, this would prove an ideal choice.

about_property:
Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden
4 Bed, 3 Bath, 3 Receps, Wine Cellar & Cinema Room
An Outstanding, Period Character Property, Set Over 4 Floors
Generous Living Space Of Almost 3,000sqft
Beautifully Presented Inside & Out
Superb Retained Character Features
Excellent Patio, Pond, Lawn, Gardens & Wooded Outlook
Electric-Gated Private Parking & Detached Timber Garage
Viewing essential - Available Now By Appointment Only
Contact Our Rawtenstall Office Exclusively To View
This stunning, period character property is believed to date to the 17th/18th Century and forms part of the original 'Ashworth Hall'. Now one of 3 cottages and offering exceptionally generous, 4 bedroom living over 4 floors, this superb home has gorgeous outside space too. 3 Bathrooms and 3 receptions provide versatile accommodation, while electric-gated parking, a patio, pond, gardens and lawn add superb outdoor areas and complete the picture here. This beautiful Grade II Listed property sits within a quite wonderful setting amongst country surroundings yet is within just minutes of Bury town centre. It has a great range of nearby local amenities and is without doubt, a genuinely outstanding opportunity.
Ashworth Hall Cottage, Ashworth Road, Norden is one of those unusual properties which can truly be called exquisite. With deceptively spacious accommodation, well arranged over 4 storeys and amounting to almost 3,000sqft in all, this 4 bedroom / 3 bathroom / 3 receptions Grade II Listed home is an outstanding period property, boasting an absolute wealth of beautiful aspects and character features.
From stone flagged floors to impressive beamed ceilings and from the Feature Fireplace to the superb Kitchen and Bathrooms, this property has it all - even a Cinema Room and Wine Cellar too! Moving outside things are no less impressive with private electric-gated access to the ample parking and detached timber garage. There is a superb stone paved rear patio overlooking the beautiful mature Koi pond and wooded outlooks beyond, while the spacious garden area has a superb lawn, hedging and stone walls too. There is certainly ample space here for a kitchen garden or perhaps a garden building for a work from home option STP if desired. Additionally, to the front, the property can also be approached through a listed, historic gateway which gives shared access to this and the adjoining properties and is the original entrance to Ashworth Hall.
In all, this glorious home enjoys a great setting in a fabulous location amongst lovely surroundings and offers everything needed for modern family living within a property of excellent period features. Viewings here are available now, exclusively by appointment through our Rawtenstall office - contact us now to arrange you private viewing appointment.
Internally, this property is arranged over 4 storeys in all and briefly comprises:
Ground floor - Entrance Vestibule, Hallway with Downstairs WC, Lounge, Kitchen / Dining Room with Pantry.
First floor - Off the first flor Landing with Built In Storage are Bedroom 1 with En-Suite Shower Room and the Family Bathroom.
Second floor - Off the second floor Landing are Bedroom 4, Inner Landing to Bedroom 2 with Walk-In Wardrobe, Bedroom 3 and Shower Room.
Third floor
 - To the third floor is a spacious Study.
Basement - To the Basement, off the Lower Landing with Store are the Media Room with Store Room, a Wine Cellar and the Utility.
Outside, the property has Electric Gates which give access to ample off road Driveway Parking and a Detached Timber Garage. There is a stone flagged Rear Patio with Koi Pond, extensive Rear Garden and superb wooded outlooks. To the front, the property is accessed via a listed, pedestrian Communal Gated Entranceway.
Situated slightly off Ashworth Road itself, this property has an enviable position amongst a truly wonderful setting. Country surroundings envelop the site of the original Ashworth Hall, with farmland, woodland and open fields too, while still being within reach of main road connections and commuter routes. Notable amenities nearby include The Bird at Birtle - one of Lancashire's best gastropubs, Gelder Wood Country Park and The Pavilions. Bury Grammar School is just 4 & 1/2 miles away and there are excellent range of local facilities in both Norden and Bamford, while Bury town centre with comprehensive shopping, leisure, health, sports & fitness, dining and entertainment options is just 10 minutes away.

A stylish and superbly presented three bedroom modern detached family home on a sought after estate a few miles from Manchester. EPC - B.
A stylish and high-spec property, this three bedroom detached would make the ideal family home on on the sought after 'Lancaster Gardens' estate in Failsworth.
Located on Garden Crescent, the property is garden fronted plus boasts driveway parking leading to the detached garage. While to the rear there is a smart and low maintenance back garden perfect for busy professionals or anyone with children or pets.
Internally you will find a tastefully decorated home thoughtfully finished with modern touches and quality fittings throughout.
With an inviting entrance hallway, there is a good sized lounge with a media wall to your right, there is then a generous kitchen/dining room at the rear enjoying plenty of worktop and cupboard space plus your essential appliances integrated. There is also a handy downstairs toilet plus storage beneath the stairs. To the first floor there are three superbly proportioned double bedrooms with an en-suite to the main bedroom plus a separate family bathroom completing the accommodation.
Located just off Broadway, the popular estate is pleasantly tucked away on the edge of Failsworth while retaining fantastic access to commuter links, schools and outdoor spaces. The M60 motorway is just over a 1 mile drive with the Manchester city centre easily reached via the adjacent A62 or the nearby Metrolink stations. There are well-regarded schools nearby plus popular walks and green spaces including Lower Memorial Park and Moston Brook.

This exceptional three-bedroom semi-detached home, thoughtfully designed with modern living in mind, offers spacious accommodation across three beautifully presented floors. Situated in the prestigious Heartsmead development in Ashton, this property enjoys a prime location close to an array of local amenities, renowned schools, and excellent transport links. The property also provides easy access to breathtaking countryside walks and Ashton-Under-Lyne Golf Club.
As you step inside, the welcoming entrance hall leads you into a generously proportioned kitchen/diner, where bespoke Silestone worktops add a touch of luxury. This area seamlessly blends functionality with style, providing ample space for cooking and dining. The ground floor also includes a convenient WC and a spacious lounge, where bi-fold doors open out onto the rear garden, allowing for effortless indoor-outdoor living. The entire ground floor is finished with elegant Amtico flooring, enhancing the contemporary ambiance of the home. The first floor features two well-appointed bedrooms, each offering comfort and versatility, along with a sleek family bathroom. The second floor is dedicated to the master suite, a private sanctuary complete with a luxurious en-suite bathroom. This space provides the perfect retreat, combining comfort with a touch of elegance.
Externally, the property boasts a two-car driveway at the front, providing ample off-street parking. Side access leads to a meticulously maintained, landscaped rear garden, where an additional £10,000 has been invested to create a stunning outdoor space. The garden features a bespoke Indian Stone patio, which extends to a lush, green lawn bordered on either side by lush flower beds, with a raised planter to the rear., creating a serene outdoor space for relaxation and entertainment.

about_property:
Sought-after residential road close to Gatley Village
Within catchment for outstanding Gatley Primary School
Beautifully presented 1930s bay-fronted semi-detached home
Elegant bay-fronted dining room with Art Deco fireplace
Stylish living room with panelling, feature fireplace and French doors
Well-equipped galley kitchen with integrated appliances
Three well-proportioned bedrooms and four-piece family bathroom
Off-road parking, detached garage and private lawned rear garden
Planning permission granted for rear/side and dormer loft conversion.
A beautifully presented 1930s bay-fronted semi-detached home set on a sought-after residential road in Gatley, perfectly placed for the charming Gatley Village and the outstanding Gatley Primary School.
Description
Decorated and maintained to a high standard throughout, this characterful property combines period charm with stylish modern touches. The welcoming entrance hall, with its decorative hardwood front door and patterned glazing, sets the tone for the rest of the home. To the front, the elegant bay-fronted dining room features an attractive Art Deco fireplace and wooden flooring, while the separate living room offers stylish panelling, a feature fireplace, and French doors opening onto the patio area. The well-equipped galley kitchen boasts integrated appliances, tiled flooring with under-floor heating, and the practicality of an under-stairs WC.
Upstairs, three well-proportioned and beautifully decorated bedrooms are served by a contemporary four-piece family bathroom, complete with shower enclosure and separate bath. The rear bedroom offers far-reaching views over Manchester's skyline.
Other noteworthy features include the recently approved plans for a ground floor wrap around extension and dormer loft conversion allowing the opportunity for growth in the future.
Externally, the property enjoys off-road parking to the front, a detached garage to the rear, and an enclosed lawned garden providing a private and peaceful outdoor space.
Location
Cheadle offers a good selection of shops, pubs and restaurants and provides excellent educational facilities for children of all ages. Cheadle Royal Shopping Centre is close by together with access to the A34 by-pass which leads to Handforth Dean and Stanley Green Retail Park. Motorway connections to the M60 are available at both ends of the village, Manchester International Airport is easily accessible, whilst railway stations are situated at nearby Gatley and Cheadle Hulme.

This stunning four bedroom detached home offers immaculate interiors, a modern layout, and a prime location close to everything you need from top-rated schools and transport links to beautiful green spaces. Perfect for busy families and those who love to entertain, this property combines style, comfort, and practicality in one irresistible package.
Step into a bright and inviting hallway that leads to a generous lounge the perfect spot to relax and unwind. The heart of the home is the impressive open-plan kitchen and dining room, finished with sleek, modern units, integrated appliances, and plenty of space for family gatherings or dinner parties. Bi fold doors open onto the rear garden, letting in natural light and creating an easy indoor-outdoor flow.
A separate utility room, a handy downstairs WC and integral garage provide everyday convenience. Upstairs, you’ll find four beautifully presented bedrooms. The master suite is a standout, complete with fitted wardrobes and a modern en-suite shower room. The remaining bedrooms are equally well-proportioned, offering flexibility for family, guests, or even a home office. A contemporary family bathroom with stylish fittings completes the interior.
The private rear garden has been thoughtfully landscaped to offer a blend of lawn and patio areas, ideal for summer barbecues, relaxing in the sun, or giving children a safe space to play. To the front, a driveway offers ample off-road parking alongside the garage.
Situated in one of the most sought-after addresses in the area, the property is just minutes from excellent local schools, shops, cafes, and transport links making commuting simple.
A truly move-in ready home in an enviable location, early viewing is highly recommended.

***no chain***A simply delightful and recently renovated three bedroom semi detached 1920S property positioned on a well regarded road, benefitting from both a driveway as well as a south-westerly facing rear garden. This splendid property offers spacious and light move-in ready accommodation, ideal for a young couple or family and is ideally located within only a short stroll from Chorlton Village, Old Trafford cricket and football grounds as well as multiple local schools and Longford Park. The property further benefits from having two Metrolink stations (Firswood and Old Trafford) within only a few minutes walk which provide fast access across the city and to the nearby airport. The property has been reroofed, rewired, re-plumbed, re-plastered and decorated, fitted with new central heating and flooring throughout as well as featuring a brand new kitchen and bathroom and is certainly not one to be missed. The accommodation briefly comprises: Covered porch, entrance hallway, lounge with large bay window, sitting/dining room with views the rear garden, new breakfast kitchen fitted with modern shaker style units and marble effect worktops. To the first floor there are three good sized bedrooms, the main with large bay window and bathroom, refitted with a modern three piece suite. Double glazing has been installed throughout. Externally, to the front of the property is a decorative gravel driveway providing off road parking while to the rear, a good sized fenced and enclosed garden enjoys a sunny southerly aspect and has been mainly laid to lawn with a stone flagged patio area. An internal viewing is most highly recommended. Council Tax: C

Imagine waking up and stepping out onto your own private balcony, enjoying your morning coffee as sunlight pours into the garden below. Welcome to 249 Outwood Road – a bright, spacious and beautifully maintained four-bedroom semi-detached home in the heart of Heald Green.
From the moment you step inside, the house feels bright and airy, with natural light streaming through charming stained glass windows, adding character and colour to the home.
The ground floor offers an enormous living room, perfect for family life or entertaining. French doors at the rear open straight out to a truly massive, south facing garden – a dream for summer barbecues, children playing, or simply relaxing in your own private green space.
There’s also a large kitchen, full of potential for culinary enthusiasts, and a separate dining room, ideal for hosting meals or creating a family hub.
Upstairs, you’ll find four well-proportioned bedrooms, including a master bedroom with a private balcony — a rare and peaceful spot to enjoy a moment of calm. A family bathroom and separate WC complete the upper floor layout. There is also great potential for a loft conversion with the property having a brand new roof and with skylights fitted.
Set in a popular residential area, this home is just a short distance from local schools, transport links, and amenities, making it perfect for families or anyone looking to enjoy the space and lifestyle of suburban living with all the convenience of nearby Manchester and Stockport.
* Four spacious bedrooms
* Driveway fits 3-4 vehicles
* Master bedroom with private balcony
* Enormous living room with French doors to garden
* Large kitchen and separate dining room
* Stained glass windows and bright, character-filled interiors
* Huge private garden
* Bathroom plus separate WC
* Brand new boiler system
* Sought-after location in Heald Green

about_property:
Semi-Detached Home For Sale
Desirable Bury Location
3 Well Sized Bedrooms
Open Plan Dining/Kitchen/Summer Room
Modern 3 Piece Bathroom
Large Low Maintenance Garden
Driveway to the Front
Detached Garage
Early Viewing is Highly Advised!
Spacious Three-Bedroom Semi-Detached Home in Bury
This well-presented three-bedroom semi-detached property offers generous living space, modern touches, and a versatile layout, making it an ideal family home.
You enter through a welcoming porch into the main hallway, which provides access to the living areas as well as the staircase to the first floor. At the front of the home is a bright and inviting living room, complete with a wall-mounted gas fire and a charming bay window that floods the room with natural light.
To the rear lies the heart of the home — an open-plan kitchen, dining, and summer room. The kitchen/dining area is fitted with a range of wall and base units and benefits from an extended section, offering extra workspace and storage. This expansive space also offers a feature log burning stove within the chimney breast. The summer room is a superb addition, providing a light-filled space with patio doors leading to the rear garden, perfect for entertaining or relaxing.
To the first floor, you will find three well-proportioned bedrooms. The main bedroom boasts fitted wardrobes, providing practical storage, while the other two rooms offer flexibility for family living, guests, or a home office. The family bathroom is also located on the first floor and is fitted with a three-piece suite.
Externally, the property enjoys a driveway to the front providing off-road parking, and to the rear, a low-maintenance garden with a detached garage for additional storage or workshop use.
Located in a popular area of Bury, close to local amenities, schools, and transport links, this property combines comfort, convenience, and style — ready for its next owners to move straight in.
Early viewing is advised!

This well presented three-bedroom semi-detached home, located in a sought-after area of Ashton situated on the popular residential 18th Fairway development. EPC C
Ryder & Dutton are delighted to present for sale this well presented semi detached home situated on the sought after 18th Fairway development providing a superb family home and therefore early viewing is highly recommended.
Upon internal inspection you will find an entrance porch leading to a spacious living room. Beyond the living room is a dining area which leads to a kitchen which is fitted with a range of matching units.
To the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a further single bedroom. The main family bathroom is fitted with a white three piece suite comprising panelled bath with shower over, pedestal wash hand basin and low level wc.
Externally the property benefits from driveway to the front, whilst to the rear is a well maintained south facing landscaped garden. The property benefits from being non overlooked to both the front and rear.
The property is heated via a Ideal combi boiler and is enhanced by being fully uPVC double glazed.
The property sits close to Ashton Golf Club and offers convenient access to good local amenities and transport links, including the M60 motorway network which is just a short drive away. A number of schools including St Damiens R.C high school and St. Christopher's Primary school are also very closeby.
Knott Hill nature reserve is just a short walk away and Mossley and Saddleworth are also just a short distance away and offer numerous attractions and villages including Greenfield, with its wonderful walks around Dovestone Reservoir and the Peak District National Park and Uppermill, with canal boats tours and a fantastic array of shops, cafés and public houses.

Deceptively spacious two-bedroom mid-terrace home, offering a light and airy interior and beautiful gardens to the front and rear. Lovingly owned for many years, the property now requires some modernisation, offering an excellent opportunity for buyers to put their own stamp on it.
The accommodation comprises a welcoming lounge, kitchen/diner, two generously sized bedrooms, and a family bathroom. It also benefits from a new roof fitted last year and a boiler installed approximately 3–4 years ago.
Located close to Rochdale town centre, the property is ideally positioned for excellent access to schools, shops, transport links, and other local amenities. Offered for sale with no onward chain.
Entrance
A welcoming space with room to hang coats and store shoes. Stairs rise to the first floor, and a door leads through to the lounge.
Lounge
 (4.34 x 3.56 (14'2" x 11'8"))
A bright and welcoming reception room, enhanced by a charming bay window to the front that fills the space with natural light. The feature fireplace adds a focal point to the room. A door leads seamlessly through to the kitchen/diner, creating a natural flow for everyday living.
Kitchen Diner
 (4.45 x 2.87 (14'7" x 9'4"))
Offering scope for modernisation this good sized kitchen offers a range of base and wall units with space and plumbing for appliances, along with a useful pantry-style storage cupboard. A rear-facing window and door provide pleasant views and access to the garden, allowing plenty of natural light to fill the space.
Landing
A central landing providing access to all first-floor rooms, creating a practical and convenient layout.
Bedroom 1
 (5.51 x 3.74 (18'0" x 12'3"))
A spacious double bedroom with two windows allowing plenty of natural light. The room includes a large storage cupboard, and its generous proportions mean that some neighbouring properties have successfully split this space into two separate bedrooms, offering flexible options for future use.
Bedroom 2
 (2.87 x 2.63 (9'4" x 8'7"))
A comfortable double bedroom with a rear-facing window overlooking the garden, providing a pleasant outlook and giving access to the loft.
Bathroom
 (1.73 x 1.72 (5'8" x 5'7"))
A three-piece suite comprising a WC, wash hand basin, and bath. With a rear-facing window providing natural light, the bathroom would benefit from modernisation, offering an excellent opportunity to create a stylish and contemporary space.
Gardens
Beautiful, well-established, and thoughtfully maintained gardens surround the property. The front garden features a paved path leading to the front door, with lawn areas bordered by a variety of plants and shrubs. To the rear, a sunny south-facing garden provides a lovely place to sit out and enjoy, complete with a seating area, raised planting borders, and an easy-to-maintain artificial lawn.

Nestled in a quiet residential cul-de-sac, Ashawe Grove, M38 0EE presents an ideal opportunity for first-time buyers, small families, or investors seeking a well-proportioned two-bedroom home in a convenient location. This delightful semi-detached property offers comfortable living spaces, generous gardens, and ample off-road parking – all within close proximity to local amenities, schools, and transport links.
Upon entering you're welcomed by a bright and inviting entrance hall that leads through to a spacious lounge. The lounge features a large window and French doors to the garden that fill the room with natural light, enhancing the sense of space and warmth. To the rear of the ground floor is a well-appointed fitted kitchen, complete with a range of base and wall units, ample worktop space, and integrated appliances. Adjacent to the kitchen is a convenient utility area that offers additional storage and functionality – ideal for housing white goods or creating a practical laundry space.
Upstairs, the first floor comprises two well-sized bedrooms, both offering comfortable accommodation and versatile layout options. The master bedroom benefits from generous proportions, while the second bedroom is perfectly suited for a child’s room, guest space, or home office. A modern family bathroom completes the first floor, featuring a clean and functional design with a three-piece suite. The loft has been fully boarded out with integrated ladder hatch and lighting for additional storage space.
Externally, the property continues to impress with a private driveway to the front providing off-road parking. The rear garden is of a good size and offers a secure and enclosed space – perfect for children, pets, or summer entertaining.
With GCH and double glazing throughout, this charming home is ready to move into but also offers scope for personalisation. Viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the potential and value on offer at this well-located address.
Entrance Hall
Radiator and stairs to first floor.
Lounge
Radiator, double glazed window and double glazed patio doors leading to rear garden area.
Kitchen
A range of low and eye level units incorporating a stainless steel sink and drainer unit, built in four ring hob, oven and grill, partly tiled walls, space for washing machine, wall mounted radiator, double glazed window, door to under stairs storage cupboard, door to utility area and door to inner hall
Inner Hall
Door to rear garden and front garden with doors to separate storage cupboard and utility room.
Utility Room
A range of low level units, space for fridge freezer and double glazed window.
First Floor Landing
Double glazed window and loft access with fully boarded loft and ladder which can be used for storage.
Bedroom One
Double glazed window and wall mounted radiator with storage cupboard.
Bedroom Two
Double glazed window and wall mounted radiator.
Bathroom
A three piece suite comprising of bath with shower over, vanity unit housing sink unit and low level WC, fully tiled walls and flooring, spot lights to ceiling, double glazed window and wall mounted stainless steel heated towel rail.
Outside
To the front of the property there is a paved driveway providing off road parking for numerous cars and to the rear of the property there is a lovely enclosed lawned garden, patio with raised planters full of flowers and plants making this a fantastic space for al fresco dining.

Tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of highly sought-after Prestwich, this superbly presented home offers a wonderful combination of space, style, and convenience—perfectly suited for modern family life.
Set across three well-designed floors, the property features three generously sized bedrooms, providing comfortable and flexible living arrangements for families, professionals, or those in need of a home office. The master bedroom benefits from its own en-suite shower room, while the remaining bedrooms are served by a modern and well-appointed family bathroom—ideal for busy households.
At the heart of the home is a bright and airy open-plan living space, designed for modern living. The lounge flows seamlessly into the dining area and contemporary kitchen, creating an ideal setting for both everyday living and entertaining. From the dining area, there is direct access to the rear garden—perfect for summer evenings and al fresco dining.
On the ground floor, you’ll also find a practical utility room, a convenient downstairs WC, and a large integral garage. This garage offers fantastic versatility and could easily be transformed into an additional bedroom, home office, or second reception room, depending on your needs.
Externally, the property boasts a driveway with space for two vehicles, as well as an electric vehicle charging point—an increasingly desirable feature for modern homeowners. The rear garden provides a private outdoor retreat, ideal for families or simply enjoying a bit of green space in a peaceful setting.
Located just a short stroll from Prestwich Village, you’ll enjoy easy access to independent shops, cafés, excellent schools, and direct transport links into Manchester, all while benefiting from the quiet charm of this tucked-away residential enclave.
This is a home that beautifully balances contemporary living with comfort and convenience, in one of Prestwich’s most desirable locations.
Early viewing is strongly recommended to fully appreciate all that this fantastic property has to offer.

No chain! A truly unique opportunity to acquire a stunning Grade II listed five bedroom property measiuring over 4,300 sqft situated on approx a 1 acre plot. EPC - Exempt
Welcome to Park House, they don't build 'em like this anymore!
This is a rare opportunity to acquire a large five bedroom Grade II listed house steeped in local history dating back to c.1814 and beyond. It is said Winston Churchill even visited the property prior to him being elected as an Oldham mp in 1900.
Only appreciated by internal inspection and measuring over 4,300 sqft, this exceptionally spacious family home has lots of character and features.
This is perhaps a once in a generation opportunity to acquire such a prestige character property in this highly regarded location.
The property features stunning grand entrance hallway with parquet flooring, lounge also with parquet flooring, morning room, study, kitchen/diner, utility room, downstairs WC. Upstairs leads to large landing with picture window, a further WC, plus shower room, five large double bedrooms, washroom accessed via two of the bedrooms, plus a further family bathroom.
Externally, the property sits on a large plot measuring approx 1 acre with stunning mature gardens. The garden has been carefully curated to flourish in the pennine climate. There is also a gated driveway leading to a detached double garage to the rear which also has a tack room to the side. The property also has large cellar rooms which are full standing height and can be accessed externally, these rooms are ideal for potential conversion.
Situated just off Milnrow Road (A663) close to the junction with Buckstones Road - a location which has proved consistently popular. On the doorstep of stunning countryside such as Crompton Moor, yet within easy reach of Shaw town centre, the property is also well placed for popular local schools and provides easy access to the M62 to Leeds. Saddlewoth is also not far away, Shaw & Crompton Metrolink station is within walking distance providing easy access to Manchester.

Stamp Duty
Residential property rates
You usually pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (sdlt) on increasing portions of the property price when you buy residential property, for example a house or flat.
The amount you pay depends on:
• when you bought the property
• how much you paid for it
• whether you’re eligible for relief or an exemption
Rates for a single property
You pay sdlt at these rates if, after buying the property, it is the only residential property you own.
You will usually pay 5% on top of these rates if you own another residential property.
Rates from 1 April 2025
Property or lease premium or transfer value sdlt rate
Up to £125,000 Zero
The next £125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) 2%
The next £675,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £925,000) 5%
The next £575,000 (the portion from £925,001 to £1.5 million) 10%
The remaining amount (the portion above £1.5 million) 12%
Example
In April 2025 you buy a house for £295,000. The sdlt you owe will be calculated as follows:
• 0% on the first £125,000 = £0
• 2% on the second £125,000 = £2,500
• 5% on the final £45,000 = £2,250
• total sdlt = £4,750

A Fantastic Opportunity to Own a Spacious Three-Bedroom Semi-Detached Family Home on the Ever-Popular Stockport Road, Denton – With Expansive Garden, Detached Garage, and Huge Potential
As you approach this charming property, you’re immediately struck by its welcoming presence. Boasting a well-maintained garden frontage and a spacious driveway offering ample off-road parking for multiple vehicles, the home also benefits from a detached garage, perfect for additional storage or workshop use.
Upon entering, you’re greeted by a bright and spacious entrance hall, setting the tone for the generous proportions throughout. To the front of the home is a beautifully presented living room, complete with a large bay window that floods the space with natural light and a feature fireplace that adds character and warmth.
To the rear, you’ll find a versatile second reception room, currently used as a formal dining room, with patio door access directly into the rear garden – ideal for entertaining or family meals with a garden view. The kitchen, also overlooking the rear garden, is a practical and functional space with plenty of scope for modernisation or reconfiguration to suit your lifestyle.
Upstairs, the home continues to impress. There are two generous double bedrooms, both featuring fitted wardrobes, providing excellent storage solutions. The third bedroom is notably larger than average and would make an ideal nursery, home office, or guest room. Completing the first floor is the family bathroom, well-proportioned and ready for your personal touch.
To the rear, the property truly comes into its own. The extensive garden offers a tranquil and private space, perfect for families, avid gardeners, or those who love to entertain outdoors. With a generous lawned area, established borders, and plenty of space to play or relax, it’s a rare find in such a well-connected location.
This property offers fantastic potential for those looking to modernise, personalise, or even extend (subject to the relevant planning permissions), making it an exciting prospect for families or investors alike.
Situated on the highly desirable Stockport Road, this home benefits from excellent transport links, with easy access to Stockport, Manchester, and the M60 ring road. It is also located within the catchment area of reputable local schools, and just minutes from Crown Point Retail Park, local shops, and other essential amenities.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a spacious family home in a prime location with scope to add value – early viewing is highly recommended!

Nestled in the charming area of Beehive Green, Westhoughton, this beautifully presented true bungalow offers a delightful living experience. With two well-proportioned bedrooms and a spacious reception room, this property is perfect for a variety of buyers, whether you are a first-time homeowner, a small family, or looking to downsize.
The bungalow boasts a large rear garden, providing an ideal outdoor space for relaxation, gardening, or entertaining guests. The garden is a true highlight, offering ample room for children to play or for you to enjoy peaceful moments in the fresh air.
Inside, the property is tastefully decorated throughout, ensuring a warm and inviting atmosphere. The layout is practical and functional, making the most of the available space. The bathroom is conveniently located, serving both bedrooms and the living area.
Situated in a quiet and friendly neighbourhood, this bungalow is close to local amenities, schools, and transport links, making it a convenient choice for everyday living.
This property truly caters to a wide range of buyers, offering comfort, style, and a wonderful garden to enjoy. Do not miss the opportunity to make this lovely bungalow your new home.
To conform with government Money Laundering Regulations 2019, we are required to confirm the identity of all prospective buyers. We use the services of a third party called credas. There is a nominal charge of £50 excluding VAT for this (per person).
Lounge
This welcoming lounge is a bright and relaxing space, featuring a large front-facing window that fills the room with natural light. The room is tastefully decorated with a feature wall and a mounted television, complemented by a comfortable seating area that invites you to unwind.
Kitchen
This kitchen is efficiently designed with modern white cabinetry and dark countertops, creating a clean and contemporary aesthetic. It includes integrated appliances and a convenient window above the sink that offers a pleasant view of the garden, while providing ample workspace and storage.
Bedroom 1
Bedroom 1 is a comfortable double room that benefits from natural light through a side-facing window. The room is beautifully presented with a calming colour scheme and decorative mirror above the bed, creating a restful and inviting atmosphere.
Bedroom 2
Bedroom 2 is a well-proportioned room. It enjoys plenty of daylight from a front-facing window and is decorated in neutral tones, making it a flexible space to suit a variety of needs.
Bathroom
The bathroom is fitted with modern white tiling and includes a corner shower cubicle, a contemporary basin with storage beneath, and a toilet. A frosted window allows natural light in while maintaining privacy, completing this fresh and practical space.
Hallway
The hallway provides access to the main rooms of the property and is decorated with neutral flooring and simple white walls. It creates a welcoming entrance and a practical flow through the home.
Rear Garden
The rear garden is a generous outdoor space with a well-maintained lawn bordered by a paved patio area. It features a seating area with garden furniture and a built-in barbecue setup, perfect for entertaining or relaxing in the sunshine. The garden is enclosed by fencing, providing privacy and a safe space for children or pets.
Front Exterior
The front exterior of the property features a well-kept driveway and lawn area with mature trees providing shade and privacy. The brick facade and tiled roof give the property a classic and welcoming appearance, with a paved path leading to the front door.

about_property:
Incredible victorian family home
Sought after location in ramsbottom
Substantial accommodation boasting character throughout
Two parking spaces & impressive garden to the rear
Garden room could be utilised as A home gym or office
Beautifully presented throughout
A rare gem!
Exceptional Victorian Residence in the Heart of Ramsbottom
This magnificent Victorian home occupies a prime position in the heart of Ramsbottom village, offering a rare combination of generous proportions, elegant period features, and a high-quality contemporary finish. Immaculately presented throughout, the property retains its imposing period charm, showcasing features such as sash windows, original wood flooring, intricate coving, panelled shutters, and a striking Victorian tiled floor, all seamlessly blended with modern-day comforts.
Perfectly situated within walking distance of Ramsbottom’s vibrant shops, restaurants, and highly regarded schools, and just a short drive from excellent motorway connections, this home combines convenience with timeless character.
Accommodation is arranged over three storeys and briefly comprises:
A welcoming entrance vestibule with original Victorian tiled floor leads into a stunning hallway with original wood flooring and access to one of the cellar rooms which is used for storage. The beautifully appointed lounge features a bay window with panelled shutters, a feature fireplace and elegant period detailing. The breakfast kitchen boasts a centre island, granite and wood worktops, and a double Belfast sink, aga and fridge/freezer, flowing into the open-plan sitting room with access to the rear courtyard. A useful utility room and guest WC complete the ground floor.
The gallery landing, with its remarkable full-length arch window, leads to the master suite – a luxurious space with sash window views, a large dressing room, and a stylish four-piece en-suite. Two further bedrooms are on this level, one with en-suite facilities. The second floor houses a light-filled double bedroom with Velux windows, and en-suite bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys a good-sized plot with an enclosed front garden and a rear block-paved courtyard with access to the second cellar room. Beyond lies a large, private garden with lawn, composite decked seating areas, and a detached insulated garden room with double doors and power perfect as a home office or entertaining space. Two allocated parking spaces are provided to the rear. The property also benefits from a new boiler which provides separate heating upstairs and downstairs installed approximately 18 months ago and double glazing throughout.
A truly outstanding Victorian home, offering space, character, and modern luxury in one of Ramsbottom’s most desirable locations. Viewing is essential to appreciate the scale and quality of accommodation on offer.
Lease Term : 999 years from 11 June 1879
Rent : £10.2s.

Well Presented
Situated at the top of a quiet cul-de-sac, this well presented two-bedroom home effortlessly combines period charm with modern touches. The property benefits from driveway parking and is set in a peaceful location, making it an ideal retreat while still being conveniently located.
Upon entering the home, you are welcomed by a bright hallway that showcases the original internal doors and staircase, giving a warm and characterful first impression. Under the stairs, a practical storage cupboard houses the boiler and is plumbed for a washing machine. To the front of the house is a cosy reception room featuring a charming wrought iron fireplace and a large bay window, flooding the space with natural light.
To the rear of the property, a spacious open-plan room creates a wonderful space for modern living. This area incorporates a comfortable lounge with a wood burner, a dining area with French doors opening directly onto the garden, and a well-designed shaker-style kitchen complete with a range of fitted cupboards. It’s a perfect space for entertaining or enjoying family time, with a seamless flow between indoors and outdoors.
Upstairs, the master bedroom is generously sized and positioned at the front of the house. With dual windows and a classic picture rail, it’s a bright and elegant space. The second bedroom is also a large double, overlooking the rear garden. The bathroom is tastefully fitted with a large walk-in shower, WC, and a stylish vanity sink unit, offering a luxurious and contemporary feel.
The rear garden is a true highlight of the property. Westerly facing, it enjoys the afternoon and evening sun, with steps leading down to a well-maintained lawn and colourful flower borders. To the side, a dedicated kitchen garden allows for the growing of a variety of vegetables, lovingly tended by the current owner. An unexpected and unique feature is the original Anderson shelter situated at the side of the property — a fascinating historical touch that adds further character.
This home is full of charm, from its original features to its modern comforts, and is ideal for buyers looking for a quiet yet connected lifestyle in a welcoming and attractive setting.

about_property:
The Pump House is an impressive fusion of contemporary architecture, luxury family living, and peaceful sanctuary — all wrapped in over 7,000 sq ft of exceptional space and nestled within 4.5 acres of private grounds. Elevated above a tranquil wooded valley with landscaped gardens cascading down to the river below, this magnificent home offers unrivalled privacy, awe-inspiring design, and a standard of living that must be seen to be fully appreciated.
From the tree-lined driveway and bold architectural form to the exquisite interiors, bedroom suites, designer kitchen, multiple reception rooms, home cinema, indoor swimming pool and home gym — this is family life at its most refined. Located just moments from the amenities of Standish village, acclaimed schools, and key transport links, The Pump House is a home that delivers the very best of both worlds.
An Impressive Approach
The house is so discreetly positioned that if nobody told you it was here, you’d never know it existed. Accessed via electric gates, a tree-lined driveway opens to landscaped grounds and reveals the home in all its grandeur — perfectly framed by lush greenery and manicured lawns.
The main parking area is large enough for a whole fleet of cars, and the home welcomes you inside through a supersize bespoke solid oak door with glass surrounds, giving you the first impression of the grand proportions found throughout. A handy porch leads through to the central reception hall where you immediately notice the stylish oak and glass staircase, plus the abundance of natural light pouring in through the huge skylight window and glass wall at the rear.
The Designer Kitchen
The heart of the home is the exceptional designer kitchen and daily dining area — a breathtaking space with plentiful glass and panoramic views of the gardens and valley below. Bifold doors and three sets of French doors open onto a vast elevated composite deck, creating seamless indoor-outdoor living.
Designed and installed by the renowned Stuart Frazer, this premium Siematic kitchen features minimalist cabinetry, ambient recessed lighting, and deep Corian worktops. Every detail has been considered — from the walk-in pantry to the well-tailored storage and integral larder cabinets.
A selection of Miele appliances includes two conventional ovens with warming drawers, a microwave, steam oven, full-length fridge and dishwasher. Additional highlights include a Bora induction hob with built-in downdraft extractor, a Quooker tap with instant boiling, chilled and sparkling water, a Liebherr full-length freezer, and twin Monogram wine fridges.
At the centre is an enormous island with a contrasting dark oak breakfast bar — a stunning and practical hub for everyday family life, relaxed weekends, or entertaining. Whether it's Sunday brunch, evening drinks with friends, or summer barbecues spilling out onto the decking, this space is made to be enjoyed.
Reception Rooms
The Pump House offers four distinct reception rooms, each delivering space, comfort, and flexibility for the modern family.
The main lounge is a showstopper — around 33 sq m in size, with a vaulted double-height ceiling, six-panel bifold doors, and a stylish glass inset log burner within a towering chimney breast and gallery landing above. It’s a room made for hosting on a grand scale or unwinding in total comfort.
Next door, the media room offers another luxurious lounge experience, with floor-to-ceiling windows by day and a full cinema set-up by night — blackout blinds, projector screen, and surround sound at the touch of a button. It’s ideal as a cinema, games room or teenage retreat.
On the opposite side of the reception hall, the formal dining room enjoys an abundance of natural light, with French doors opening onto a covered al-fresco dining terrace. Perfect for dinner parties and special occasions, it blends elegance with atmosphere.
Adjoining the kitchen is a peaceful day lounge — currently a relaxed sitting room with more French doors onto the garden. It’s the perfect spot for morning coffee, a children's playroom, or a snug for reading and relaxation.
Practical Aspects
Functionality is fully considered, with a separate plant room, utility, guest WC, ample cloak storage, and a large, fully equipped home office designed for two people. A unique bonus is the first-floor laundry room — located near the bedrooms and complete with plumbing, sink, and generous storage.
Bedrooms & Bathrooms
The entire first floor benefits from vaulted ceilings and striking architectural lines. Full-height apex windows and walls of glass frame tranquil green views from every room.
Each of the five double bedrooms has its own sleek three-piece en-suite with tiled surrounds and modern fittings, all immaculately maintained. The master suite adds a walk-in dressing room and a stunning private balcony beneath an apex roof — your own peaceful morning sanctuary just steps from the bed.
Leisure Facilities
The indoor swimming pool is a standout feature, newly refurbished and upgraded with a Calorex system in 2025. Enjoy year-round heated swimming with a swim-jet system for endless laps, plus a hot tub, skylights, floor-to-ceiling windows, and bifold doors connecting you back to the neighbouring nature.
Accessed via a covered walkway from the house and also from the first floor via a spiral staircase, it’s a true private spa experience. A home gym links the gallery landing to the pool hall — equally suited to yoga or conversion into a wellness suite or sauna.
A Luxury Finish
From the moment you enter, the luxury is unmistakable — bespoke oak joinery and flooring, natural stone tiling, gallery landings, vast proportions, and world-class appliances throughout.
A Control4 smart home system allows you to manage lighting, heating, and audio from your phone, delivering comfort and convenience with every touch.
Gardens, Grounds & Garages
Set on approximately 4.5 acres with no neighbours in sight, this is more than a home — it's a countryside retreat. The gated driveway delivers complete seclusion and leads to a shale-surfaced parking area, triple garage, and carport with EV charging point.
To the rear, a full-width composite deck with glass balustrades offers a breath-taking entertaining space overlooking the valley and river. It’s piled into the ground for structural integrity and generously sized to accommodate sun loungers, dining zones, or even an outdoor kitchen if desired.
The surrounding grounds include manicured lawns, landscaped borders, rockeries, and mature trees. To one side, Japanese-inspired tiered lawns step down to a large wildlife pond, offering a magical connection to the river and nature. A children’s treehouse completes the picture — making this a truly special home for every generation.
Location
Despite its extraordinary privacy, The Pump House is just moments from the bustling and sought-after village of Standish — home to a wide selection of independent shops, cafes, restaurants, gyms, supermarkets, and top-rated schools.
The M6 motorway is a short drive away, placing Manchester, Preston, and the wider North West within easy commuting distance. This rare combination of peace, privacy, and connectivity makes the location just as impressive as the home itself.
Specific Details
Council Tax Band: H
Tenure: Freehold
Heating: Gas boiler and tank with water-based underfloor heating throughout
Drainage: Private septic tank
Utilities: Mains gas, electricity, and water
Security: Full alarm system with CCTV
Smart Home: Control4 automation system

The large double bedroom comfortably

about_property:
Beautifully renovated period home
Bowdon conservation area
Secure gated entrance
Private and convenient location
Stunning interior
Superb principal suite
Private rear garden
EPC Rating = C
One of the finest examples of a beautifully renovated period property in the Bowdon conservation area.
Description
Nestled in the picturesque Bowdon conservation area, the Red House is a shining example of an exceptionally well crafted and fully renovated six-bedroom detached period residence.
Dating back to 1903 and retaining a wealth of period features, the vendors have meticulously blended the elegance of this imposing Edwardian home with an exacting classical finish, lavishing attention to detail throughout.
The solid oak front door, adorned with original stained and leaded windows, opens into the timelessly elegant wood panelled and tiled entrance hall, reminiscent of a bygone era. The ground floor comprises generously sized rooms: A large open plan living dining kitchen, formal living room, dining room, executive study and utility boot room. Particular mention must be made of the open plan kitchen, diner which extends to over 500 sq ft. It is flooded with natural light and benefits from opening out onto a large sun terrace overlooking the garden below.
The kitchen, with underfloor heating includes a variety of integrated appliances by Fisher Paykel and Neff, including a double oven with warming drawer, wine fridge, dishwasher and both gas and induction hobs, all housed in bespoke wall drawer and base units, complemented by quartz stone work surfaces. A WC and cloakroom storage complete the ground floor.
Two staircases complete with brass hand rails provide access to the lower ground floor where there is a large family cinema room complete with stylish bar area, a games room, gymnasium, small utility area and WC. The vendors have cleverly retained and exposed some of the original brickwork in the hallway as a feature and all rooms have their own access to the terrace and gardens beyond.
To the first floor, the principal suite is generously sized, offering stylish fitted wardrobes housed in a separate dressing area, and a sizeable en-suite with freestanding tub, shower and marble topped sink unit. The bedroom has the benefit of a lovely sit on balcony overlooking the gardens below. The first floor is completed by a further three bedrooms all of which are doubles, serviced by a large family bathroom. A further two double bedrooms, family bathroom and large open seating area can be found to the second floor. A versatile space which could be easily adapted for live in relatives.
Additional features include Sonos sound system, commercial Wi-Fi and Strongbox security system. What is evident whilst meandering through this beautiful family home is the use of quality materials, and seamless interior design, bringing a calming feel and cohesive flow throughout.
Externally, electric gates provide access to a substantial gravel forecourt set well back from the road and offering parking for numerous vehicles, in addition there is a single garage with an electric car charging point.
The rear gardens have been cleverly designed to offer a good mixture of grass laid to lawn, raised sun deck and a large covered dining and seating area complete with electrics and lighting, perfect for outdoor entertaining on summer evenings. Beautifully stocked borders and hedging to the perimeters, ensure a high degree of privacy.
Location
Nestled in a prestigious conservation area, this residence enjoys a private setting yet remains conveniently close to local amenities being easily walkable to the nearest villages.
The property is superbly placed for access to the many amenities of fashionable Hale village and the town of Altrincham with their impressive range of restaurants, bistros and bars, specialist shops, cinema, artisan markets and supermarkets. The property is well positioned, walking distance to both Altrincham and Hale centres.
The area offers Golf courses, leisure clubs and facilities for outdoor pursuits, the National Trust’s Dunham Massey Hall and park are close by and the Bollin valley and Cheshire countryside are on the doorstep.
Access to the M56, M60 and M6 offer easy commuter links to the North West’s principal commercial centres and Manchester Airport. Altrincham Metro Link provides quick and easy access to the City centre.
The educational establishments available locally are considered among the best in the Manchester area, with Altrincham Grammar, Loreto, St Ambrose, as well as outstanding preparatory and state junior schools such as Bowdon Church. There are local bus stops to Manchester Grammar, Manchester High, Withington and many of the other private schools in the area.
Square Footage: 4,767 sq ft
Additional Info
Council Tax Band G

Nestled in the highly desirable Caldbeck Drive area of Farnworth, Bolton. This three-bedroom semi-detached home offers a perfect combination of style, space, and convenience. Ready for you to move straight in, it's ideal for families or professionals seeking a modern and practical living space.
Upon entering, you'll be greeted by a bright and welcoming entrance hall. The main reception room is generously sized, providing a perfect spot for relaxing or entertaining. The property also features a second reception room, which can be adapted to suit your needs, whether you envision it as a formal dining room, a children's playroom, or a dedicated home office.
The heart of the home is the fitted kitchen, which boasts modern integrated appliances, ample storage, and plenty of counter space. A separate utility room keeps laundry and other household tasks discreetly tucked away, while a convenient downstairs W.C. Adds to the practicality of the ground floor.
Upstairs, you'll find three well-proportioned bedrooms, each offering a comfortable and peaceful retreat. These are served by a modern family bathroom with seperate wc, complete with contemporary fixtures and fittings.
Outdoor Space and Abundant Parking
The appeal of this home extends to its outdoor areas. The well-maintained front and rear gardens provide a great space for relaxation, gardening, or outdoor entertaining. One of the most valuable features of this property is the large driveway and garage, which together provide secure off-road parking for four or more vehicles—a rare find in this area.
Located close to excellent local amenities, reputable schools, and strong transport links, this home is perfectly positioned for modern life. It's a fantastic opportunity to secure a stylish and functional property in one of Bolton's most sought-after neighbourhoods.
Early viewing is highly recommended. Contact us today to arrange your visit and experience all that this home has to offer.

A fabulous, ready-to-move-into, stylish apartment located on the first floor of the original, iconic Birch Hill Clocktower building, boasting fantastic far-reaching, south-facing views. This beautiful home benefits from new energy-efficient storage heaters, a newly installed media wall, and luxury vinyl tile (lvt) flooring, adding to its modern appeal.
Perfectly positioned for convenient access to local amenities, including shops, transport links to neighbouring towns and villages, and a variety of bars, restaurants, and supermarkets. Mainline train stations at Smithy Bridge and Littleborough provide direct routes to Leeds and Manchester, while the stunning Hollingworth Lake and Watergrove Reservoir are just a short drive away.
Light and bright throughout, the apartment is beautifully presented with sash windows and, in places, impressive floor-to-ceiling windows. The accommodation briefly comprises: A welcoming entrance hall with a generous storage room, a large lounge and dining area with open-plan kitchen, two double bedrooms with quality fitted wardrobes, an en-suite shower room to the master, and a further modern bathroom.
This apartment also includes two allocated private parking spaces (the only plot in the development to have two), plus additional visitor parking. Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the style, setting, and unique features this home offers.
Communal Entrance
Entry code system. With a well maintained communal hallway and staircase.
Entrance Hall
 (1.17 x 7.64 (3'10" x 25'0"))
Upon entering the apartment, you are welcomed into a neutrally decorated entrance hall featuring newly fitted lvt flooring. A generous storage cupboard provides ample space for coats, shoes, and more. Internal doors lead to all accommodation, while a wall-mounted intercom phone offers convenient access control for the main entrance.
Open Plan Lounge, Dining Area & Kitchen
 (7.74 x 6.83 (25'4" x 22'4"))
This spacious living and dining room is filled with natural light, thanks to an array of windows that create a bright and airy atmosphere while offering stunning views. Newly laid lvt flooring runs throughout, adding a sleek and modern touch. A recently installed media wall with integrated storage provides both style and functionality. The generous dining area easily accommodates a large family dining table and is beautifully enhanced by a striking floor-to-ceiling window.
Kitchen
Open to the living area, this modern, good-quality kitchen features a stylish range of wall and base units, complemented by integrated appliances including a fridge freezer, oven, electric hob with extractor hood, and a washing machine. The open-plan design creates a seamless flow, ideal for both everyday living and entertaining.
Bedroom 1
 (4.02 x 4.61 (13'2" x 15'1"))
A generously sized double bedroom offering ample space for additional furniture, enhanced by high-quality fitted wardrobes with integrated storage solutions. Two front-facing sash windows showcase beautiful views, and a door leads directly to the en-suite for added convenience.
En-Suite Shower Room
 (1.17 x 2.56 (3'10" x 8'4"))
A modern three-piece suite featuring a low-level WC, pedestal wash hand basin, and a shower enclosure, complemented by a heated towel rail for added comfort.
Bedroom 2
 (4.02 x 3.63 (13'2" x 11'10"))
Another spacious double bedroom benefiting from fitted wardrobes and south-facing windows that flood the room with natural light while offering a fabulous outlook.
Bathroom
 (2.27 x 1.86 (7'5" x 6'1"))
A modern three-piece suite comprising a low-level WC, pedestal wash hand basin, and a bath with shower over. The space is finished with stylish tiling and a heated towel rail for added comfort.

The gated grounds provide two allocated private parking spaces, with additional visitor parking available for convenience.
