Completed in approximately 2017, the property offers a thoughtfully designed floorplan, perfect for modern family living. Stylishly and carefully presented by the current owners, this home is move-in ready, combining contemporary touches with a welcoming feel throughout.
Upon entering, you're greeted by a bright entrance hallway with lvt flooring that flows seamlessly into the modern kitchen, complete with a smart range of neutral wall and base units. The kitchen boasts integrated Neff appliances, including a double oven, gas hob with extractor, dishwasher, and washing machine. Granite worktops, inset lighting, and French doors leading out to the garden create a practical and attractive space ideal for cooking and entertaining. The kitchen opens into a generous dining area, with access to a handy ground floor WC, while the spacious lounge is flooded with natural light thanks to three large windows, providing a perfect spot to relax. Upstairs, the home features three well-proportioned bedrooms, including a master suite with en-suite shower room. about_property:
Northern Quarter location
Balcony
Exceptionally unique home
Abundance of character
Split level apartment
EWS1 Form completed March 2025, with A2 rating!
EPC Rating = D
Exceptionally unique, an apartment with an abundance of character in the popular Smithfield's Buildings, ideally located in Manchester's Northern Quarter!
Description
In the heart of the Northern Quarter, where Manchester’s creative spirit comes alive, lies a home that’s as full of personality as the neighbourhood itself.
Savills is proud to present this exceptional two bedroom, split level apartment within the renowned Smithfield Buildings, a landmark steeped in history and brimming with character.
From the moment you step inside, the space opens into an impressive open plan living, dining, and kitchen area. Soaring ceilings, exposed brickwork, and an abundance of natural light set the stage for both stylish entertaining and quiet relaxation. The kitchen is a contemporary design, with integrated appliances blending seamlessly into the industrial charm. Just off the lounge, a private terrace provides a peaceful spot to enjoy your morning coffee or evening glass of wine.
Tucked to the right upon entry of the lower level is a comfortable double bedroom set a top staircase to the mezzanine level. This section offers clever built in storage and could be utilised as a second bedroom, or for another purpose as imagined.
To the centre of the apartment are a separate set of stairs, in which you’ll discover a versatile study or home office, perfect for remote working or creative projects. Continue upwards from here and you'll find the primary bedroom. Light pours in through the skylight above, while the private en suite ensures a touch of everyday luxury.
Smithfield Building is positioned right at the heart of Manchester's famous Northern Quarter. Formerly home to Affleck and Brown, the development was transformed into stunning loft apartments with commercial space underneath in the mid-late nineties.
Offering a rare blend of heritage and heart, this home is every bit as unique as its iconic location.
EWS1 Form and cover letter completed March 2025 available with A2 rating!
General disclaimers: We are advised there are works to the building due relating to the roof. Further information can be requested via the local office. We are also further advised a nearby car park is due to be converted into apartments, any further information requested should be sought from the local planning authority.
Location
Smithfield buildings is in an excellent Northern Quarter location close to all Manchester has to offer.
Victoria tram and train links (0.4m), Manchester Piccadilly (0.5m) and the Arndale shopping centre (0.3m) are all within easy reach.
Deansgate is also situated nearby (0.7m) with a host of restaurants, bars and attractions perfect to enjoy city centre living.
You are also not far from sport and entertainment options. Manchester's famous football stadiums Old Trafford (home to Manchester United) and the Etihad (home to Manchester City) are 4.1m and 1.7m away respectively.
For cultural activities locally, residents are situated near to Manchester's famous Northern Quarter (0.1m) which offers a variety of leisure and nightlife activities.
Please note all distances quoted are approximate.
Square Footage: 1,417 sq ft
Leasehold with approximately 970 years remaining.
Additional Info
We are advised by the vendor that:
The ground rent is fixed and is not reviewed/escalated.
The building insurance is included within the service charge figure quoted.

Welcome to this beautifully presented two-bedroom semi-detached property, perfectly situated on the ever-popular St. Anne’s Road in Denton. Boasting excellent curb appeal with a sleek, modern exterior, this home offers contemporary living in a fantastic location – ideal for first-time buyers, young families, or those looking to upsize.
As you step inside, you’re greeted by a bright and welcoming entrance hallway that leads into a spacious living room, complete with a stylish feature media wall – the perfect spot for relaxing or entertaining guests.
To the rear of the property, you’ll find a modern open-plan kitchen and dining area designed with both style and functionality in mind. The kitchen includes a hidden utility space, handy downstairs WC, and French doors that open out onto a generous rear garden – ideal for al fresco dining, entertaining, or simply enjoying the outdoors.
Upstairs, the property offers two well-proportioned double bedrooms. The main bedroom, located at the front of the house, features sleek spotlights that add a contemporary touch. The second double bedroom, overlooking the rear garden, is perfect for guests, children, or a home office setup. The floor is completed by a modern family bathroom with stylish fittings and finishes.
Externally, the standout feature of the rear garden is the charming summer house, currently used as a bar and entertainment area by the current owners – providing fantastic extra space for relaxing or hosting.
Located in a sought-after residential area, this home is ideally placed for excellent local transport links, well-regarded schools, local amenities, and is just a short distance from Crown Point North Retail Park, offering a variety of shops and eateries.
This is a home that truly has it all – style, space, and location. Early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment!

No Chain – Newly Decorated And Ready To Move Into In The Heart Of Walkden
This beautifully presented and recently redecorated three-bedroom property offers bright, airy living spaces and a well-designed layout, making it perfect for families, first-time buyers, or those seeking a comfortable downsize. Situated just off the A6 and right in the heart of Walkden, the home enjoys an exceptional location – only 2 minutes’ walk (0.3 miles) from Walkden train station and 3 minutes’ walk (0.5 miles) from Ellesmere Shopping Centre – making it highly sought-after and in strong demand.
A welcoming hallway leads into the attractive and stylish lounge, where a beautiful bay window at the front looks over the neat, small front garden and floods the room with natural light. Light oak wooden flooring flows seamlessly throughout the ground floor, and a gas fireplace creates a cosy focal point. An internal door opens into the generous kitchen/diner at the rear, fitted with light brown cupboards, black marble-effect countertops, an electric oven and grill, gas hob, and cooker hood. There is space for freestanding appliances, including a fridge-freezer and washing machine. The breakfast bar and dining area provide ample room for family meals, and patio doors open to a very private rear garden.
Upstairs, the landing leads to two spacious double bedrooms and a versatile box room, ideal for a single bed, home office, or dressing room. The family bathroom is fully tiled in cream from floor to ceiling for easy maintenance and features both a separate bath and a shower cubicle.
Outside, the property benefits from a newly laid large patio area, creating the perfect setting for entertaining, and a very private garden with ample space for outdoor fun with family and friends. The front garden adds further curb appeal.
With its fresh décor, move-in-ready finish, and unbeatable location close to transport, shops, and schools, this property is an opportunity not to be missed. Early viewing is highly recommended.

Offering over 1,200 square feet of accommodation, plus useful eaves storage, this well-presented semi-detached home offers versatile family-sized accommodation in an enviable position.
Personal inspection will reveal an entrance hall with useful under-stairs storage and a large lounge with double doors leading out to the rear garden. The dining room is ideal for more formal gatherings, with the kitchen/breakfast room perfect for casual dining. Ideally located for easy access to local amenities and neighbouring villages including Delph, Dobcross and Uppermill, with its local shops, cafés, pubs and recreational facilities including Uppermill park, museum and canal boats tours, this would prove an ideal choice.

On entering the apartment itself you head right into the living/dining room with expansive windows flooding the room with natural light, and the space is open to a number of configurations. Separate to the reception space is the kitchen, complete with base and eye level storage units, fitted fridge/freezer, oven, and an abundance of work surface space.
Heading on round from the reception area is the family bathroom, tiled throughout with a ceiling level glass tiled section providing natural light despite being internal. The bathroom comes with sink, WC and bath with over shower.
To the left of the entrance hall is the bedroom section of the apartment. The second bedroom is a good size double, with plenty of space for both a bed and storage.
Completing the apartment is the incredible main bedroom, with bay window, ideal for seating or dressing area, alcoves for wardrobes and an en-suite shower room.
Sure to generate plenty of interest, make sure to get in touch to avoid missing out

Traditional mid-terraced home
Well presented throughout
Three bedrooms + useful loft area

A wonderfully spacious mid-terraced home set in a highly convenient position in popular Mossley. Benefitting from three bedrooms and a loft area, viewing comes highly recommended. EPC: Tbc.
Offering an impressive 860 square feet on accommodation, plus a large, useful loft area, this deceptive mid-terraced home should appeal to a variety of purchasers.
Personal inspection will reveal an entrance vestibule which leads swiftly into a bright & spacious lounge and a modern kitchen fitted with a range of matching units and integrated appliances including a gas hob, oven & grill and dishwasher.
To the first floor viewers will find three good-sized bedrooms and a luxury three-piece shower room comprising of a low-level WC, hand wash basin and walk-in shower unit with rainfall shower.
Additionally, there is a fantastic loft area accessed via a drop-down ladder. Benefitting from central heating and a 'Velux' window, this offers a variety of additional uses, including play area, home office of craft area.
Warmed by a gas central heating system with combination boiler, the economy and comfort are enhanced further by uPVC double glazed windows. Please note, the lounge has an electric radiator in lieu of central heating.
Externally at the rear there is an enclosed cottage garden with charming garden room, perfect for enjoying summer evenings. Beyond the garden there is a vehicular right of away and a gravel garden and two parking spaces used by the current owner.
Please note - the gravel garden and two parking spaces do not appear on the deeds to property - solicitors to confirm further details.
King Street can be located off Station Road and in turn Micklehurst Road in the popular and sought after Bottom Mossley district of Tameside, ideal for easy and convenient access to excellent local amenities and transport links including Mossley station, which is just a short walk away.
Conveniently placed for access to Saddleworth, there are numerous attractions and villages including Greenfield, with its wonderful walks around Dovestone Reservoir and the Peak District National Park and Uppermill, with canal boats tours and a fantastic array of shops, cafés and public houses.
There are also a good range of local primary schools and the property is in the catchment area for Mossley Hollins High School, making this an ideal choice.

Personal inspection of this modern end-townhouse will reveal an entrance hall with stairs to the first floor and a generously sized guest WC just off, a doorway leads to a modern, open plan lounge/dining/kitchen area.
The kitchen itself is fitted with a range of modern matching units and integrated appliances including an electric hob, oven/grill, slimline dishwasher, fridge-freezer and washing machine. Double doors lead out to the rear garden.

Location
The development enjoys a prime position in a desirable residential area. There are a variety of everyday amenities close by, including supermarkets, cafes, and restaurants. For leisure, nearby green spaces such as Doffcocker Lodge Nature Reserve and Moss Bank Park offer scenic walking trails, play areas, and wildlife.
Families will appreciate the proximity to highly regarded schools, including both primary and secondary options within easy reach, such as St Thomas's CE Primary School and Bolton School, known for its strong academic reputation.
Excellent transport connections make commuting straightforward. The property is within easy reach of Bolton town centre, with its shopping, dining, and cultural attractions, while road links to the M61 and A666 provide swift access to Manchester, Preston, and beyond. Public transport options include nearby bus routes and rail services from Bolton Station, connecting to Manchester in around 20 minutes.

about_property:
Freehold - Council Tax Band E
Character property built around 1836
High ceilings throughout
Spacious lounge with fireplace & bay window
Separate dining room
Two bathrooms
Attic & basement
Stunning outdoor area with decked balcony
Close to amenities
Viewing advised
Spacious and well-presented detached home offering four bedrooms with potential for a fifth in the attic, generous parking, and double glazing throughout. Situated in a desirable Stalybridge location close to schools, parks, local amenities, and exce
Built around 1836, this remarkable four-bedroom detached home combines historical grandeur with modern comfort, offering generous proportions, elegant period features, and stunning panoramic views.
From its elevated position, the property commands an impressive presence, with its stone facade, original detailing, and mature gardens behind wrought iron railings. Off-road parking is plentiful, ensuring convenience alongside kerb appeal.
Step inside through a striking stained-glass doorway and into a large, welcoming hallway, where the scale and character of the home are immediately apparent. Two substantial reception rooms, each adorned with high ceilings, ornate cornicing, large bay windows, and polished wooden floors, provide both formal and informal living options. The main lounge features a beautiful fireplace, while the dining room offers ample space for entertaining.
The country-style kitchen is well-appointed with wooden worktops, integrated appliances, and a charming breakfast bar, complemented by a useful utility room. Downstairs, a unique cellar bar creates a truly distinctive leisure space - perfect for hosting friends or enjoying a cosy evening in.
Upstairs, there are four spacious double bedrooms, each with its own character. The principal bedroom boasts a period fireplace and plenty of natural light. A luxurious family bathroom offers both a walk-in shower and a separate bath, while a second bathroom retains a classic roll-top tub for added indulgence.
The second floor reveals a vast games room - currently housing a full-sized snooker table - with the potential to be converted into a fifth bedroom, studio, or office.
Situated within easy reach of excellent local schools, transport links to Manchester, Leeds, and beyond, scenic walking trails, parks, and a range of local shops, cafes, and restaurants, this is a rare opportunity to acquire a home that blends heritage, space, and lifestyle flexibility in one outstanding package.

about_property:
Four-Bedroom Semi-Detached Stone Farmhouse
Idyllic Rural Setting Close To Edgworth
Glass-Roofed Conservatory With Panoramic Views
Award-Winning Lounge With Double-Sided Fireplace
Character Dining Room With Exposed Oak Beams
Contemporary Kitchen With Breakfast Bar Seating
Main Bedroom With En-Suite Shower Room
Luxury Family Bathroom With Rainfall Shower
Landscaped Gardens With Multiple Seating Areas
Integral Double Garage And Ample Driveway Parking For 6
Spacious 4-Bedroom Stone Farmhouse In A Idyllic Rural Edgworth Setting
Birches Farm Cottage – A Most Unique Setting
Tucked just off Bury Road, close to the picturesque village of Edgworth, Birches Farm Cottage is a honey-hued semi-detached stone farmhouse where timeless character meets modern living. Framed by open countryside, its glass-roofed conservatory captures sweeping views across rolling fields, while the gardens – a blend of manicured lawns, vibrant borders, and stone pathways – offer peaceful corners to pause and take in the surroundings.
The approach sets the scene. A gentle climb along a farm track, edged with open green fields and drystone walls, draws you deeper into rural life. Passing through the working farmyard, the air carries the scent of hay and the occasional sound of livestock, a reminder of the home’s agricultural setting. Beyond the old stone gateposts and cattle grid, the paved driveway and integral double garage mark your arrival at this welcoming home.
Where Character Meets Comfort
Step inside the covered portico entrance into a bright, contemporary hallway, complete with a handy cloakroom cupboard and direct access to the garage. The warmth of the timber front door, the herringbone flooring, and the overall light and airy feel immediately set the tone – this is a home that respects its heritage while embracing a stylish, modern finish.
A Lounge for All Seasons
To the left lies the award-winning, magazine-featured lounge – a showpiece of style and comfort. A rustic double-sided stone fireplace with wood-burning stove anchors one wall, adding warmth and character. Soft recessed lighting casts a gentle glow over white walls, oak doors, and the stone-flagged floor that flows throughout the ground floor. Generous picture windows frame the surrounding greenery, creating a connection with the outdoors, while the spacious layout offers the flexibility for cosy evenings or larger gatherings. Integrated ceiling speakers in both the lounge and the kitchen enhance everyday living and entertaining, offering seamless, high-quality audio throughout the social heart of the home
Dining with a Sense of Occasion
The dining room is full of character, with flagstone flooring under centuries-old oak beams. The double-sided fireplace forms a striking focal point, perfect for lingering over candlelit dinners. A wide picture window overlooks the garden, bringing the changing seasons into every mealtime. Above, the double-height section reveals the oak staircase, complete with cleverly integrated storage beneath, linking the two floors with light and openness.
The Heart of the Home – Kitchen & Conservatory
The kitchen/breakfast room is designed to be both functional and inviting. Soft grey cabinetry with brushed brass handles pairs with warm wood worktops, while a range-style cooker sits beneath a concealed extractor, framed by rustic herringbone tiling. Integrated appliances include an oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, wine cooler, and a farmhouse-style sink perfectly placed beneath a window to take in the countryside views.
A breakfast bar seating four creates the ideal spot for casual dining, morning coffee, or catching up with friends. From here, a door opens to the conservatory – a light-filled space with glass walls and a vaulted roof that blurs the boundary between indoors and out. In summer, it’s bathed in sunshine with garden scents drifting in; in winter, the underfloor heating beneath the tiled floor keeps it warm and inviting, making it a peaceful place to watch frost settle over the fields. French doors lead directly onto the terrace.
A useful downstairs WC is located off the kitchen lobby.
The garage, also accommodates the washing machine and serves as a practical laundry area, keeping day-to-day chores neatly out of sight.
Upstairs – Four Bedrooms and Countryside Calm
The oak staircase leads to a vaulted landing filled with light from Velux windows, creating an airy welcome to the upper floor.
Bedroom One –
 The main bedroom enjoys far-reaching views from four windows, fitted wardrobes, and a feature oak-slat wall detail. The en-suite includes a double shower with glazed screen, vanity sink with mirror, WC, and marble-effect tiling to walls and floor.
Bedroom Two –
 A spacious double with a front-facing outlook, blue panelled feature wall, and built-in wardrobes.
Bedroom Three –
 Overlooking the side garden, decorated in soft pink to half height with a charming exposed beam behind the bed.
Bedroom Four –
 Currently a nursery, with a sage-painted feature wall and a view over the front.
A Bathroom Designed for Comfort and Style
The family bathroom combines practicality with a sense of luxury. Large marble-effect tiles flow from floor to ceiling, reflecting light beautifully. A wall-hung toilet, contemporary vanity with warm wood countertop, and countertop basin with chrome mixer tap set the scene. An illuminated circular mirror adds soft ambience, complemented by recessed shelving. The bath, with rainfall shower over, invites both quick refreshes and long, indulgent soaks. A chrome heated towel rail and thoughtful design touches complete the space.
Gardens and Outlook
The gardens are a perfect marriage of open space, mature planting, and uninterrupted views. Lawns sweep around the property, bordered by established shrubs, seasonal flowers, and well-tended beds. A paved terrace alongside the conservatory offers a sunny spot for morning coffee or evening drinks, while stone pathways link different seating areas.
A raised planting bed adds colour and structure, and a firepit area provides a cosy place to gather. Climbing plants soften timber and stone boundaries, while hedges offer privacy without interrupting the expansive views. From every vantage point, the rolling hills stretch into the distance – vibrant in summer, golden in autumn, and softly frosted in winter.
In the Village
Edgworth offers a thriving community with everyday essentials and a welcoming atmosphere. Within walking distance, you’ll find a post office, village shop, butcher, two cafes, a hairdresser, and a beautician. The village also boasts a cricket club, 4G football pitches, and the much-loved Holden’s & Co ice cream shop.
For dining, try the new gastropub at The Spread Eagle or the traditional charm of The White Horse and The Black Bull. Nearby Ramsbottom offers an even wider choice of restaurants and bars, just 10 minutes away.
Edgworth Primary School is rated ‘Good’ by Ofsted, with secondary options at Turton School and Canon Slade, both also rated ‘Good’. Buses also run to Bury Grammar and Bolton independent schools.
For outdoor pursuits, the scenic Wayoh and Entwistle reservoirs are close by, along with the village park. Commuters benefit from excellent road links, with the M65 just 15 minutes away, and Bolton or Bury reachable in around 20 minutes.
Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage.
At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed.
Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee or benefit for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

about_property:
This investment property, X1 Trafford Waters, offers an exceptional opportunity for investors. This iconic collection of one- and two-bedroom apartments combines stylish, comfortable living with solid investment potential. This attractive two-bedroom end-of-terraced property enjoys a prime position in the popular Gee Cross area of Hyde. Offering a welcoming and practical layout, the home blends modern finishes with homely charm, making it an ideal purchase for first-time buyers or those looking to downsize. Offered for sale with no vendor chain.
The property was modernised in 2023 and had the following upgrades - Full re-wire, fully re-plastered, New gas Central Heating boiler, New Kitchen, utility and bathroom.
Upon entering, you are greeted by a light-filled reception room that flows seamlessly into the modern fitted kitchen, complete with a range of wall and base units and stylish work surfaces. A separate dining room provides the perfect setting for family meals or entertaining guests, while the adjoining utility room offers additional storage and laundry space. A conveniently located ground-floor WC adds to the home’s practicality.
Upstairs, there are two generous double bedrooms, both tastefully decorated, alongside a sleek modern fitted bathroom with contemporary fixtures and fittings.
Externally, the property boasts a terrace garden to the front, a low-maintenance rear courtyard garden, and an additional rear garden, laid with artificial lawn, providing outdoor space for relaxation, play, or gardening enthusiasts.
Fully double-glazed and gas central heated, this home is situated within easy reach of local amenities, well-regarded schools, and excellent transport networks — making commuting and everyday life a breeze.

The accommodation of this spacious end of terrace property comprises Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, 3 Bedrooms and a Family Bathroom. Externally the property is garden fronted and also benefits from a large garden to the rear aspect (some of which is not included in the deeds for the property). Our View
This property has been a happy family home for the current owners for over 60 years. During that time they have loved and cared for the property but its now the right time for a new family to take over and make it into a modern home for the next generation.
It is spacious and benefits from a garden to the rear meaning it is suitable for first time buyers either with or planning a family. It is in need of an element of modernisation but we believe it has been priced to sell and is being offered with no vendor chain attached.
Location
Denton is a Town in Greater Manchester to the East of the City centre.
Situated on the junction of the M60/M67 it is ideally located for those wishing to commute.
The Town itself has great amenities with Crown Point North shopping centre, Morrisons, Sainsbury and Lidl supermarkets, major banks, post office, library and swimming pool.
The town centre is also on the cross roads of the A57 providing access to many major bus routes for Hyde, Ashton-under-Lyne, Stockport and Manchester.
Denton also provides access to some of the best schools in Tameside both at a junior and senior school level. Other local amenities include a golf club, several cricket and football clubs as well as various churches, Conservative, Liberal and Labour clubs.

about_property:
Attractive Family Home with Spacious Interiors, Gardens, and Garage in a Convenient Location
Full Description
Tenure: Freehold
Occupying a desirable corner plot, this well-presented three-bedroom home is located in a popular residential part of Wythenshawe, offering excellent access to local amenities, reputable schools, Wythenshawe Hospital, and superb transport connections. Motorway links, the airport, and Manchester city centre are all within easy reach, making it a highly convenient choice for commuters and families alike.
Stepping inside, you are welcomed into a spacious family living room filled with natural light, enhanced by French doors opening directly onto the rear garden. This bright and inviting space is ideal for both everyday living and entertaining. The adjoining breakfast kitchen features a modern range of wall and base units, integrated oven with electric hob, space for a dishwasher, and ample room for additional appliances. There is also space for a dining table, creating a sociable area for mealtimes, with laminate flooring providing a sleek, practical finish.
Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms, two of which are generous doubles, alongside a stylish and contemporary family bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys both front and rear gardens. The front offers a driveway with parking for multiple vehicles, while the rear garden provides a mix of lawn and a wooden decked area—perfect for outdoor dining and summer gatherings. The property also benefits from a good-sized garage, offering excellent storage space.
This home combines a convenient location with versatile living space, making it an excellent choice for families or professionals seeking a well-connected yet comfortable place to live.
Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the size and potential of this property.

Paying this fee ensures that the seller takes their property off the market and reserves it exclusively for you, therefore eliminating the risk of gazumping and aborted costs.

Pattinson Auction are referred to below as The Auctioneer. This auction lot is being sold under either conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer. The property is available to view strictly by appointment only via any Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between any marketing agent and The Auctioneer so that all matters can be dealt with effectively. The property is being sold via a transparent online auction. To submit a bid on any property marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders buyers must adhere to a verification of identity process in line with Anti Money Laundering procedures. Bids can be submitted at any time and from anywhere. Our verification process is in place to ensure aml procedures are carried out in accordance with the law
Auctioneers Additional Comments
The advertised price is commonly referred to as a Starting Bid or Guide Price and is accompanied by a Reserve Price. The Reserve Price is confidential to the seller and the auctioneer and will typically be within a range above or below 10% of the Guide Price, Starting Bid. These prices are subject to change. An auction can be closed at any time with the auctioneer permitting for the property (the lot) to be sold prior to the end of the auction. A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers obligations and sellers commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.
Auctioneers Additional Comments
In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit equivalent to 5% of the purchase price. The deposit will form part of the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of 7,200 inc VAT) is also payable upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price, and consideration should be given by the purchaser to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with the overall purchase costs. Both the Marketing Agent and the Auctioneer may consider it necessary or beneficial to pass customer details to third-party service suppliers, from whom a referral fee may be received. There is no requirement or obligation to use any recommended suppliers or services.

about_property:
Earn instant income
Studio apartment
Cash buyers only
Fully furnished
Excellent location
Great transport links
Shops, bars and amenities nearby
Close to university
The Pack Horse, Nelson Square, Bradshawgate, Bolton, Bl1 1Aq
Earn instant income on this already tenanted student investment opportunity - cash buyers only! Just 10 minutes walk to The University of Bolton! Excellent investment opportunity in hugely popular student development.
This stunning ensuite student room apartment is fully furnished and includes a bed, en-suite with shower and access to a communal kitchen kitchen. It's easy to see why The Pack Horse has proven popular with Bolton's influx of students, offering a fantastic range of on-site facilities including a fully-equipped gym and a modern common room with pool tables, pinball machines, video games and even a large projector screen for movie nights, making it incredibly easy for residents to relax, unwind and socialise. Residents also benefit from secure bicycle storage, CCTV in the communal areas, a concierge reception service and laundry facilities.
The Pack Horse is a beautiful period building that was once the prestigious Pack Horse Hotel, which was transformed in 2012 to create the ultimate boutique student living experience. Located on Bradshawgate, only a 10 minute walk away from the University of Bolton, The Pack Horse has everything that Bolton has to offer on its doorstep! Bradshawgate is home to most of Bolton's bars and restaurants, alongside the recently renovated Market Place shopping centre and the newly opened Vaults which contains numerous restaurants and high street shops. It's no surprise that The Pack Horse is one of the most sought after developments in Bolton!
The University of Bolton has around 14,000 students, with over 8,000 living and travelling from areas outside the North West region. Unlike the close neighbours of Liverpool and Manchester, virtually no Purpose-Built Student Accommodation exists in the immediate area, with a housing problem lagging some way behind the ambitious ongoing development plans of the University of Bolton. Now is the perfect time to invest in Bolton's student accommodation!
Financial Breakdown
Gross Rent: £5,060.00
Net income: £1,307.00
Gross yield: 31.63%
Net yield: 8.17%
Please contact agent for full financial breakdown.

Summary
auction sale 09 September 2025 - Leasehold eleventh and twelfth floor flat
description
Leasehold eleventh and twelfth floor flat
Location:
The property is located on Spindletree Avenue. Shopping amenities can be found locally within Manchester City Centre. Public transport links are available at Moston Train Station to the south east along with a network of local bus services serving the surrounding areas. The property is served by road links including the A6104 and M60 both lying to the north. Recreational pursuits can be found at Alkrington Woods Nature Reserve to the north west.
Accommodation:
Three bedrooms, reception room, kitchen, bathroom/wc
EPC Rating: C
Council Tax Band: B
Lease:
Held on a lease for a term of 125 years (less 10 days) from 17/03/2005.
To view:
Strictly by arrangement with the auctioneers.
Important Notice:
For each Lot, a contract documentation fee of £1,500 (inclusive of VAT) is payable to Barnard Marcus Auctions by the buyer. The seller may charge additional fees payable upon completion. If applicable, such fees are detailed within the Special Conditions of Sale. Buyers are deemed to bid in full knowledge of this.
The Guide Price quoted must not be relied upon by prospective purchasers as a valuation or assessment of value of the property. It is intended to provide purchasers with an indication of the region at which the reserve may be set at the time of going to press. The guide price may be subject to variation and interested parties are advised to make regular checks for variations and should be aware that the reserve price may be either below or above the quoted guide price.
Prospective purchasers should also be aware that the eventual sale price may be above or below the guide level dependent upon competition, and should therefore not presume the guide to be indicative of the final expected sale price or the price the property is available at.
When setting the guide price, the auctioneers have given consideration to the seller’s instructions in respect of their indicated reserve price at the time of instruction. The reserve price, (the level below which the property will not be sold), remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. about_property:
The Starkies, Manchester Road, Bury
Generous, 5 bedroom / 3 bathroom / 6 receptions
Versatile Accommodation of Over 4,000sqft In All
Well Laid Out Over 3 Storeys
1 Bedroom Top Floor Self-Contained Annexe
Excellent Gardens & Grounds
Triple Garage & Ample Driveway Parking
Highly Sought After, Locally Iconic Setting
No chain delay - Early Viewing Essential
Viewing highly recommended - Contact Us now To View
This generously spacious 5 bedroom home with potential to easily become 6 bedrooms, sits within exclusive courtyard surroundings in a highly sought after and locally renowned setting. With over 4,000sqft of accommodation, well laid out over 3 floors and currently configured including a top floor self-contained 1 bedroom annexe, this exceptional property is a wonderful opportunity, brought to the market for the first time in many years. It offers an outstanding chance to create an outstanding home in beautiful surroundings. Excellent gardens, triple garaging and ample off road parking complete the picture here, with the added benefit of no chain delay - Viewing Highly Recommended, Contact Us now To View.
The Starkies, Manchester Road, Bury is a 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom home with multiple reception spaces offering flexibility and ease of creating 6 bedrooms or more, within the generous accommodation of over 4,000sqft in total. Offering flexible and versatile accommodation, the property is currently configured with a self-contained 1 bedroom annexe to the upper floor. Well laid out over 3 storeys in all, living spaces at this property are a good size throughout and retained features add significantly to its appeal.
In addition to its extensive reception spaces within, there is also a lovely sun room / conservatory with beautiful outlooks over the rear garden and grounds. To the front of course, there is also ample parking within the triple garage, while driveway space is also ample too. In all, the property's curtilage is comprehensive both inside and out.
Offering an outstanding opportunity to purchase a substantial home which offers great options and versatility, while being positioned in such a locally iconic setting which is well located and within easy reach of local amenities and very highly regarded local schools, this is a genuinely unusual chance to acquire a piece of local history too, while the property also has the further benefit of being offered for sale with no chain delay - Contact our Rawtenstall office now to reserve your exclusive personal viewing. With such a great suite of features and aspects, early viewing is highly recommended to avoid disappointment.
Internally, this property briefly comprises:
Ground floor - Entrance Hallway with Downstairs Cloaks & WC, Lounge, Dining Room, Breakfast Kitchen, Utility Room, Conservatory, Integral Triple Garage.
First floor - Landing off to Bedroom 1 with Dressing Room & En-Suite Shower Room, Bedrooms 2 & 3, Study and Family Bathroom.
Second floor - 2nd Landing off to further Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, Bedroom and Jack & Jill Bathroom.
Externally, the property enjoys a generous plot which, in addition to the Integral Triple Garage, also has ample Driveway Parking for several vehicles, a Rose Garden to the front, a Side Garden and both Rear Patios and Rear Garden space too.
Set within its private stone courtyard setting, this property has parking to the front and looks out onto lovely surroundings both front and rear. The popular location is within easy reach of many shops and local amenities which Bury has to offer and of course, it is well placed for major transport links making it easy to commute into Manchester and across the North West. Highly regarded schools are also within walking distance, as are sports and leisure facilities, healthcare, entertainment and both shopping and dining options too.

Karen Ritchie Estates are delighted to be instructed with the sale of this superb family home offering a spacious and flexible living environment and ideally located on the premium post code of Albert Rd West.
The property boasts four spacious bedrooms, four reception rooms and is set upon an extensive plot offering the opportunity for substantial further development subject to relevant planning.
This imposing residence is the perfect choice for the growing or multi generation family and is positioned to take advantage of a wealth of local amenities. Heaton is regarded as one of Boltons leading residential areas and offers a number of reputable schools, both private and public, places of worship, health and fitness centres, restaurants and shopping facilities striking the perfect balance of access to the leafy outdoors coupled with an excellent transport infrastructure. Sitting on the doorstep of some beautiful semi rural surroundings to include The Doffcocker Nature Reserve, Moss Bank Parklands and the historic Smithills Hall Estate and for those who enjoy life outdoors the country parks of Rivington and The West Pennine Moors are within easy reach.
Access to the property is via an extensive driveway which will accommodate multiple vehicles and to the rear a large, well maintained garden plot offers clearly defined areas for outdoor dining relaxation and play.
Albert Road West has long been regarded as a highly desirable post code and plays host to a number of sizeable quality dwellings, whist this property would benefit from a degree of modernisation it has been maintained in excellent order and is in fully ready to occupy condition. Home to its current vendor for 45 years the time is now right to pass to new ownership to recreate that same loving family home. We strongly recommend early viewing to fully appreciate what is on offer.
Ground Floor
Entrance Hall - double glazed entrance door giving access to entrance hall comprising of radiator, useful under stairs storage, stairs to first floor and two double glazed windows.
Lounge - double glazed window to front, two radiators, ceiling coving, feature fire place housing living flame gas fire and double glazed double doors giving access to rear.
Dining Room - double glazed double doors giving access to rear and two radiators.
Kitchen/Diner - full range of wall and base units housing stainless steel sink and splash back tiling to compliment. Gas cooker point, arger cooker, double glazed window to front, door giving access to garage, radiator and open access in conservatory.
Conservatory - double glazed construction with double glazed double doors giving access onto rear garden.
First Floor
Bedroom One - double glazed window to front, double glazed bay window to rear, two radiators and range of fitted hanging units with dressing table.
Bedroom Two - double glazed window to rear, radiator and storage cupboard.
Bedroom Three - double glazed window to rear, radiator and storage cupboard.
Bedroom Four - double glazed window to rear, radiator and storage cupboard.
Bathroom - two piece suite comprising of panel bath with over bath shower, hand wash basin, radiator, double glazed window to front, splash back tiling to compliment and fitted storage cupboard housing tank.
Separate WC - WC and double glazed window to front.
Landing - two double glazed windows to front, radiator and storage cupboard.
Surrounding the Property
To the front of the property is large paved drive giving access to garage. To the rear of the property is large garden area comprising of paved patio with steps leading down to laid lawn with well stocked mature borders and a variety of plants, trees and shrubbery.

Looking for space, comfort and potential? This deceptively spacious period end terraced on Shrewsbury Road offers an abundance of living space simply perfect for a growing family to put their own stamp on and enjoy. With accommodation conveniently arranged over three spacious floors, three reception rooms are on offer, a separate kitchen, four large bedrooms plus a cellar used for storage.
The house requires modernisation in places but beams with potential to restore, renovate and improve. We think the house would make a perfect purchase for a large family looking for something that they can put their own stamp on.
Shrewsbury Road is located just off Chorley New Road in Heaton. Bolton School is walkable in minutes and there's plenty of other amenities on the doorstep such as shops, supermarkets and leisure facilities.
The accommodation in brief comprises of; entrance porch with a door leading to a large and welcoming hallway. Doors lead to a large reception room with a bay fronted window. Adjacent is another spacious reception room which would make an ideal dining room. Another third reception can be found at the rear which is slightly smaller and flows into a fitted kitchen. Take the stairs to the first floor where three large bedrooms await in addition to the family bathroom and WC. Another staircase leads to the top floor where the biggest of the four bedrooms is located.

Entrance Hall With Cloaks/Storage
Spacious Lounge With Bay Window And Separate Dining/Sitting Room

Three Bedrooms - Main With Modern Built In Furniture

Tenure: Leasehold
Situated in the highly sought-after area of Prestwich, this extended semi-detached property offers a perfect blend of contemporary living and traditional charm. Stepping into the entrance hall, you are greeted with ample cloakroom and storage space, providing a practical solution for every-day living needs.
The property boasts a spacious lounge featuring a bay window that bathes the room in natural light, creating a welcoming ambience and with a feature living flame gas coal fire. A separate dining or sitting room offers versatile space for entertaining guests or unwinding after a long day. The large dining kitchen is a focal point of the home, complete with Velux windows that flood the area with sunlight, making it the perfect spot for family meals or social gatherings and includes an integrated double oven, hob and dishwasher with ample room for table and chairs. For added convenience, a utility room and ground floor WC are located on the ground level, ensuring household chores are a breeze.
Ascending to the first floor, you will find three bedrooms, with the main bedroom showcasing modern built-in furniture, providing ample storage solutions while maintaining a sleek and contemporary aesthetic. A modern family bathroom adds a touch of luxury, offering a tranquil setting for relaxation. The landing also has a built in storage cupboard and gives loft access.
Externally, the property features well-stocked gardens, perfect for outdoor dining or enjoying a morning coffee in the fresh air with a block paved patio. A driveway and detached garage provide ample parking and storage options.
Within proximity to Heaton Park, residents can enjoy leisurely strolls or picnics in the expansive green spaces. Prestwich Village offers an array of local amenities, including quaint shops, restaurants, and cafes, perfect for weekend excursions. With excellent transport links to the metro and motorway networks, commuting and exploring the surrounding areas is effortless.
In conclusion, this property is a true gem in a desirable location, offering a blend of modern comfort and convenient living. Don't miss the opportunity to make this house your home. Contact us today to arrange a viewing and experience the charm and convenience this property has to offer.

An Impressive and Unique Edwardian Detached Home on One of Marple’s Most Prestigious Roads
Occupying a prime position in one of Marple’s most sought-after locations, this stunning five-bedroom Edwardian detached residence seamlessly blends period charm with contemporary luxury. Tastefully updated by the current owners to an exceptional standard throughout, this home offers spacious and versatile accommodation, ideal for modern family living.
Beyond the elegant entrance hall, the ground floor features an expansive open-plan lounge, kitchen and dining area, perfect for both everyday living and entertaining. A separate snug and additional reception room/ study provide additional reception space and flexibility.
Upstairs, the property boasts five generous double bedrooms, including two with stylish en-suite bathrooms, alongside a well-appointed family bathroom.
The converted cellar divided into separate rooms with underfloor heating and full head height adds even more functionality, currently configured as a workshop with multiple rooms.
Externally, the home is set within beautiful wrap-around gardens, providing a private and tranquil outdoor retreat. A gated driveway leads to a triple garage with underfloor heating, offering secure parking and further storage.
Situated within easy reach of excellent local schools, Marple’s amenities, and with convenient access to both the countryside and Manchester city centre, this is a rare opportunity to acquire a truly special home in an enviable location.
Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate all this exceptional property has to offer.

about_property:
Chain-free two bedroom starter home on the sought-after cul-de-sac of Leeside in Heaton Mersey tucked away in a very popular estate. Sure to appeal to first-time buyers and downsizers alike, early viewings come highly recommended as properties on Leeside and neighbouring streets do not often grace the market for long.
Leeside is indisputably one of the most popular and sequestered streets in this section of Heaton Mersey offering residents privacy that cannot be found elsewhere. Transport links are superb with Didsbury Road offering ample road links, the East Didsbury Metrolink a 20 minute walk away, and the rail station too. Heaton Moor Road and its vast array of bars, restaurants and retail outlets offers residents a wide selection of amenities. Mersey Vale school may be found in this area of Heaton Mersey making the area attractive to families.
Entering through the front porch, the property itself is briefly comprised of: Spacious living room to the front with feature fireplace, kitchen to the rear including fitted units, worktops and cupboards as well as an integrated oven and hob, two well-proportioned bedrooms upstairs with the smaller of the two rooms benefiting from an integrated storage cupboard, and a serviceable bathroom comprised of a three-piece suite.
Externally, there are gardens to the front, side and rear. To the rear, the garden is easterly-facing enjoys the sun primarily in the morning and seeing the sun towards the bottom of the garden towards the afternoon/evening. Off-street parking is provided by the longer-than-average at the rear of the home.

about_property:
For sale by Informal Tender - 12noon 10th September
Lot 1: A detached Grade II listed four-bed farmhouse Associated Grade II listed traditional brick barn
Full residential planning for 3 units and dutch barn
Planning Number: 114988/lbc/24 (Trafford Council)
Lot 2: Farm outbuildings, storage bays, slurry lagoon and silage clamps
Substantial plot in a private, semi-rural location
The whole area extends to 3.06 acres
For sale as a whole or in two Lots - An opportunity to acquire a derelict farmhouse, brick barn with residential permission for 3 dwellings over 5005.sq.ft, Dutch barn and farm outbuildings.
Informal tender by 12 noon 10th September
For sale as a whole or in two Lots, an opportunity to acquire a farmhouse requiring modernisaiton, brick barn with residential permission for 3 dwellings over 5005.sq.ft, dutch barn and farm outbuildings in a desirable location.
Lot 1: Xs £975,000
A detached Grade II listed four-bedroom farmhouse, associated Grade II listed traditional brick barn with full residential planning for 3 dwellings over 5005sq.ft and dutch barn.
Lot 2: Tba
Farm outbuildings, storage bays, slurry lagoon and silage clamps.
Lot 1 - The Farmhouse
• The detached property is constructed of brick under a slate roof and requires a full scheme of modernisations. The accommodation offers good sized and well-proportioned space over 2 floors. On the ground floor are three reception rooms, a kitchen, shower room, and boiler/utility room. Upstairs there are four bedrooms and a bathroom.
The Barns
• A Planning Application has been approved under Section 19 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 to amend the approved proposals for the conversion of a traditional agricultural building into three residential dwellings (Ref: 106995/lbc/22).
• The original scheme, which was granted with Listed Building Consent, includes the sensitive restoration and conversion of the building into three characterful homes (Use Class C3), along with associated external works, private amenity space, and parking provision. The project also involves the removal of more modern structures on the site, including a steel-framed agricultural building, a shed, and a car port, relocating two of the approved parking spaces to better integrate with the site layout and heritage context, enhancing the landscaping scheme, with additional planting to further soften the development and support local biodiversity
Lot 2 - The Farm Buildings
• Complementing the traditional features of the property is a range of modern agricultural buildings positioned alongside a slurry lagoon and well-constructed silage clamps. These facilities are currently in use by a farming tenant under a Farm Business Tenancy, which is set to conclude in September 2025. These are available by separate negotiation.
Situation
Bow Green Farm is situated in Bowdon, a leafy suburb of Altrincham within the borough of Trafford. While in a rural setting, it is within a 5-7 minute drive of Hale Village and Altrincham town centre, both of which offer a good range of independent shops, bars and restaurants, as well as several supermarkets.
Bowdon’s close proximity to the M56 motorway makes it an ideal location for commuting to Manchester, while the tram connection into Manchester is only 10 minutes away, offering a less stressful route to the city centre.
Bowdon village is host to many sporting/leisure activities including cricket, tennis and squash, all based at the nearby sports club. Dunham Golf Club is within a five-minute drive. For those looking for a more leisurely stroll, Dunham Massey estate, with its impressive gardens and deer park, is just 10 minutes away.
On the educational front, there are three primary schools in Bowdon, and the highly rated Altrincham Grammar

about_property:
A Rare Opportunity to Own a Beautifully Presented, Spacious Three-Bedroom Semi-Detached Home on the Ever-Desirable Fairview Avenue, Dane Bank – With Stunning Garden, Detached Garage & Huge Potential
Welcome to Fairview Avenue, one of Dane Bank’s most sought-after residential streets – where homes rarely come to market. This impressive three-bedroom semi-detached property is a true gem, offering spacious, stylish living with an abundance of charm, curb appeal, and potential.
From the moment you arrive, the home’s exterior makes a lasting impression. The immaculately kept front garden, double driveway, and detached garage with electric set the tone for what lies beyond – a property that’s been lovingly maintained and thoughtfully designed both inside and out.
Step inside to a large and welcoming hallway, providing a warm and elegant entrance. The living room stretches the full length of the house, creating a generous and inviting space for relaxing or entertaining. With a beautiful bay window to the front and French doors opening out to the rear garden, the room is bathed in natural light throughout the day.
Off the hallway, you’ll also find a separate dining room, ideal for formal meals or a flexible second reception space. The modern kitchen is both stylish and practical, offering access to the rear garden and plenty of storage and workspace.
Upstairs, the property continues to impress with three generously sized bedrooms. The primary bedroom, positioned at the front, boasts another elegant bay window and built-in wardrobes, while the second double bedroom, overlooking the garden, also features ample fitted storage. The third bedroom is surprisingly spacious and can accommodate a double bed, though it currently works well as a large single or home office.
A key highlight of the first floor is the expansive family bathroom, complete with both a full-sized bath and a separate shower enclosure, providing comfort and practicality for busy households. The WC is housed separately, a convenient layout for families.
Outside, the beautifully landscaped rear garden offers a peaceful retreat or a vibrant entertaining space. Whether you’re a keen gardener, enjoy outdoor gatherings, or have children who need space to play, this garden ticks all the boxes. The detached garage provides excellent additional storage or workspace potential.
For those seeking future flexibility, the generous plot size offers fantastic scope for extension (subject to planning permission), making this an excellent long-term family home.
Located just a short walk from local shops, amenities, and the stunning Reddish Vale Nature Reserve, this home enjoys a prime position in Dane Bank. With excellent transport links to Manchester, Stockport, and the wider M60 network, and within catchment for well-regarded local schools, the location is ideal for families, professionals, and commuters alike.
Properties on Fairview Avenue are rarely available – don’t miss your chance to make this stunning home your own. Early viewing is highly recommended

about_property:
Fabulous end family home
Three reception rooms
Good sized modern kitchen
Modern utility room
Four generous bedrooms
Beautiful four piece family bathroom
Plus Jack and Jill en suite
Period style family home
In the ever popular Barrow Bridge
Internal and external viewing a must
Karen Ritchie Estates are delighted to be instructed with the sale of this highly desirable, Grade 11 listed property, dating back to 1830 and ideally located in the highly sought after conservation area of Barrow Bridge. Immaculately presented and offering a flexible and spacious living environment this striking, double fronted, family home is the perfect choice for the discerning homeowner. Framed with beautiful semi- rural surroundings to include The Moss Bank Parklands the location offers a range of activities and country walks to suit all members of the family. For those who enjoy exploring life outdoors The West Pennine Moors are within easy reach and the idyllic location is just a short distance from a wealth of local amenities to include shops, reputable schools and all major transport links ideal for those seeking a blend of convenience and tranquillity.
The property occupies an enviable position on Bazely Street, a tranquil and highly regarded postcode located just off Barrow Bridge Road. This most tastefully presented home briefly comprises of an entrance hallway giving access to the two well proportioned family reception rooms positioned to the front and rear aspect, additionally the study provides the perfect home office environment to accommodate the needs of modern hybrid working. The lower floor is complete with a shaker style kitchen and the benefit of a utility room set within separate walls. To the first floor the home benefits from four well proportioned bedrooms, a luxurious family bathroom and a Jack and Jill en suite facility.
Boasting Freehold tenure and in fully ready to occupy condition this beautiful home has been maintained to the highest standard preserving many of the characteristics from the era of build. We strongly recommend early viewing to avoid disappointment.
Ground Floor
Entrance Vestibule - entrance door, oak flooring, stairs to first floor and access into ground floor accommodation.
Lounge - oak flooring, double glazed window to side overlooking garden, radiator, feature log burner set into chimney breast with stone hearth, open access into dining room and door giving access to side garden.
Dining Room - oak flooring, double glazed window to front, door to side garden and radiator.
Study - oak flooring, radiator and double glazed window to side.
Kitchen - full range of modern wall and base units in cream shaker style finish with butchers block work surfaces housing under mount belfast sink and splash back tiling to compliment. Full range of integrated appliances to include fridge, freezer, five ring gas hob, cooker hood, electric fan assisted oven grill, dishwasher, slate flooring, useful under stairs storage, door giving access to utility, double glazed window to front and side.
Utility - full range of modern wall and base units in white high gloss finish with moulded work surfaces housing stainless steel sink, traditional clothes airier, wall mounted boiler concealed within units, plumbed for automatic washer, door to side and radiator.
First Floor
Bedroom One - feature stripped flooring, radiator and two double glazed windows to side.
Bedroom Two - radiator, double glazed window to front and side, fitted storage and door to Jack and Jill en-suite.
Bedroom Three - door to Jack and Jill en-suite, double glazed window to front and side, radiator and fitted storage.
Bedroom Four - radiator and double glazed window to side.
Landing - two loft access, one with pull down ladder.
Bathroom - stunning four piece suite giving great space comprising of oval bath, corner walk in shower, large hand wash basin set onto vanity unit and WC, tiled elevations, extractor, heated towel rail, double glazed window and acrylic panelled ceiling.
Surrounding the Property
To the front of the property we have pavement access. To the side of the property is beautiful well kept gardens set on different levels with York stone paving, traditional stone walls, laid lawn and well stocked mature borders with a variety of plants, trees and shrubbery. about_property:
Three Double Bedrooms
En-suite With Roll Top Bath
Parking
Enclosed Rear Yard
Balcony
Viewing Essential!
Level access
This unique and deceptively spacious three double bedroom terrace property is full of character and charm, offering versatile living space ideal for families, professionals, or those looking for something a little different. Tucked away on an un-adopted road, the property is conveniently close to a range of local amenities, excellent transport links, and the picturesque Haughton Dale Nature Reserve, where scenic river and woodland walks can be enjoyed, offering a wonderful balance of town and nature.
Stepping inside, the home immediately impresses with its generous room sizes and thoughtful layout. The spacious lounge is a welcoming space, featuring a log burner that creates a cosy and homely atmosphere. There is a separate sitting room that opens into the dining area, creating an open plan feel ideal for entertaining or family life, while the kitchen offers a practical and well-laid-out space with ample storage and workspace for day-to-day cooking, access to spacious and versatile cellar.
Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned double bedrooms, all offering comfortable and flexible accommodation. The master bedroom benefits from French doors opening onto a decked balcony, providing a peaceful outdoor spot to enjoy a morning coffee or evening sunset. The master also boasts its own stylish en-suite bathroom complete with a freestanding roll top bath, adding a touch of luxury. A separate modern shower room serves the remaining bedrooms.
Externally, the property offers off-road parking to the front along with a low maintenance gravelled garden that wraps around to the side. To the rear, the enclosed yard has been attractively designed with artificial grass and a paved pathway for easy upkeep, creating a private and practical area for outdoor seating or children to play. There is also gated access for added security and convenience.
With its distinctive character and generous proportions, this home is truly a rare find and and must be viewed!

Looking for your next family upsize? This modern three-bedroom semi-detached home on Cranberry Drive has got so much appeal! Flowing elegantly with neutral and sophisticated decor, the house is ready to move straight into and enjoy immediately. We think it would be absolutely perfect for a growing family looking to make their next move in the market.
Two double bedrooms are on offer in addition to a third single bedroom plus an impressive kitchen/diner, cloakroom, plenty of off road parking and well kept gardens to both sides.
Cranberry Drive is a quiet and well regarded cul-de-sac of modern properties located just off Wigan Road. An abundance of amenities are on the doorstep such as schools, shops, supermarkets and leisure facilities. For those needing to commute and travel the local M61 motorway network is just minutes away which provides great links to Manchester and beyond.
In brief, the accommodation comprises; entrance vestibule with doors leading to a cloakroom and bright and airy lounge. A door to the rear leads to an impressive kitchen/dining area with a combination of base and eye level fitted units. Take the stairs to the first floor are you'll find two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a fully fitted family bathroom suite. Luxurious ground floor apartment
Wonderful position in exclusive development
Large private garden terrace area
Beautiful en suite & luxurious bathroom

Remainder of NHBC guarantee in place
No upward chain. Viewing highly recommended
A beautifully appointed ground floor apartment in superb condition throughout enjoying a large private terrace, providing the type of external space that is rarely found in an apartment. Importantly, the property is offered for sale with only vacant possession, and no further upward chain delay, so it is hoped a prompt completion can be arranged when the sale is agreed.
Situated in a stone building and being part of the much admired Deakins Park development, in Egerton, the setting is wonderful. Eagley Brook river runs near by and the waterfall can be seen from the grounds of the development. There is beautiful countryside and woodland nearby offering wonderful opportunities to explore the countryside. There are superb every day amenities, including; restaurants (Ciao Baby, Cibo, Thomas Egerton etc) sports clubs (Delph Sailing Club, Dunscar Golf Club, and The Last Drop Village), the wonderful Rainy’s is just a short walk away and there are superb transport links within easy reach by both road and railway as Bromley Cross railway station is within easy reach which directly serves; Manchester, Salford, Bolton and Blackburn.
The superbly appointed accommodation extends to around 957 ft.² and briefly comprises: Welcoming reception hall with built-in storage space, open plan, lounge/diner with tall windows and door off to the private terrace, the lounge/diner opens directly into the modern professionally, fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, there is a separate utility space, the Master bedroom is over 6.3 m in length with fitted triple size wardrobe and luxurious en suite shower room off. The second bedroom is over 5 m in length and the bathroom suite is particularly well appointed. Externally there is a sizable private terrace area that you step out onto from the lounge part of which is covered. There is allocated car parking.
The property is fully double glazed, including feature windows which revolve around for easy cleaning, there is an electric heating and hot water system, video entrance, telephone, and importantly, the property is available with no further upward chain delay.
There is a great deal to admire, and a viewing can be arranged by calling Cardwells Estate Agents Bolton on , emailing; or visiting:

Situated within a popular and highly convenient setting, this fabulous semi-detached home offers well-proportioned and highly versatile living space over two floors that must be seen in person to be fully appreciated.
Having been extended to the ground floor and into the roof space, the accommodation comprises an entrance hallway, superb lounge, separate dining room, further conservatory, a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, a good sized double bedroom and a three piece bathroom/wc to the ground floor. On the first floor a landing, two further good sized double bedrooms master with fitted wardrobes ad its own three piece en-suite bathroom) can be found which complete the internal living space. Outside the property is garden fronted with a drive and a detached garage offering ample parking. Detailed Description
Located on the ever-popular Rectory Road in Garswood, this three-bedroom detached property represents an exceptional opportunity for those with vision, creativity, and a passion for transformation. In need of a full back-to-brick renovation throughout, the home offers endless potential either as a rewarding development project or the foundation for creating a truly bespoke family residence. The generous plot and well-proportioned rooms provide an excellent canvas, with the current ground floor layout comprising a porch, welcoming entrance hall, kitchen, dining room, living room, and a versatile downstairs bedroom. Upstairs, there are two spacious double bedrooms and a bathroom. Outside, the property enjoys gardens to both the front and rear, a driveway providing off-road parking, and a single garage.
Due to the property’s condition, it is unlikely that traditional mortgage finance will be available, and we strongly recommend viewing the virtual tour before arranging a physical visit. Garswood itself is a desirable residential area within Ashton-in-Makerfield, cherished for its close-knit community, well-regarded local schools, and excellent access to open green spaces. For commuters, the location is superb - Garswood Train Station is just moments away, and the M6 motorway is within easy reach, offering swift connections to Liverpool, Manchester, and beyond. This is a rare chance to acquire a property with such scope in one of the area’s most sought-after locations.

This exceptional double-fronted semi-detached home has been substantially extended to create a truly impressive family property, perfectly blending generous living spaces with a practical layout. Situated on one of Worsley’s most popular and well-regarded roads, it enjoys a highly desirable location close to excellent schools, local shops, and superb transport links, making it an ideal choice for families seeking both comfort and convenience.
Upon entering, you are welcomed into a bright and inviting hallway that immediately sets the tone for the space within. The ground floor offers two separate and beautifully proportioned reception rooms – one perfect for use as a formal lounge, the other lending itself to a cosy family room or playroom, depending on your needs.
To the rear of the home lies the heart of the property: A stunning, extended open-plan kitchen and family room. Thoughtfully designed with both style and functionality in mind, this space features modern fitted units, integrated appliances, and ample room for a large dining table and additional seating area, creating a wonderful environment for entertaining guests or enjoying everyday family life. A useful utility room keeps household chores neatly tucked away, while a convenient downstairs WC completes the ground floor.
Upstairs, the generous proportions continue. The principal bedroom benefits from a newly fitted en-suite shower room, while two further well-sized bedrooms offer excellent flexibility for children’s rooms, a guest room, or even a home office. The stylish family bathroom has been finished to a high standard, featuring contemporary fixtures and fittings.
Externally, the property provides a driveway to the front, ensuring off-road parking, and to the rear you will find a substantial garden. This private outdoor space combines a neat lawn and a raised decking area.

about_property:
Immaculately Presented Period End Terrace
Substantially Extended Throughout and Sympathetically Restored
Accommodation over Four Floors
Highly Sought After Location Close to Sale Town Centre
Four Bedrooms
Converted Cellar Chamber providing Further Living Accommodation
A stunning example of a meticulously enhanced, immaculately appointed and substantially extended period residence, with sympathetically restored and contemporary themed accommodation over four floors of just over 1,700 sq ft. Boasting four double bedrooms and three bath/shower rooms, and a striking remodeled and refitted dining kitchen. With a large landscaped rear garden, set on the revered Poplar Grove, only a short stroll to Sale, popular schools including Sale Grammar, both St Joseph's and Springfield Primary, and two Metrolink stops.
Description
A handsome traditional, bay-fronted period end-terraced, having been comprehensively enhanced and intelligently improved to offer an outstanding example of an exceptional versatile residence over four floors. Enjoying a stylish blend of contemporary themed improvements and sympathetic enhancements, with a large landscaped garden, and occupying a much sought-after location.
Upon approach the home enjoys a charming frontage, with bay-fronted twin-tone brick elevations, a mature feature tree in a stone topped brick planter, and a block paved driveway leading to the elevated entrance. A striking stained glass rich front door sets the tone for the exceptional period home. Opening to a fabulous and welcoming entrance hall, a single door leads to the extensive open plan ground floor, with a bay-fronted living room with in-built alcove storage to the front, and a central dining room with attractive wooden flooring. A large opening leads to the intelligently remodelled and extended dining kitchen, providing a vast family/entertaining area with a striking refitted quality kitchen, a feature central island with breakfast bar, enjoying quartz work surfaces and contrasting tones. Crittal-style double doors to the garden, charming picture-frame window, and vaulted ceiling with multiple skylights. Off the dining room is a staircase to the basement and a useful cloakroom storage cupboard which houses plumbing for a ground floor w/c.
The basement level is a special addition to the home, having been converted and also excavated to offer improved head height. The main chamber provides for a large versatile bay-fronted reception room/ home office or even occasional bedroom, whilst there is also a modern refitted separate shower room.
Location
The friendly town of Sale is an extremely popular place to live, thanks to easy transport links into Media City, Manchester City Centre and other neighbouring areas via three Metrolink stations. The nearby North West motorway network and Manchester International Airport are also conveniently located nearby. Sale and the surrounding areas are also very desirable locations for families, due to the large number of highly regarded schools in the vicinity. Both Sale and nearby Altrincham can also provide for all shopping and recreational needs and one of Europe's largest shopping centres, The Trafford Centre can be found only a few miles away.
Directions

about_property:
Freehold new build
No chain – perfect for a smooth and speedy purchase.
Spacious lounge
Stylish kitchen/diner
Three generous double bedrooms
Contemporary family bathroom

Prime Walkden location
Freehold – No Chain – Modern New Build in Prime Walkden Location
This stylish and energy-efficient three-bedroom detached home is newly built and ready to move straight into, offering a perfect blend of modern design, comfort, and convenience. Ideally located just a 10-minute walk from Walkden train station (with direct 18-minute trains to Manchester), plus excellent links to the M60, A580, and guided bus routes to Leigh, Tyldesley, and Salford, it’s an ideal choice for first-time buyers, young families, or professionals.
A bright hallway with dark wooden flooring sets the tone for the property’s modern style and leads to the downstairs WC, finished with light grey tiling. On the right-hand side, the spacious and airy lounge is filled with natural light from a large bay window and features cream carpets for a warm, cosy feel. On the left-hand side, the kitchen/diner is fitted with white cupboard doors, dark grey countertops, and cream tiled flooring. It includes an integrated oven and grill, gas hob, and cooker hood, with space for a washer/dryer and a freestanding fridge-freezer. The dining area opens through patio doors to the rear garden, offering a pleasant view and an easy indoor-outdoor flow.
Upstairs, the landing leads to three generously sized double bedrooms, one currently used as a home office. The master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom with a walk-in shower, tiled from floor to ceiling for easy maintenance. The family bathroom is decorated in a similar style and features a bath with overhead shower.
The rear garden combines a paved patio and lawn area, fully enclosed with fencing for privacy—perfect for relaxing or entertaining. The property also benefits from a private double driveway. Families will appreciate being within the catchment area for Hilton Lane Primary School (Good) and St Andrew’s Methodist Primary School (Outstanding), with Worsley College and Manchester’s universities just a short drive away.
This immaculate freehold home with no onward chain offers comfort, style, and a sought-after location—viewing is highly recommended.
