An idyllic family home with no chain delay
Nestled in the sought-after area of Swinton, Manchester, this outstanding detached house on Arkwright Way presents an exceptional opportunity for families seeking a spacious and stylish home. Boasting four well-proportioned bedrooms and a welcoming reception room, this property is designed to cater to the needs of modern family life.
The interiors are both contemporary and inviting, featuring neutral decoration that allows for personalisation and creativity. The property has been meticulously maintained to the highest standard, ensuring that it is ready for you to move in without delay. The well-appointed bathroom and modern fixtures throughout add to the overall appeal, making daily living both comfortable and convenient.
One of the standout features of this home is the generous outdoor space. The enviable garden provides a perfect setting for children to play, family gatherings, or simply enjoying the fresh air. Additionally, the property benefits from off-road parking, a valuable asset in this popular estate.
This home is not just a house; it is the perfect family haven, offering everything needed to create lasting memories. With no chain delay, you can embark on your new journey without the usual waiting period. Situated in a desirable location, this property is truly not to be missed. Whether you are a growing family or simply seeking a spacious retreat, this home is ready to welcome you.
For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Swinton branch at your earliest convenience.

A Substantial Four-Bedroom Family Home in a Prestigious Prestwich Location
Set on one of Prestwich’s most desirable residential avenues, this impressive semi-detached home offers space, character and flexibility for modern family living. With four bedrooms, two reception rooms, a separate garage and a prime location close to excellent schools and local amenities, it is the perfect blend of comfort and convenience.
From the moment you step into the welcoming porch and hallway, the generous proportions are immediately apparent. The front lounge is light-filled and elegant, providing the ideal setting for relaxing with family or hosting guests. Two dining spaces offer versatile options – a cosy everyday area adjacent to the kitchen, and a larger, more formal dining room perfect for entertaining. A ground floor cloakroom adds further practicality to the layout.
Upstairs, the home’s four bedrooms offer a variety of uses. Two are substantial enough to serve as the principal bedroom, while the remaining rooms are well-suited for guests, children or a dedicated home office. The family bathroom is centrally located to serve all rooms with ease.
The property also benefits from a separate garage, ideal for secure parking or additional storage, and sits within a mature residential setting renowned for its peaceful atmosphere and strong community spirit.
Prestwich is a vibrant and highly sought-after area of Greater Manchester, known for its tree-lined streets, excellent schooling and an array of independent shops, cafes and restaurants. Local parks and green spaces are within easy reach, and excellent transport links – including nearby rail connections – ensure Manchester city centre is just a short journey away.
This is a rare opportunity to secure a substantial home in an outstanding location, offering both the space and the lifestyle that many buyers are seeking.

Former three bedroom
Semi detached bungalow
Spacious lounge
Two double bedrooms
Dining room & Kitchen

No Chain
This detached bungalow, once three bedrooms and now converted into a two-bedroom layout by extending the lounge, offers a fantastic opportunity for anyone looking to put their own stamp on a property. While the home is in need of renovation, the spacious rooms and well-planned layout make it an appealing project in a highly convenient location.
Situated close to motorway connections and just a short drive or walk into Upholland, you’ll have easy access to all essential amenities. There’s even a small council-owned pond across the road, perfect for fishing.
The accommodation comprises an entrance hall leading to a dining room at the front of the property and a kitchen with access to the side. There are two store rooms and a bathroom off the inner hallway. The two double bedrooms both have fitted wardrobes, and the large lounge—created by extending into what was previously a third bedroom—offers an impressive main living area with plenty of natural light.
Outside, the bungalow benefits from a gated driveway to the rear, which is typically used as the main entrance, and this leads directly onto the main road. There’s also a shed for storage, and the garden offers plenty of scope for landscaping to your taste.
With its generous plot, flexible layout, and desirable location, this property is ideal for those seeking a renovation project with real potential.
Auctioneer Comments
This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction allowing the buyer and seller to complete within a 56 Day Reservation
Period. Interested parties’ personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold Ltd).
If considering a mortgage, inspect and consider the property carefully with your lender before bidding. A Buyer Information
Pack is provided, which you must view before bidding. The buyer is responsible for the Pack fee. For the most recent
information on the Buyer Information Pack fee, please contact the iamsold team.
The buyer signs a Reservation Agreement and makes payment of a Non-Refundable Reservation Fee of 4.5% of the purchase
price inc VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,600 inc. VAT. This Fee is paid to reserve the property to the buyer during the
Reservation Period and is paid in addition to the purchase price. The Fee is considered within calculations for stamp duty.
Services may be recommended by the Agent/Auctioneer in which they will receive payment from the service provider if the
service is taken. Payment varies but will be no more than £960 inc. VAT. These services are optional.

A substantially and thoughtfully extended three bedroom end terrace property occupying a favourable location within poynton. Immaculately presented accommodation over two floors. Entrance hall, lounge, stunning open plan living dining kitchen, three bedrooms and contemporary family bathroom and detached garage. Set on a large corner plot with a large south facing garden.
Directions

Location
Poynton is a vibrant village renowned for its independent shops, bars and restaurant's which are all centrally based around Park Lane. The village is also home to Waitrose, Morrisons and Aldi supermarkets which are complemented by other popular names such as Costa Coffee and Pizza express. There are many based community events such as the annual show and the Poynton village 10K. The area borders Lyme Park and the Peak District, and is home to many stunning Country Walks and Cycle Paths along The Middlewood Way and Poynton Canal. The Railway Station offers regular access to the city of Manchester, along with major towns of Stockport, Macclesfield and shopping centres in Handforth Dean and Cheadle Royal. Manchester International Airport is a 10 minute drive from Poynton centre accessed via the new A555 relief road, and access routes to all Motorways are easily accessible. All schools in the area both primary and secondary have excellent reputations.

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction, meaning the buyer and seller are to Complete within 56 days (the "Reservation Period"). Interested parties personal data will be shared with the Auctioneer (iamsold).
If considering buying with a mortgage, inspect and consider the property carefully with your lender before bidding.
A Buyer Information Pack is provided. The winning bidder will pay £349.00 including VAT for this pack which you must view before bidding.
The buyer signs a Reservation Agreement and makes payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.5% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,600.00 including VAT. This is paid to reserve the property to the buyer during the Reservation Period and is paid in addition to the purchase price. This is considered within calculations for Stamp Duty Land Tax.
Services may be recommended by the Agent or Auctioneer in which they will receive payment from the service provider if the service is taken. Payment varies but will be no more than £450.00. These services are optional.

6 Henry Street, BL0 0DR is a beautiful three-storey stone cottage, offering stylish interiors and a highly versatile layout in the heart of Ramsbottom. Lovingly updated while retaining its period charm, the property provides flexible living spaces ideal for modern lifestyles.
On the basement level, you’ll find a spacious second reception room with an adjoining study area – perfect for home working, a hobby room, or a cosy snug. The ground floor is home to a well-appointed fitted kitchen and the main reception room, a bright and welcoming space ideal for everyday living and entertaining.
The first floor comprises two comfortable and well-proportioned bedrooms along with a modern three-piece family bathroom. Each room benefits from tasteful décor and thoughtful design, making the most of the cottage’s character and proportions.
Externally, a private rear patio provides a lovely spot for morning coffee or evening dining, while a further lawned garden offers additional outdoor space for relaxation or play.
Perfectly located just a short stroll from Ramsbottom’s vibrant centre, residents can enjoy boutique shops, award-winning restaurants, charming cafés, and excellent local schools, along with great transport links to Bury, Manchester, and beyond. This property offers the perfect balance of charm, practicality, and location – a must-see for those seeking a character home in a thriving community.

Set in a quiet cul-de-sac on Willow Bank, this four-bedroom home has a warm and welcoming feel from the moment you arrive.
The driveway offers plenty of space for off-road parking and stepping through the porch into the generous entrance hall, you’ll instantly get a sense of the space and light that runs throughout the property.
Downstairs, the layout works perfectly for family life. The open-plan kitchen and dining area is a real heart-of-the-home space – somewhere to gather over breakfast or host a lively dinner with friends. The large lounge feels inviting and comfortable, ideal for cosy evenings in. There’s also a handy downstairs W/C, a separate utility room to keep things organised, and access to the garage, which is large enough to accommodate a car as well as provide extra storage or hobby space. The garage also features a fitted EV charging point, making it ready for electric vehicle owners.
Upstairs, there are four well-proportioned bedrooms, offering plenty of flexibility whether you need family rooms, guest space, or a home office. Two of the bedrooms benefit from fitted wardrobes, adding to the home’s excellent storage. The large family bathroom features a four-piece suite, providing both a bath and a separate shower. For anyone needing even more storage, the fully boarded loft is a huge bonus – ideal for keeping everything neatly out of sight but close to hand.
The location is hard to beat. Willow Bank sits within the catchment for some of Cheadle Hulme’s most sought-after schools, making it a great choice for families. The garden is another highlight – a generous space with a lovely decked area, perfect for summer get-togethers or simply enjoying a quiet morning coffee. With local shops, parks, and excellent transport links all close by, this is a home that offers both convenience and a sense of community.

For those who love the outdoors, the picturesque Daisy Nook Country Park is just a short drive away, offering scenic walks and green open spaces.

Deceptively Spacious Semi-Detached Property – Versatile & Conveniently Located
Situated in a popular and highly convenient location, this deceptively spacious semi-detached home offers exceptional versatility. Close to a variety of local schools, shops, and amenities, as well as Bury Town Centre, Fairfield Hospital, and excellent motorway links, the property is ideally placed for families, commuters, and investors alike.
Previously a commercial premises with a flat above, the property has been thoughtfully converted into a generous family home but could easily be adapted back to commercial use, split into flats, or configured as an HMO (subject to the relevant planning consents).
The accommodation comprises: Spacious open-plan fitted kitchen/dining room – perfect for entertaining, Comfortable lounge, Utility room and guest WC to the ground floor
To the first floor are three well-proportioned bedrooms, including Bedroom Three with its own dressing area/study, plus a family bathroom. The second floor offers a versatile loft room with an additional WC.
Externally, there is a large store room/workshop, good-sized enclosed rear yard and on-street parking is available to the front.
This is a fantastic opportunity for those seeking a flexible living space in a prime location, whether as a home, investment, or business opportunity.

Description
Nestled in the heart of a peaceful residential cul-de-sac on Chasetown Close, Baguley, this immaculately presented three-bedroom semi-detached home is offered for sale with no chain, making it the ideal opportunity for families, first-time buyers or those looking to upsize with minimal hassle. Priced at £299,950, this thoughtfully extended property boasts a wealth of contemporary features and is ready for immediate occupation.
The accommodation is generously proportioned throughout and impressively configured to suit modern living. A standout feature is the bespoke open-plan dining kitchen, fitted to a high standard and offering a stylish and functional heart of the home ? Perfect for entertaining or relaxed family meals. The bright and welcoming reception room to the front offers a cosy yet spacious retreat. Upstairs, the property comprises three good-sized bedrooms, each offering ample space for furnishings and storage, while the modern family bathroom is finished to an excellent specification.
To the rear, a secluded garden provides a wonderfully private outdoor space ideal for children, pets or leisurely summer evenings. The property is located in a quiet and well-regarded neighbourhood, within walking distance to a range of local amenities including independent shops, major supermarkets, and schools rated well by Ofsted. Families will appreciate the close proximity to parkland and leisure facilities, while those commuting will benefit from the nearby Brooklands Tram Stop and Timperley village ? Both just a short walk away.
Wythenshawe Hospital is conveniently located close by, offering comprehensive healthcare services, and Manchester Airport can be reached in under 15 minutes by car, making this a prime location for professionals who travel regularly. Excellent transport links, including rail connections from nearby Altrincham or Manchester Airport stations, ensure easy access to central Manchester and beyond.
With its stylish interior, spacious layout and sought-after position, this delightful home should not be missed. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the quality and location on offer.

Immaculately Presented Mid-Terrace in the Heart of Ainsworth Village
Situated in the sought-after village of Ainsworth, this beautifully presented garden-fronted mid-terrace offers the perfect blend of period charm and modern comfort. Ideally positioned within easy reach of local schools, shops, amenities, traditional country pubs, and scenic countryside walks, it’s an ideal choice for first-time buyers, downsizers, or those seeking a move-in-ready home.
Lovingly upgraded by the current owner, the property is offered in impeccable condition and retains a wealth of character throughout.

Tucked away in the very heart of Worsley, this captivating three-bedroom period cottage combines the charm of a bygone era with the comfort and practicality of modern living. Offered with no onward chain, it represents a rare chance to secure a home in one of the area’s most sought-after locations, surrounded by history, green spaces, and a welcoming village atmosphere.
The moment you step inside, the character of this home is immediately apparent. Original period details create a sense of warmth and heritage, while tasteful updates ensure it is perfectly suited for contemporary life. The inviting lounge is ideal for both relaxed evenings and social gatherings, while the adjoining kitchen enjoys an abundance of natural light and provides a delightful space for cooking and dining. Upstairs, three well-proportioned bedrooms provide comfortable and private spaces to retreat to. The principal bedroom is particularly generous, offering a calm and restful setting, while the remaining bedrooms are versatile, ideal for family, guests, or a dedicated home office.

The village itself is alive with independent shops, cosy pubs, and dining options, while excellent transport connections put Manchester and surrounding areas within easy reach.

about_property:
Welcome to Victory Grove in Audenshaw. A highly sought-after location, home to an array of beautiful properties and set on a quiet estate with no through access, keeping traffic and disturbance to a minimum.
This stunning three-bedroom detached home occupies a generous plot and instantly captivates with its exceptional kerb appeal. The front driveway/garden is beautifully maintained and provides ample parking for up to 4 cars, while the modern grey frontage, complementary rendered exterior, and stylish entrance door combine to create a sleek, contemporary look that speaks of the care and attention to detail lavished on this property. Stepping inside, the same level of thought and refinement is immediately apparent. The welcoming entrance hallway sets the tone for the rest of the home, offering space for guests to be greeted and for coats and shoes to be neatly stored in a well-lit and useful under-stairs storage space while serving as a central hub connecting the stairs and the main ground floor rooms which have been stylishly laid in luxury vinyl flooring seamlessly flowing through the ground floor space.
The lounge is an inviting and versatile space, bathed in natural light from two tall windows and offering flexibility in layout thanks to its generous proportions, all while providing a charming view of the private rear garden. The second reception room, currently used as a dining area and bar and with well-designed, floor-to-ceiling storage cupboards along one wall, is another adaptable space that could be tailored to suit a variety of needs—whether as a formal dining room, home office, playroom, or additional entertaining area. The kitchen, truly the heart of the home, exudes elegance and practicality in equal measure, with premium features including concealed pop-up outlets, a Quooker tap, exquisite work surfaces, and top-quality finishes that make it ideal for both everyday family life and entertaining. A conveniently located downstairs WC, maintained to the same immaculate standard as the rest of the property, completes the ground floor.
Upstairs, three double bedrooms await. The master bedroom offers a sense of luxury with its spacious layout, bespoke fitted storage that surrounds the bed, and high-end touches such as matching hardware and integrated lighting, all while comfortably accommodating a king-size bed without compromising space. The second bedroom is equally generous, boasting extensive built-in storage across two walls, while the third bedroom, currently used as a home office, offers ample flexibility to serve as a bedroom, nursery, playroom, or home gym. The family bathroom continues the home’s premium feel, presenting a bright, modern design with a shower unit, toilet, and sink basin in a high-quality finish.
To the rear, the enclosed garden is an oasis of both relaxation and entertainment. The landscaped design reflects the same attention to detail as the interior, with durable surfacing matching the wraparound driveway for year-round usability. A summer house, canopied seating area, and a beautifully presented hot tub setup make this the perfect space for hosting or enjoying quiet evenings outdoors. For keen gardeners, the vibrant planting offers plenty of opportunity for enjoyment, while the garage provides a dry, well-finished space with plentiful electrical outlets—ideal for storage, hobbies, or as a practical workspace.
Situated within close proximity to Fairfield train station, multiple tram stops, bus links, and excellent motorway access, this home is perfectly positioned for commuters. The area also benefits from great school catchments, local supermarkets, and shopping centres, offering convenience in abundance. Presented in turnkey condition with a premium finish throughout, this property represents a rare opportunity to purchase a truly high-end home in a prime location. Viewings are strictly by appointment through Bridgfords on .

This large four bedroom detached property is found on Tandlewood Park - one of the area's best regarded and most sought-after roads, just a short stroll from Tandle Hills, and being home to some of the area's most beautiful properties.
This has been a much cherished and well-loved family home. Royton town centre is around a mile away and has a good range of shops, amenities, bars, cafes and restaurants.

Elegant Five-Bedroom Detached Home with Spacious Interiors, Generous Parking & Private Gardens
This beautifully presented five-bedroom detached residence combines modern comforts with a versatile layout, making it an ideal choice for families seeking space, style, and convenience. With two reception rooms, three bathrooms, a well-designed kitchen, and excellent outdoor space, this home offers everything needed for contemporary living.
Step into a bright and welcoming hallway that sets the tone for the property’s generous proportions. To the front, the lounge provides a warm and comfortable retreat, perfect for relaxing with family or friends. At the rear, the separate dining room is ideal for entertaining and family meals, with French doors opening directly to the garden. The kitchen is thoughtfully designed, offering ample storage, generous worktop space, and a practical layout for busy households. A convenient downstairs WC completes the ground floor.
The first-floor hosts four generously sized double bedrooms, one with its own en-suite shower room, plus a stylishly finished family bathroom. Each room offers flexibility to suit your lifestyle—whether as bedrooms, home offices, or guest accommodation.
The top floor is dedicated to the impressive principal suite, created through a high-quality loft conversion. This expansive space boasts a luxurious double bedroom, sleek en-suite, and a peaceful ambience, making it the perfect private sanctuary.
To the front, a neat lawn enhances the home’s kerb appeal, while a generous driveway offers parking for up to three vehicles and leads to a small garage, ideal for storage or hobbies. The rear garden is a true highlight—spacious, private, and well-maintained, with a mix of lawn and patio areas. With direct access from both the lounge and dining room, it’s perfect for entertaining, play, or quiet moments outdoors.
Situated in a desirable residential cul-de-sac, the property benefits from excellent local schools, green spaces, and a friendly community atmosphere. Shops, supermarkets, and leisure facilities are within easy reach, while strong transport links provide quick access to surrounding towns and the city centre, ensuring the best of both convenience and tranquillity.

about_property:
No Vendor Chain
Three Bedrooms
Double Driveway
Rear Garden
Convenient Location
Viewing Essential!
Selling a three bedroom mid-terraced property with no vendor chain, ideally situated in a convenient and sought-after area of Ashton-under-Lyne. This well-positioned home offers the perfect blend of comfort, practicality, and location, making it an attractive choice for first-time buyers, professionals, families, or investors.
Enjoying a prime setting, the property is within walking distance of Tameside Hospital and the picturesque Stamford Park — ideal for weekend walks and outdoor activities. Ashton-under-Lyne town centre is just a short stroll away, offering a fantastic range of shops, cafés, restaurants, and essential amenities. Excellent transport links are close at hand, including easy access to the motorway network and nearby train and bus services, making commuting into Manchester and surrounding areas quick and convenient. The property also falls within the catchment area for well-regarded local schools.
Set back from the road, the home benefits from a welcoming frontage with a double block-paved driveway providing ample off-road parking. Inside, the ground floor features a hallway leading to a comfortable lounge and a spacious kitchen/diner — perfect for both everyday meals and entertaining guests. Upstairs, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms, offering flexible space for sleeping, working from home, or creating a hobby room, along with a family bathroom.
To the rear, the property boasts an enclosed paved patio garden with gated access, offering a private, low-maintenance outdoor retreat.
This property offers a fantastic opportunity for those seeking a well-connected home in Ashton-under-Lyne. **Viewing Highly Recommended**

Nestled on Garthorp Road in the vibrant city of Manchester, this charming two-bedroom apartment presents an excellent opportunity for both first-time buyers and savvy investors. The property boasts a well-maintained interior, ensuring a comfortable living space that is ready for you to move in.

One of the standout features of this property is the allocated parking space, providing convenience in this bustling urban area. Additionally, the nearby Metrolink and Wythenshawe Park enhance the appeal of the location, offering excellent transport links and green spaces for leisure activities.
This apartment is not only a delightful home but also a promising investment opportunity, given its desirable location and amenities. Whether you are looking to settle down or expand your property portfolio, this apartment on Garthorp Road is a must-see.

about_property:
No chain
Recently refurbished two bedroom period end terrace
Two spacious reception rooms + modern fitted kitchen
Landscaped rear garden
Sought after location just off Beech Road
Ideally placed for all local amenities, parks and the Metro
Gardens to both the front and rear
Many original features retained
Double glazing and gas central heating throughout
Council Tax: B. EPC: D
***no chain*** Situated on a highly sought after road just off beech road, a truly delightful two bedroom end terrace period property providing spacious and light accommodation throughout. This splendid property, having been recently refurbished by the current owners, is offered for sale with no onward chain and in move-in condition. With many original features throughout, such as the wooden flooring and fireplaces, this property will prove ideal for a young couple, first time buyers or buy to let investors alike. Located only a stone's throw from the vibrant scene of Beech Road, all local amenities in Chorlton Village, local parks and the Metro, this wonderful end of terrace further benefits a well proportioned landscaped rear garden and is not one to be missed. The spacious accommodation briefly comprises: Covered porch, entrance hallway, lounge with bay window and original wooden flooring and fireplace opening through to the dining room, modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. To the first floor there are two well proportioned bedrooms and refitted shower room, with a three piece suite and tiled walls and floor. Externally, a walled garden can be seen to the front of the property whilst to the rear, a superb landscaped garden with raised wooden deck, decorative gravel and raised beds with wooden boundaries. Double glazing and gas central heating are both installed throughout and an internal viewing is most highly recommended. Council Tax: B. EPC: D
Hmrc Directive
To be able to sell or purchase a property in the United Kingdom all agents have a legal requirement to conduct Identity checks on all customers involved in the transaction to fulfil their obligations under Anti Money Laundering regulations. We outsource this check to a third party and a charge will apply. Ask the branch for further details.

Chain free | A spacious bay-fronted three bed semi-detached requiring modernising but enjoying an elevated position with excellent potential. EPC - tbc.
No vendor chain
Enjoying an elevated position on Broadway in South Chadderton, this spacious and traditional bay-fronted, three bed semi-detached is in need of some modernisation but boasts huge potential for discerning buyers.
With scope to become a superb family home, the property enjoys sizeable living spaces across two floors and is positioned in a popular and convenient location. An ever sought after location, the property sits comfortably back off Broadway with an abundance of transport and amenities on your doorstep. With several local primary and secondary schools all within 1/2 mile, there are two easily-accessed Junctions of the M60 via Broadway and Hollinwood Avenue as well as the nearby Moston train station and Metrolink stops. There are plenty of shops nearby as well as easy access towards North Chadderton, Oldham, Failsworth and the Manchester city centre within around 6 miles.
Internally, the property comprises of a sizeable and bright entrance hallway with two separate reception rooms to the left. To the rear there is an extended galley-style kitchen. To the first floor there are three bedrooms – two doubles and a generous single – with a large bathroom completing the accommodation.

A three bedroom end of terraced house enjoying a particularly large south facing garden. EPC - C
Ryder & Dutton are delighted to bring to the market this three bedroom end of terraced house is the sought after Clarksfield area of Oldham.
To the ground floor level there is an entrance hallway, large lounge, kitchen and a conservatory with a solid roof. Upstairs, there are three bedrooms (two double and one large single), and a bathroom.
Externally, the property sits on a particularly large plot meaning the house benefits from a great sized garden, and offers the potential to extend (subject to any necessary permissions). The rear garden is also south facing, meaning it enjoys the sunshine throughout the day. Additionally, there is also a large log cabin in the garden which measures 5m x 4m and is included in the sale.
To the front of the house is a block paved driveway for off street parking.
Kestrel Avenue is located in the Clarksfield area of Oldham. This location has good transport links with bus routes operating along Lees Road just a 2 minute walk away. Oldham town centre is only a 5 minute drive away, and Lees village centre is approximately a 10 minute walk away which has a variety of shops, supermarkets, bars and restaurants.

If you're looking for a blank canvas to add your own flare to, something to add to your portfolio or simply wanting to get your foot onto the property ladder, then look no further than this good sized two bedroom terraced property in Tonge Fold! The property has undergone recent renovation work including structural work involing wall ties, replaster and redecoration. It is now ready for someone else to move in and put their own stamp on.

The home would suit a btl investment returning £750 pcm, this property would suit both buy to let investors or first time buyers alike.
Terraced homes ready to move in rarely come on the market at this price. Please call the office now to book your viewing!

Ideal for first-time buyers or savvy investors, this inviting residence is conveniently situated within walking distance to St. Catherine's Academy and a stone's throw from local amenities, ensuring both comfort and convenience at your doorstep.

Ryder & Dutton are pleased to bring to the market this much larger than average terraced house, located in the popular Bardsley area of Oldham.

about_property:
Three Storey Townhouses
Located In The Heart Of Altrincham
Brand New Development
Private Garden
Three Double Bedrooms, Two Bathrooms
EPC Rating B
Open Plan Living/Kitchen Area
Guest W/C
Undercroft Car Parking
Now Completed
Only Two x Three Bedroom Townhouses Remaining – The Downs Quarter, Altrincham
Situated in the heart of Altrincham, The Downs Quarter is a newly completed, private development featuring just four exclusive three-bedroom townhouses – and only two are still available.
Set over three floors and offering approx. 1,159 sq ft of stylish living space, each home includes three double bedrooms, with the primary suite boasting a spacious dressing room, two bathrooms, a guest W/C, and a large open-plan kitchen/living area opening onto a private garden.
Each townhouse also comes with two secure undercroft parking spaces.
Enjoy contemporary living just moments from top schools, parks, transport links, restaurants, and the buzzing Altrincham town centre.
Book your viewing now – these final homes won’t last long.
The Location
Altrincham is an affluent market town. It boasts a thriving community, offering a selection of award-winning retail, dining, drinking and leisure facilities, as well as several outstanding primary and secondary schools. It’s location close to both the cosmopolitan city of Manchester and charming Cheshire countryside adds to its appeal, with Altrincham included in The Sunday Times Best Places to Live 2022. It is not the first time the town has received this much coveted accolade, meaning its popularity remains year on year.
“a melting pot of culture for everyone to enjoy”
The Downs Quarter
35 contemporary one, two and three bedroom apartments, as well as 4 stunning three bedroom townhouses. Undercroft car parking.
A total of 39 properties will be built and 46 car parking spaces available, providing a rare opportunity to purchase a high quality, new build home in this much sought-after modern market town.
In addition to the residential properties, The Downs Quarter will offer one stand-alone commercial unit, plus four live/work houses, creating a vibrant development to work and live in one of the UK’s most desirable town centres.
About Mcgoff / Villafont Homes
The McGoff Group is an Altrincham-based, multi award-winning company with an impressive heritage spanning 48 years. Privately owned, the Group incorporates a multi-faceted collection of like-minded businesses, with construction retained at the core, and offers a holistic range of services; acquire, design, build, operate and maintain.
Villafont Homes is the residential arm of the McGoff Group.
A leading North West developer, Villafont is renowned for its design, quality, style and superior specification. The company is committed to delivering sophisticated homes, priding itself on its high build standards and immaculate finishes. Each and every Villafont home is bespoke, built with care, boasts luxurious touches and located in a desirable residential location.

Nestled in the heart of Little Lever, this four-bedroom linked detached property offers an ideal family home. Positioned in a quiet cul-de-sac on Dalebrook Close, this home is conveniently located close to local amenities, well-regarded schools, and excellent transport links.
As you step inside through the porch, you are greeted by a spacious living room. The hallway provides access to a three-piece bathroom and leads into the open-plan kitchen. The kitchen has modern integrated appliances, complemented by patio doors that open out to the rear garden, creating a wonderful indoor-outdoor flow. Adjoining the kitchen is a dedicated dining area and a versatile games room, perfect for entertaining guests or family activities.
Upstairs, you will find four well-proportioned bedrooms, each filled with natural light, and a stylish shower room for added convenience.
Externally, the property benefits from a private rear garden, perfect for family gatherings, and the front has a large driveway. The location is ideal, with Little Lever offering a range of local amenities including shops, cafes, and parks, as well as highly-rated schools such as Masefield Primary School and Little Lever School, all within close proximity.
This home is perfect for families seeking spacious living in a prime location. Viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate what this property has to offer.

This charming family home occupies a lovely plot, offering both comfort and convenience.

The delightful rear garden is a true highlight, featuring a patio seating area and a neatly manicured lawn, making it an ideal space for families with children and pets, or for anyone seeking a tranquil outdoor retreat to unwind after a long day.

Residents will enjoy excellent access to commuter links, with the M60 motorway only a short drive away. Manchester city centre is easily reachable via the adjacent A62 or the nearby Metrolink stations, ensuring that urban amenities are within easy reach.
Families will appreciate the proximity to well-regarded schools, as well as the abundance of outdoor spaces for leisure and recreation. Nearby, you will find Lower Memorial Park and Moston Brook, both of which offer lovely walks and green areas to explore.

Extended and beautifully presented, this end-terrace home on Hartley Street which is tucked away in the heart of Wardle village. Ideally located within walking distance of local amenities and the picturesque Watergrove Reservoir, it also offers excellent access to Rochdale town centre, Littleborough village, and the local train station.
Deceptively spacious and light and bright throughout, the accommodation is set over three levels. The ground floor features a generous lounge/dining area and a fully fitted kitchen. The lower ground floor offers a versatile family room and a bathroom, while the first floor hosts two bedrooms and a shower room. The property benefits from gas central heating and double glazing throughout.
Externally, the property boasts and fantastic garden and driveway which is rare to find within the village, a viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate the space and setting of this lovely home.
Lounge Diner
 (6.12m x 4.00m (20'0" x 13'1"))

Two windows to both the front and rear allows natural light to fill the space, complemented by tasteful wood detailing throughout. A feature gas stove gives the room charm and a lovely focal point. The room provides access to the kitchen via a doorway, and internal doors lead both upstairs and to a downstairs area, offering excellent flow throughout the property. Ideal for both everyday living and entertaining.

The living space is warmed by gas central heating, which is further complemented by uPVC double glazing and includes a generous entrance lobby with stairs to first floor, spacious lounge with bay window fitted with plantation shutters and limestone fire surround, separate dining room with French doors to rear garden, dining kitchen with built in appliances and downstairs wc. To the first floor: Master bedroom with bay window fitted with plantation shutters and built in wardrobes, three further double bedrooms and family bathroom with white suite and separate corner shower cubical. Externally, there is parking to the front of the property and a side pathway leading to the enclosed rear garden, with mature borders, lawn and seating area and detached garage/workshop.

about_property:
Five Bedroom Detached House
Spacious Open-Plan Dining Kitchen
Fantastic Opportunity to Create a Dream Family Residence
Generous Room Sizes Throughout
Private Rear Garden
Viewing Recommended
Located in the heart of Whitley on a quiet residential street, this extended and detached family home on Walter Scott Road offers impressive living space, spanning over 1,327 square feet.
The property features a spacious open-plan dining kitchen, five well-proportioned bedrooms, and a family shower room. With generous room sizes throughout, the home also benefits from a sunny, rear garden — ideal for families and entertaining.
Presented as a blank canvas, the home provides excellent potential for modernisation or further extension, making it a fantastic opportunity to create a dream family residence in a highly sought-after location. With outstanding local schools and excellent transport links close by, this is a prime spot for families.
The accommodation begins with an entrance hallway that leads into a bright and welcoming open-plan lounge and dining area, centred around a cosy fireplace. At the rear of the home, the kitchen is fitted with a range of wall and base units, an eye-level oven, and provides internal access to the integral garage. A convenient ground floor cloakroom is also located off the kitchen, with a door opening into the garden.
Upstairs, the first floor offers five bedrooms, some of which benefit from built-in storage, and a modern three-piece family shower room.
Externally, the property boasts a large brick paved driveway, edged by lawns and leading to the integral garage. The rear garden is private, secure, and is currently laid to lawn with a flagged patio area. There is also a further brock built store/ workshop however this could be easily converted to a work from home space if needed.
Offered with no onward chain, this spacious and versatile home in the desirable area of Whitley is now available for viewings and offers an exciting opportunity for families looking to make a home their own.

This impressive and thoughtfully extended five-bedroom end of terrace property presents a fantastic opportunity for large or growing families seeking spacious and versatile living in a sought-after residential location. Boasting a wealth of desirable features, this home is ready to move into and offers a superb blend of modern living and practicality.
Step inside via the welcoming porch and into a bright and airy hallway that leads to a generously sized living room, perfect for relaxation and family gatherings. The contemporary fitted kitchen seamlessly flows into the dining room, creating an open-plan feel ideal for entertaining. French doors from the dining area provide direct access to the low-maintenance rear garden, extending your living space outdoors.
A significant advantage of this property is the spacious ground floor bedroom complete with its own WC, offering excellent flexibility for guests, elderly relatives, or those seeking single-level living.
The first floor features four further well-proportioned bedrooms, two of which benefit from fitted wardrobes, providing ample storage. Completing the upper level is a modern family bathroom equipped with a bath and overhead shower, WC, and wash basin.
Externally, the property offers convenience and practicality with a block-paved driveway providing ample off-road parking. To the rear, the low-maintenance garden offers a private space for outdoor enjoyment. Furthermore, the property benefits from a detached garage, offering additional storage or parking options. Embracing modern efficiency, the property is also equipped with solar panels, contributing to reduced energy costs.

For sale by live stream auction on Tuesday 2nd September 2025 at 12PM.
* guide price £132,000+
Two Bedroom Grade 2 Listed Mill Conversion with great features 20 minute walk to Manchester.
This a rare opportunity to live in a Grade II* listed building - Victoria Mill in Miles Platting is perfect for investment.
Sitting beside Rochdale Canal and at the centre of a district once at the heart of Manchester's industrial revolution, Victoria Mill is designed beautifully and feels rustic and modern at the same time.
The building has been restored to retain the charm of its old identity whilst making it perfect for modern city living.
The stairwell curling up through the chimney makes for a grand entrance while the flat itself has been built to high standards; carpeted throughout, with sizable rooms, and windows that give you plenty of Manchester's sunny skies.
There are parks aplenty around the Mill and the Northern Quarter is just a canal walk away.
This building is a perfect example of the past and the future of Manchester with City Sky Line views, canal walk and urban featured living.
Auction house are yet to inspect the property, however we believe accommodation comprises:
Open Plan Kitchen/Living Area - Open plan kitchen and living space. Fully fitted modern kitchen, open to one of the bedrooms.
Bedroom One - Access through from the living area. Large feature windows and spacious room.
Bedroom Two - Size double bedroom is currently being used as an extra living space.
Bathroom- suite is gorgeous with vanity and walk-in rain shower.
Internal Pictures & Floor Plan to follow
Lease Length - 125 years from and including 1 January 2014 to and including 31 December 2138
Ground Rent - tbc

Beautifully Presented Two-Bedroom End Terrace in the Heart of Tyldesley.
Ideally positioned just a short stroll from Tyldesley’s vibrant town centre, this charming and immaculately presented two-bedroom end-terrace home offers both comfort and convenience in equal measure. With shops, cafes, schools, and excellent transport links—including the popular guided busway—right on the doorstep, this property is perfect for first-time buyers, downsizers, or buy-to-let investors.
Set back from the road behind a small, welcoming front yard, the home opens into a bright entrance porch leading through to a spacious and cosy sitting room. Here, a stunning feature log-burning stove creates a warm and inviting focal point, ideal for relaxing evenings at home.
To the rear, a stylish and well-appointed kitchen boasts a generous range of wall and base units, ample workspace, and room for freestanding appliances. The adjoining dining area is perfect for everyday meals or entertaining guests, and there's also a handy under-stairs storage cupboard for added practicality. A rear door opens out to the enclosed, low-maintenance yard—an ideal outdoor space for seating —with double wooden gates providing access to off-road parking via Blossom Street.
Upstairs, the property continues to impress. The spacious master bedroom occupies the front of the home and offers plenty of room for furniture and storage. To the rear is a second generously sized bedroom, along with a sleek and modern three-piece family bathroom, featuring contemporary and stylish fixtures.
Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate what this delightful home has to offer.

Millbrooke Estate Agents are delighted to offer for sale this impressive 4-bedroom detached house. Nestled in a prime spot on the popular Boothshall Way in the desirable Boothstown area, and occupying a substantial plot. This fantastic home offers a perfect blend of space and style, ideal for modern family living. Boasting a freehold ownership, the property features immaculate front and rear gardens meticulously landscaped to perfection. Extensive outdoor living space, perfect for entertaining guests or relaxing in tranquillity. The property's rear elevation has been thoughtfully extended, adding to the overall spaciousness and charm of this residence. With four generously sized double bedrooms and two bathrooms, this home provides ample accommodation for a growing family. Further enhancing its appeal, the property comes with driveway parking for multiple vehicles, EV charging and a single garage, providing convenient and secure parking options.
Internally, the property offers circa 1800 sq.ft of accommodation which briefly comprises an entrance hall with understair storage and a guest w/c, a spacious lounge with a fireplace and a bay window, a dining room, and a fantastic garden room/second reception. A stylish oak kitchen with granite work surfaces, a utility room, an office/study and a single garage. To the first floor are four spacious double bedrooms, all with integrated storage/wardrobe space, and an en-suite to the master bedroom, plus a three-piece family bathroom. Additional storage space is available in the boarded loft.
The outdoor space of this property is truly a standout feature, offering a private and serene escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The expansive, low-maintenance gardens surrounding the home are ideal for those seeking a peaceful retreat.
With access to excellent local amenities and superb transport links, this property is perfectly situated for those looking for a convenient and connected lifestyle. Located within the catchment area for the esteemed St Andrews CofE Primary school, this home offers a prime opportunity to reside in a highly sought-after location that values education and community. You will also be within a short stroll of the village centre, family pubs, shops, bars and restaurants. The nearby Bridgewater Canal and the rhs Bridgewater Gardens. Excellent transport links with local bus routes and just a short drive to the M60 Ring Road and A580 East Lancashire Road.
To truly grasp the beauty and potential of this property, a viewing is highly recommended. Don't miss out on the chance to make this stunning residence your own and enjoy the benefits of luxurious living in a prime location.

Upstairs, the accommodation comprises one double bedroom, one single bedroom, and a three-piece bathroom suite with an over-bath shower. Additional benefits include gas central heating throughout.
Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process
Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process:
Step 1
 - Register your interest
Step 2
 - Prepare your finances for the purchase
Step 3
 - Arrange a viewing
Step 4
 - Make an offer
Step 5
 - Secure your sale using our secure system
Step 6
 - Exchange and complete

about_property:
Three bedroom end terrace family home
No chain vendor
Immaculate throughout
Large secluded rear garden
Off road parking
Scope for A downstairs WC
Quiet location
Walking distance to tram stop
Close links to manchester airport, wythenshawe hospital, local schools and shops
UPVC - GCH - multi fuel log burner
Description
Located on the Newhey Avenue in Wythenshawe, Manchester, this spacious three-bedroom end terraced house is offered for sale with no onward chain. Beautifully maintained and presented to an immaculate standard throughout, this appealing family home presents a fantastic opportunity for a wide range of buyers, including growing families, first-time buyers and investors alike.
Upon entering the property, you are greeted by a generously proportioned reception room which benefits from a multi-fuel log burner, creating a warm and inviting living space. This leads into the bright and modern kitchen, which boasts ample storage and room for dining. The ground floor also provides scope to be reconfigured to incorporate a downstairs WC, offering buyers even greater flexibility. Upstairs, there are three well-sized bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom, all decorated to a high standard and ready to move into.
Externally, the property truly excels. The large, secluded rear garden offers an ideal space for entertaining or simply unwinding during the warmer months, surrounded by mature shrubs and fencing to ensure privacy. The drive to the front provides off-road parking ? A much-coveted feature in the area.
The location is equally impressive. This home is situated in a quiet and family-friendly neighbourhood within walking distance of the local tram stop, ensuring swift access to Manchester city centre and neighbouring areas. Manchester Airport is just 10 minutes away by car, making it perfect for frequent travellers, while Wythenshawe Hospital, one of the region's key healthcare providers, is also nearby.
There is a wide variety of local supermarkets within a short drive, including Tesco, Aldi and Asda, ensuring everyday essentials are always within reach. Several local schools rated 'Good' by Ofsted are located close by, making this an ideal location for families with children of all ages. Leisure facilities including parks, gyms and sports centres are also easily accessible, along with local shops, caf?s and other amenities.
This attractive end terrace benefits from uPVC double glazing and gas central heating throughout, and its excellent location combined with immaculate presentation and thoughtful layout make it a must-see. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the space, comfort and convenience this superb property has to offer. Asking Price: £239,950.
Ground Floor
Entrance Hall
With polished oak flooring, meter cupboard, leading to ground floor rooms.
Living Room
 (14' (4m 26cm) 6'' x 10' (3m 4cm))
Spacious living room with polished oak flooring, feature multi-fuel burner with a tiled hearth and cast iron surround, radiator, uPVC double glazed window to the rear aspect. Ample space for free standing living room furniture.
Dining Kitchen
 (14' (4m 26cm) x 8' (2m 43cm) 2'')
Great size kitchen diner with tiled flooring, ample base and eye level units with wooden work tops and tiled splash backs, integrated four ring gas hob with electric oven and extractor hood over, space and plumbing for white goods, two uPVC double glazed windows giving extra light, pantry cupboard, ample space for dining table and chairs.
Utility Room
Space for storage to one side and plumbing in situ for the introduction of a downstairs WC.
First Floor
Bedroom One
 (10' (3m 4cm) 9'' x 10' (3m 4cm) 11'')
First double bedroom with wood laminate to floor, radiator, cupboard, uPVC double glazed window to the rear aspect, ample space for double bed and free standing bedroom furniture.
Bedroom Two
 (12' (3m 65cm) 7'' x 8' (2m 43cm) 4'')
Second double bedroom with wood laminate to floor, radiator, uPVC double glazed window to the rear aspect, ample space for double bed and free standing bedroom furniture.
Bedroom Three
 (9' (2m 74cm) 5'' x 7' (2m 13cm) 2'')
Large single bedroom with wood laminate to floor, radiator, uPVC double glazed window to the front aspect, ample space for single bed and free standing bedroom furniture.
Family Bathroom
Modern bathroom suite boasting panel bath with shower over and glass shower screen, pedestal hand wash basin, low level WC, tiled walls and vinyl to floor, extractor fan, uPVC double glazed window to the front aspect.
Outside
To the front there is a paved driveway for off road parking with a wooden gate leading into the expansive South facing rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a raised paved patio area bordered by wood panel fencing.

Upon entering the property, you are welcomed by a spacious entrance hall that provides access to the ground floor WC, ensuring convenience for both residents and guests alike. The property features a beautifully fitted dining kitchen, complete with a range of modern appliances, perfect for culinary enthusiasts and those who enjoy hosting gatherings.
The generous lounge area is flooded with natural light, thanks to large patio doors that open out to the rear garden, creating a seamless connection between the indoors and outdoors. The three bedrooms offer ample space, with two benefiting from fitted/built-in furniture, maximising storage options and creating a sleek and organised living environment.
The property further boasts a modern en suite in addition to a family bathroom, finished to the highest standards, providing residents with a touch of luxury in the comfort of their own home. The stunning rear garden serves as a tranquil retreat, ideal for relaxation and outdoor entertaining. Completing the exterior is a detached garage and driveway, offering convenient parking solutions for multiple vehicles.
Conveniently located close to the border with Whitefield, residents benefit from easy access to the motorway, ensuring swift commutes and enabling exploration of the surrounding areas. This property presents an ideal opportunity for individuals and families seeking a contemporary home in a prime location, offering a harmonious blend of style, comfort, and practicality.

Beautifully Extended Three-Bedroom Semi-Detached Home.
Situated in a popular and convenient location just moments from the Parsonage Retail Park and a choice of supermarkets, this beautifully presented and thoughtfully extended three-bedroom semi-detached property on Angus Avenue is perfectly tailored for modern family living.
The property comprises a welcoming entrance hallway leading into a spacious front-facing sitting room. This bright and comfortable space features double internal doors that open into the dining area, creating a wonderful flow between rooms. The dining area is flooded with natural light thanks to a skylight window and patio doors that open out to the rear garden—making it an ideal space for entertaining or family meals.
Seamlessly connected to the dining space is a well-appointed kitchen offering a range of wall and base units, dual aspect windows, and a door providing access back into the hallway. The ground floor also benefits from a handy downstairs W.C., adding to the home's practicality.
Upstairs, the accommodation includes a generous master bedroom with built-in storage to the front, a spacious double bedroom at the rear, and a further double bedroom created by the extension—ideal for children, guests, or a home office. Completing the first floor is a modern three-piece family bathroom.
Externally, the property boasts a driveway providing off-road parking, and to the rear is a fantastic family-sized garden with both patio and lawn areas—perfect for outdoor living and play.

about_property:
End terrace family home
Ideal first time buy or investment
No chain
Living room & kitchen
Two bedrooms & family bathroom
Rear courtyard
Close to local amenities & transport networks
Viewing is highly recommended
Located in a popular residential area close to local amenities and excellent transport links, this well-presented two-bedroom end-terrace family home on Newport Road, M34 offers a move-in-ready opportunity, having been freshly painted throughout and benefitting from a new boiler fitted just two years ago. With no upward chain, it’s an ideal purchase for first-time buyers, downsizers, or investors seeking a straightforward transaction.
The property opens directly into the living room, a bright and welcoming space with fresh neutral décor, providing a comfortable setting for everyday relaxation. From here, the layout flows into the fitted kitchen, equipped with a range of wall and base units, complementary worktops, and space for appliances.
To the first floor, there are two well-proportioned bedrooms, each freshly decorated to offer a clean, modern finish. The family bathroom is fitted with a three-piece suite, including a bath with shower over, wash basin, and W.C., providing functionality and scope for personalisation.
Externally, the property benefits from a low-maintenance rear courtyard, offering space for outdoor seating, container planting, or simply a private spot to enjoy in warmer months. Being an end-terrace, the home also enjoys additional privacy compared to mid-terrace alternatives.
Positioned in a convenient location, the property is close to shops, schools, parks, and public transport links, with easy access to main roads connecting Manchester, Stockport, and surrounding areas.
With its fresh décor, recent boiler installation, and no upward chain, this charming end-terrace home is ready for its next owner. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate its potential and appeal.

Located on the Desirable Bridgewater Development just a Short Walk to Monton Village
Perfect First Time Buy
Spacious Lounge
Modern High Gloss Fitted Kitchen and Dining Space
Three Bedrooms
Three Piece Bathroom Suite and Guest W.C.
Off Road Parking for Multiple Cars & Rear Garden Benefitting from the Sun all day
Situated within Winton on the desirable Bridgewater development and overlooking the scenic Bridgewater Canal!
This Fabulous three bedroom semi-detached property is perfect for both families and first time buyers alike. With a spacious lounge which seamlessly flows on through to the sleek high gloss finished kitchen and dining space, flooded with natural light beaming in through the French doors that open on to the rear garden. Completing the ground floor is the guest bathroom which adds convenience to any busy household.
Head up to the first floor where you will find the three tastefully decorated bedrooms, two double alongside the generous single. Complementing the three rooms is the modern fitted three piece bathroom suite complete with shower over the tub.
Externally this property offers off road parking for multiple cars, with gated access leading through to the sun drenched rear garden that boasts a well maintained lawn and paved patio.
A stand out feature of this lovely home is its proximity to Monton village which is located just a short walk down the Bridgewater canal, whilst a five minute walk in the opposite direction leads you to Patricroft train station offering easy access to Manchester City Centre, Manchester airport and Liverpool. For families seeking a quality education for their children, the property falls perfectly within catchment for sought after schooling. The above are just a few aspects that make this property an excellent find, book your viewing and see first hand!
EPC Rating: B
Location
Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus.

Manchester commuter belt
Around half a mile to train link
Extensively modernised throughout
Prime position opposite Star Lodge
High quality thoughtful finish

This property has been extensively modernised in recent years and has been finished with flair and style.
The accommodation offers great flexibility and by its original design is spread over three floors. To the ground floor there is a versatile living room/bedroom which opens to the garden. There is also a dswc and a utility zone has been created to the rear of the garage.
To the first floor there is a bright L-shaped living area with three windows and an attractive dining kitchen to the rear.
The first floor includes the regular bedroom spaces with two double bedrooms and one single bedroom all of which are served by the family bathroom whilst the master bedroom enjoys an ensuite. The bathrooms have been one of the more recent jobs and subsequently in line with popular modern choices of tiling and furniture.
It is also worthy of note that during the last eight years items such as the boiler, windows soffits and facias and kitchen have been renewed.
The properties in this specific part of the development opposite Star Lodge are seldom placed into the open market and an early viewing should be considered essential.
The property is Leasehold for a term of 999 years from 1st January 2001 subject to the payment of a yearly Ground Rent of £100
Council Tax is Band D - £2,297.19
Butterwick Fields is a modern development located between Horwich and Blackrod and has excellent access to Blackrod train station which is on the mainline to Manchester. The modern development has achieved consistent rates of sale over the years and in particular this home, which is located close to Star Lodge is classed as one of the strongest positions within the development.
For those not familiar with the town, Horwich has a small centre with a good variety of largely independently owned shops and services together with cafes, pubs and restaurants. A consistently strong feature of the town is the surrounding countryside which includes a stretch of the West Pennine moors and a number of reservoirs, whilst the nearby village of Adlington plays host to a stretch of the Leeds Liverpool canal. This balance of surrounding countryside yet convenient access to the aforementioned train station and also links to the M61 attract many people to settle within the area. The town offers several nurseries, primary and secondary schools.

A spacious and extended two-bedroom semi-detached home in a popular residential area of Swinton, offering excellent potential for modernisation. Featuring a single-storey rear extension, generous driveway, double garage, and both front and rear garde
Nestled within a well-established residential area of Swinton, this extended brick-built semi-detached property offers a fantastic opportunity for buyers seeking a home with scope to personalise. Set on a generous plot, it boasts a double driveway, double garage, and both front and rear gardens, making it an ideal choice for those looking for a home with space and potential.
The property has been extended to the rear with a single-storey addition, creating a more spacious dining and reception area that complements the main living space. Internally, the home features two bedrooms, a family bathroom, and a bright main lounge. A new boiler was installed around two years ago, and while the home is fully functional and benefits from double glazing throughout, it would benefit from modernisation and general cosmetic attention to bring it up to date.
The rear garden offers a private outdoor space with side access and plenty of room for planting or landscaping, while the double garage provides excellent additional parking or workshop potential.
The surrounding area is popular with families and commuters alike. Several well-rated schools are located nearby, including Co-op Academy Swinton and St. Mary's rc Primary School, both within easy reach. For commuters, the property is ideally situated with access to the A580 East Lancashire Road and nearby Swinton railway station offering quick links into Manchester city centre. Regular bus services also operate along Chorley Road and surrounding routes.
Local amenities include a range of shops, cafes, and supermarkets, as well as Swinton Square Shopping Centre. Residents also benefit from proximity to green spaces such as Victoria Park and Clifton Country Park, perfect for weekend walks, cycling, or time with family outdoors.
With great transport links, schools, and a strong sense of community, this semi-detached property presents an ideal renovation project or long-term home in a desirable and well-connected location.
Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £5,000. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process
Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process:
Step 1
 - Register your interest
Step 2
 - Prepare your finances for the purchase
Step 3
 - Arrange a viewing
Step 4
 - Make an offer
Step 5
 - Secure your sale using our secure system
Step 6
 - Exchange and complete

about_property:
Located in the vibrant and ever-popular area of Longsight, this two-bedroom mid-terraced home on Hopkins Street offers a fantastic opportunity for first-time buyers or buy-to-let investors. Ideally positioned just off the A6 and within walking distance of the renowned Longsight Market, the property enjoys a central location with excellent access to local amenities, schools, and public transport links into Manchester city centre and surrounding areas.
The ground floor comprises a welcoming front living room, perfect for relaxing or entertaining, leading through to a separate dining room that offers a versatile space for family meals or a home office setup. At the rear, a kitchen extension provides ample space for cooking and storage, with direct access to the enclosed rear yard – a private and low-maintenance outdoor area ideal for enjoying warmer days or additional utility use.
Upstairs, the property features two well-proportioned double bedrooms, both offering good natural light and comfortable living space. A modern family bathroom completes the first-floor layout, making this home practical for couples, small families, or professional tenants.
Externally, the home benefits from on-street parking to the front and a private rear yard, enhancing its appeal to both owner-occupiers and potential tenants. With strong rental demand in the area and continued regeneration throughout Longsight, this property represents a solid investment opportunity as well as an affordable step onto the property ladder.

A flexible layout and quality presentation are the key factors to this home which offers something a little different and should stand out from the crowd.
There is one first floor bedroom with the further accommodation being positioned to the ground floor which includes three reception rooms, one of which is fitted as an office. A main family bathroom and two double bedrooms, one of which includes an ensuite.
To the rear, there is a modern kitchen which opens to a large rear garden and the front includes a large, gated driveway with attractive landscaping.

A home, which is located in a particularly convenient position, allowing superb access to both motorway and train links. Both junction 6 of the M61 and Horwich Parkway train station are around 1 mile away. There is also excellent access to both primary and secondary schools.
The area is equally ideal for access to nearby amenities which include a large retail development which is around half a mile away, whilst Horwich Centre is around 1.5 miles away.
The area is conveniently placed for the excellent outdoor facilities the town has on offer. A simple satellite view of the location nicely illustrates this. Georges Lane for example which is a primary route towards Rivington Pike and the surrounding hills is around 1.5 miles away. A footpath leads from the top of Austins Lane itself into open fields. The town includes a nice variety of sports facilities including rackets and sports clubs, gyms and golf courses etc.
In summary, the area has long been well regarded largely due to the excellent balance of access to amenities countryside and transport links alike and we would certainly recommend an early viewing.

about_property:
Manchester commuter belt
Around 0.5 miles to train station
Excellent location with great access to surrounding countryside
Five double bedrooms
Master bedroom with ensuite and dressing room
Family bathroom plus dswc
Garage currently used as a gym
High-quality presentation throughout

A large home which is presented to a fantastic standard throughout and in one of the premier locations within this popular development.
Positioned fronting Star Lodge the private aspect should allow the home to stand out from the crowd and the property enjoys varying views over the seasons.
A particularly strong characteristic to this design are the bedrooms which are all double sizes and the master itself runs the full depth of the dwelling and is able to include both dressing area and ensuite. In some similar designs we have seen an additional bathroom installed to the second floor should this be needed.
The ground floor has been reconfigured from the original layout and includes a stunning dining kitchen with a number of integral appliances and the primary living space similar to the ensuite runs the full depth of the home and includes an aspect to both the front and rear and houses a fantastic media wall plus contemporary fire.
For those families with an emphasis on generous bedroom sizes this home should be ideal.
To the outside there is a long driveway leading to a garage which has laterally been repurposed to be used as a gym and the landscaping to the rear garden has been very thoughtfully completed.
The property is Leasehold for a term of 999 years from 1st January 2001 subject to the payment of a yearly Ground Rent of £100
Council Tax is Band F - £3,318.18
Butterwick Fields is a modern development located between Horwich and Blackrod and has excellent access to Blackrod train station which is on the mainline to Manchester. The modern development has achieved consistent rates of sale over the years and in particular this home, which is located close to Star Lodge is classed as one of the strongest positions within the development.
For those not familiar with the town, Horwich has a small centre with a good variety of largely independently owned shops and services together with cafes, pubs and restaurants. A consistently strong feature of the town is the surrounding countryside which includes a stretch of the West Pennine moors and a number of reservoirs, whilst the nearby village of Adlington plays host to a stretch of the Leeds Liverpool canal. This balance of surrounding countryside yet convenient access to the aforementioned train station and also links to the M61 attract many people to settle within the area. The town offers several nurseries, primary and secondary schools.
Entrance Hallway
6' 7" x 5' 9" (2.01m x 1.75m) narrowing to 2' 11" x 15' 7" (0.89m x 4.75m) Tiled flooring with hanging space and under stairs storage. Natural light through rear window. Stairs to first floor landing.

The kitchen has been recently updated and fitted with wall and base units, the integrated appliances include; Miele steam oven and warming drawer, dishwasher, instant hot water tap, made to measure oven, hob and extractor. Gas central heating boiler concealed within the units.
Tiled floor throughout.

A superb, spacious, two bedroom top floor apartment situated on a modern development in a sought-after area within Bury. Situated just off Walmersley Road it is within walking distance to Bury Town Centre as well as having great access to local amenities, bus routes, the tram, and the motorway networks (M60, M66, M61, M65).
The property comprises; a hallway, a generous kitchen/lounge/diner with a feature electric fireplace to the lounge area and integrated appliances to the recently new kitchen, two double bedrooms with built in furniture to both of them, a three-piece bathroom suite and an ensuite to the main bedroom. The property benefits from electric heating, double glazing, security key entry and intercom access. Externally there is an allocated car parking space, access to visitor spaces, communal gardens, and only a short walk to Clarence Park.
This property is also suitable for investors as there is a tenant currently in the apartment paying £8700 per annum. Due to the current rental demand there is potential to increase the income to £10,740 per annum.
Lifestyle Sales and Lettings urge interested parties to arrange an internal inspection as soon as possible to avoid disappointment. This property has no onward chain.
