Stylish semi-detached home with character features, modern kitchen, two bedrooms, and a sleek bathroom. Ideally located near parks, schools, shops, and strong transport links. Move-in ready - perfect for first-time buyers or investors. Book your view
This attractive semi-detached home offers stylish, ready-to-move-into accommodation across two well-planned levels. The property opens into a welcoming lounge featuring a bay window and tasteful flooring, perfect for everyday living. The modern fitted kitchen provides generous worktop space, integrated cooking facilities and contemporary units, with direct access to the rear.
Upstairs, two well-proportioned bedrooms sit alongside a sleek bathroom with modern tiling and shower-over-bath, accessed via a central landing. Throughout the home, there are characterful design touches, such as exposed brickwork and wooden flooring, blending traditional charm with modern finishes.
Outside, the rear garden offers a blend of patio and lawn, with leafy surroundings creating a private feel. Steps lead up to the front entrance, and there is further outdoor space that may be suitable for bin or bike storage.
The property is located within a well-established residential neighbourhood offering easy access to local amenities and green open spaces. Stamford Park and the Peak Forest Canal are nearby, offering ideal settings for weekend walks, cycling or relaxing outdoors. The area is also a short distance from the scenic Tame Valley, with multiple parks and nature trails to explore.
Families will benefit from nearby schools, including Stamford High School and Alder Community High, both of which are easily reached. Local primary schools are also within walking distance, and public transport links support access to additional education options further afield.
For commuters, the area offers strong rail and road connectivity. Stalybridge and Mossley train stations provide frequent services to Manchester, Huddersfield and Leeds, while local bus services link surrounding villages and town centres. Junctions for the M60 and M67 motorways are within convenient reach for travel by car.
A number of independent cafes, restaurants and local shops are within walking distance, with larger supermarkets and high street stores a short drive away. Tameside Hospital and key health services are also easily accessible.
A brilliant opportunity for first-time buyers or buy-to-let investors alike. Early viewing is highly recommended to secure interest.
Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process
Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process:
Step 1
 - Register your interest
Step 2
 - Prepare your finances for the purchase
Step 3
 - Arrange a viewing
Step 4
 - Make an offer
Step 5
 - Secure your sale using our secure system
Step 6
 - Exchange and complete

Situated within a new build, gated development, this immaculately presented three-bedroom terraced house exudes charm and sophistication. Boasting a spacious, light, and airy lounge ideal for unwinding or entertaining guests, this property offers a modern fitted kitchen/dining room room that seamlessly opens to the rear garden, perfect for indoor-outdoor living. The ground floor also features a convenient downstairs cloakroom/W.C. Upstairs, three good-sized bedrooms, along with a contemporary family bathroom, provide ample space for comfortable living. With a laid to lawn garden at the rear, complemented by a spacious patio area, this property offers a picturesque outdoor setting for relaxation and outside dining. The property also includes a driveway for off-road parking with an EV charging point, as well as solar pv panles ensuring energy efficeincy with an impressive EPC rating of * A *. In addition to its exceptional features, this property enjoys the convenience of being within walking distance to shops and amenities, making it an ideal home for those seeking luxury and convenience. (freehold tenure)
The outdoor space of this property truly enhances the lifestyle it offers, with a laid to lawn garden at the rear providing a peaceful setting for outdoor enjoyment and family activities. The spacious patio area is perfect for hosting gatherings or summer barbecues. Additionally, the property's driveway offers off-road parking with an EV charging point, catering to modern living needs and sustainability. The presence of solar pv panles underscores the property's commitment to energy efficiency, reflected in its impressive * A * EPC rating. Located within easy reach of shops and amenities, this property not only offers luxurious living spaces but also a location that effortlessly integrates convenience and comfort. Within the catchment area for highly regarded schools and close to pleasant dog walks, enjoy the best of both indoor and outdoor worlds in this stunning residence.

Locate are proud to present this very well presented three bedroom semi-detached home, perfectly positioned in the ever-popular Stretford area.
This superb property has been beautifully maintained by the current owners and is offered in true turn-key condition, ready for you to simply move in and enjoy.
Internally, the accommodation comprises multiple reception rooms offering flexible living space to suit a variety of needs, from relaxing family areas to entertaining and dining. Upstairs, you’ll find three generously proportioned bedrooms alongside a well-appointed bathroom.
Externally, the home continues to impress. To the front and side, an extensive block-paved driveway provides off-road parking for several vehicles. To the rear, a recently landscaped garden creates a fantastic outdoor space perfect for both children and adults alike.
Situated in the heart of Stretford, the location is second to none. You’ll benefit from outstanding transport links including easy access to the Metrolink, the M60 motorway, and excellent bus routes connecting you to Manchester city centre and beyond. The area also boasts a range of well-regarded schools, ideal for families, and is currently undergoing exciting redevelopment, enhancing its appeal and vibrant community feel even further.
This is a fantastic opportunity to secure a spacious, ready-to-move-into home in a thriving location. Early viewing is highly recommended.

Fabulous First Time Buy
Tucked away on a Quiet Cul De Sac within Winton Village
Open Plan Layout to the Ground Floor
Conservatory Offering Additional Living Space
Two Double Bedrooms, One with Fitted Wardrobes
Modern Three Piece Bathroom Suite

Located Close to Excellent Amenities, Including Highly Sought after Schooling & Brilliant Transport Links
Tucked away within a small cul de sac is this fabulous first time buy boasting open plan living to the ground floor and a conservatory offering additional living space.
As you enter the house, you are greeted by the bright and airy open-plan layout of the ground floor, which creates a spacious and inviting atmosphere. The living area seamlessly flows into the conservatory, a versatile space that can be utilised to suit your lifestyle.
Upstairs, you will find two double bedrooms, one of which features fitted wardrobes, offering ample storage solutions. Whilst the modern three-piece bathroom suite adds a touch of luxury to the property.
The low-maintenance garden to the rear of the property is perfect for enjoying the outdoors without the hassle of extensive upkeep. Additionally, the allocated parking space ensures convenience and security for your vehicle.
Situated in close proximity to excellent amenities, including highly sought-after schooling options and brilliant transport links, this property offers a convenient and comfortable lifestyle for its residents. Whether you need easy access to schools for your family or quick transportation options for your daily commute, this location has it all.
Location
Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus.

about_property:
Fantastic access into open countryside
Manchester commuter belt
Both primary and secondary schools nearby
Able to function as a bungalow and two storey house depending on preference
Long driveway plus front and rear gardens
Around half a mile into Horwich town centre
Mainline train link around 1.5 miles
Modern presentation throughout
Three living areas
Solar panels and air source heat pump included to reduce running costs
A detached Freehold property which offers extremely flexible accommodation and is able to function as a bungalow or a regular two storey home depending on preferences.
There are four bedrooms in total, two to the first floor and two to the ground floor with bathrooms at both ground and first floor level.
There are three living areas, and the individual reception room is a particularly good size and plays host to a log burner.
As you will see in the photographs, the presentation is of a modern style throughout with one of the most recent jobs being the bathroom which was replaced around four years ago.
Please note that there is both solar panels and an air source heat pump installed during 2020 with the intention of being able to reduce running costs in the long-term
The seller informs us that the property is Freehold
Council Tax is Band C - £2,041.91
Malvern Close is positioned close to Pennine Road and consists of semi-detached and detached properties. The location provides an excellent balance of access to the consistently popular nearby countryside and also towards the transport links that serve the town so well. These links include access to the M61 and two train stations which are situated on the main line to Manchester.
From a commercial aspect Horwich has a 'traditional' town centre with a good number of shops and services and there is also a large out of town retail and leisure complex close to the Toughsheet football stadium. The town includes several nurseries, primary school and secondary schools with education through to a-Level.
All in all, we feel this package on offer is rather family friendly and will no doubt be of particular interest to those people who wish to spend time in and around the hills which form an impressive backdrop to the town.

House style: The Hartford
Spacious 4 bedroom detached
Tenure: Freehold

Early internal viewing recommended
Millbrooke Estate Agents are thrilled to bring to market this beautiful, four double bedroom detached, Eccleston Homes - The Hartford. Built in circa 2019 and occupying a prime plot, with views of St John's Church to the rear. If you are looking for well well-presented, high specification property with an abundance of living space, then this is for you. The owners have finished the property to an excellent standard throughout with several upgrades such as Amtico lvt flooring, quality blinds and integrated Neff appliances. The tenure of the property is freehold, and it is offered with no onward chain!
Comprising an entrance hall with under-stair storage, a single garage, a vast and bright kitchen/family room to the rear opening onto the low-maintenance, landscaped rear garden, a utility room, a guest W/C, and a dining room/second reception to the front elevation. To the first floor is a landing and airing cupboard, master bedroom with en-suite, second double bedroom, third double bedroom, a spacious fourth bedroom/study, and a contemporary three-piece family bathroom with a shower over the bath.
Externally, the property has driveway parking to the front elevation for up to 2 cars + ample on-street parking. Side access and a stunning, low-maintenance east-facing landscaped rear garden. Ideally situated within walking distance of two excellent local primary schools. Excellent transport links with the newly constructed guided busway just a short walk away and within a short drive of the A580 East Lancashire Road and the M60 Ring Road. Many local amenities, including shops, bars, restaurants and the recently opened Parr Bridge Retail Park with various shops, cafes and a gymnasium.

about_property:
Perfect First Time Buy Located in the Heart of Monton Village
Spacious Lounge
Open Plan Fitted Kitchen and Formal Dining Space with Exposed Brick Fireplace
Two Double Bedrooms
Three Piece Bathroom Suite
Gated, Low Maintenance Front & Rear Gardens
Surrounded by a Plethora of Amenities Including Shops, Bars, Restaurants & Beautiful Scenic Walks
Well Served by Public Transport and Motorway Links
Opportunity to Create Your Perfect Home
Welcoming to the market this brilliant terrace property located in the heart of Monton Village, offering the perfect opportunity for first-time buyers or downsizers to create their dream home. As you step inside, you are greeted by a spacious lounge, which leads through to the formal dining space that’s open plan with the fitted kitchen. The eye catching exposed brick fireplace creates a lovely centre piece and character to this brilliant property.
Head up to the first floor the property comes complete with two double bedrooms, the master a lovely bright room positioned to the front of the house and the second, positioned to the rear comes complete with fitted storage. Complementing the two bedrooms is the three piece bathroom suite.
This property boasts gated, low maintenance front and rear gardens, providing a private outdoor space to enjoy. Surrounded by a plethora of amenities, including shops, bars, restaurants, and beautiful scenic walks, residents will have everything they need right at their doorstep.
For those who rely on public transport or need quick access to motorway links, this property is well served, ensuring ease of travel to key destinations. Whether commuting to work or exploring the surrounding areas, convenience is guaranteed.
With the opportunity to create your perfect home, this property presents endless possibilities for customisation and personalisation.

EPC Rating: D
Location
Monton village is a highly sought after, thriving village within close proximity of Manchester City Centre. With boutique and independent retailers dotted along Monton Road, Monton’s range of shops give the area character – you can find a specialist craft beer bottle shop, a jewellers and a home and lifestyle shop along the main shopping street, to name but a few. With an amazing range of coffee shops, bars and restaurants, Monton is a great place to go out to eat. You’ll find bars with heated terraces suitable for alfresco dining, wine and cocktail bars and venues that provide live music – there is a real buzz around Monton! On the edge of Monton village is the Historic Bridgewater Canal, perfect for weekend walks. The picturesque Roe Green Loopline Heritage Trail is a convenient circular walk that begins and ends in Monton village, taking you along the canal towpath. Monton has schools of a consistently high standard, including Branwood Preparatory School and Monton Green Primary School which have consistently received Good Ofsted reports. Situated between the M602 and the A580 East Lancs Road, the village of Monton is only a 20 minute drive from Manchester city centre and a 10 minute drive from MediaCity. Monton village is serviced by rail services passing through the stations of Patricroft and Eccles, along the Manchester Victoria-Liverpool Lime Street railway line. From Patricroft Station it is only a 13 minute journey to Victoria, with around three trains an hour. Monton is also within walking distance of Eccles Metrolink Interchange, where you can travel across Greater Manchester.

The Glen is a cul-de-sac just off Chorley New Road within the heart of Heaton and plays host to a number of high value dwellings in addition to this low-density group of privately built apartments.
The low-density nature of the development should really allow this home to stand out from the crowd, and it is important to note that there is also a private garage.
The first-floor property can be accessed either by the lift and communal landing or staircase.
The apartment itself is positioned on a pleasant corner with aspect towards mature trees and offers sizeable accommodation not often associated with such property types.
The master bedroom is fully fitted and includes an ensuite shower room which was refurbished approximately 3 years ago, with the second bedroom also being fitted and having access to the main separate bathroom. For those seeking a more traditional layout, there is a separate individual kitchen which, once again, was refurbished approx. 3 years ago and large living space. The living space opens to a balcony positioned on the southern side of the apartment.
Modern presentation of fittings throughout and available with no chain.
The sellers inform us that the property is Leasehold for a term of 999 years from 25th December 1977 subject to the payment of a yearly Ground Rent of £10
Council Tax is Band E - £2,761.60
The Glen is a high calibre, modern development positioned just off Chorley New Road within the heart of Heaton and provides access to many of the important characteristics features associated with the area. There is popular schooling, both in the form of both state and private education. Many people settle within this facility locale as Bolton School is just around 1 mile away.
There is a popular group of bars and restaurants in the area, together with a great variety of sports facilities.
The area in general provides excellent access to surrounding countryside, which also includes the Doffcocker Lodge Nature Reserve, which is just over 1 mile away and a satellite view of the area will display the vast array of open green space. The town is located with particularly good access towards the West Pennine Moors, which attracts people from far and wide.
There is also an excellent infrastructure for travel, which includes a motorway link in around 3 miles and a mainline train station in around 1 mile. As such, many locals consider Manchester an appropriate a convenient distance to work and socialise.

about_property:
Highly Desirable Village Location
Overlooking a Picturesque Green
Immaculately Presented Throughout
Stylish, Contemporary Interior
Two Reception Rooms
Three Double Bedrooms
High Specification Bathrooms
Stunning Mature Gardens
Electric Gates and Incredible Driveway
Close to Many Local Amenities and Excellent Transport Links
Millbrooke Estate Agents are delighted to offer for sale, the incredible Greenview Cottage, Roe Green. This stunning detached property is freehold, turn-key ready and has been styled and finished to a very high specification and standard throughout.
Ideally located in a prime position on the side of the picturesque green with panoramic views. Just a stones throw from the historic Worsley village and local amenities including a coffee shop/post office, local shops, trendy bars, restaurants, family pubs and the Marriott Hotel, Golf and Country Club. Easy access to Worsley woods and the loop lines which are perfect for picturesque walks. Excellent transport links with both the A580 East Lancashire Road and the M60 Ring Road just a short drive away. Walkden railway station is also just a 15 minute walk from the property.
The property benefits from gas central heating + partial under floor heating, is fully alarmed and has a smart Kmoon doorbell/video com system. Comprising an entrance hall which is flooded with natural light and a guest w/c. The garage has been converted to offer a fabulous second reception room with ample integrated storage and a picturesque outlook to the front elevation. The vast and bright lounge is a wealth of space and features a hole in the wall gas fire and incredible views over the garden and green. To the rear elevation is a beautiful open plan kitchen and dining/sitting space which boasts under floor heating, electric blinds, remote LED lighting and bi-fold doors opening to the rear garden. The kitchen features quality and contemporary units, stone surface, two Siemens integrated (self-cleaning) ovens, an induction hob, Neff dishwasher and a Fisher & Paykel fridge/freezer. There is also a spacious utility room complete with dog shower.
To the first floor is a gallery landing area with integrated storage cupboards. The master bedroom is a fantastic size with integral wardrobes, gorgeous views of the green and a spacious en-suite bathroom complete with freestanding bath and separate shower. To the rear elevation are two additional double bedrooms both with fantastic views and a three piece family bathroom with freestanding bath to the front elevation.
To the front of this beautiful property, you have a vast and mature garden that has been maintained to a high standard and an electric, gated driveway for multiple vehicles. Side access leads to the low maintenance and private rear garden with an elevated deck, rear external lighting and storage shed.
Greenview Cottage has been styled and finished to a very high specification and standard throughout. You have to view this property to really appreciate the quality of the fixtures, fittings and workmanship.
Early internal viewing is highly recommended for this fabulous, charming home!

This home is located off Crown Lane and has excellent access to Blackrod train station which is on the main line to Manchester and equally good access to the A6 which in turn connects to Junction 6 of the M61. For those not familiar with the town, Horwich has a small centre with a good variety of largely independently owned shops and services together with cafes, pubs and restaurants. The town also offers several nurseries, primary and secondary schools.
A strong feature of the town is the surrounding countryside which includes the historic Lever Park, a stretch of the West Pennine moors and a number of reservoirs with associated recreational walks. This balance of surrounding countryside and convenient access to the aforementioned commuting links attracts many people to settle within the town.

about_property:

Three Bedrooms
Contemporary Fitted Kitchen
Luxurious Bathroom and En Suite to Master Bedroom
Gardens to Front and Rear

Viewing is Highly Recommended
Immaculately Presented Three-Bedroom Detached Bungalow in Sought-After Hindley Green
Nestled within a highly desirable and peaceful estate in the beautiful area of Hindley Green, this exceptional three-bedroom detached bungalow has been completely transformed by its current owners to an impeccable standard. Offering a true turn-key home, the property has undergone significant upgrades, including new windows and doors, a contemporary kitchen, luxurious bathrooms, and a smart en-suite shower room, to name just a few. Perfectly located close to Hart Common Golf Course—ideal for golfing enthusiasts—and just a short drive from the vibrant heart of Hindley centre, the home is within easy reach of a wide range of shops, bars, restaurants, and local amenities.
Inside, the property boasts spacious, light-filled accommodation throughout. The heart of the home is a stunning open-plan lounge and dining area, beautifully finished with elegant laminate flooring, three front-facing windows, a stylish designer fireplace and a modern column radiator. The sleek and modern kitchen features quartz work surfaces, integrated appliances including a dishwasher, electric oven and hob, plus space for a freestanding fridge/freezer. There is also direct access to the outside. There are three generously sized bedrooms. The luxurious master bedroom is finished with elegant wall panelling and benefits from a recently completed en-suite shower room featuring a walk-in shower, wall-hung wood vanity unit, WC and stylish neutral tiling. Bedroom two enjoys French doors that open onto the rear garden, allowing plenty of natural light and direct access to outdoor space. Bedroom three includes fitted wardrobes, making it ideal as a guest room or home office. The family bathroom has been finished to the highest standard with a freestanding bath, contemporary vanity unit and WC, creating a serene and practical space for all the family.
Externally, the home continues to impress. To the front, manicured lawns frame a spacious block-paved driveway that leads to a brick-built detached garage located to the rear. The rear garden is equally well maintained and offers a private, secure outdoor space with immaculate lawns, a substantial block-paved and brick patio area, and a covered seating space ideal for entertaining in all seasons.
This is a truly immaculate home, both inside and out, and early viewing is strongly recommended to fully appreciate everything it has to offer.

Located in a peaceful cul-de-sac, this spacious and well-presented five-bedroom detached house offers flexible accommodation ideal for modern family living. The property benefits from a large driveway providing ample off-street parking, as well as a neatly maintained front garden laid in lawn.
Upon entering, you are welcomed into a bright entrance hallway with wood-effect flooring and a convenient cloakroom with WC and vanity sink unit. At the front of the house, there is a second reception room featuring a charming bay window - perfect as a formal sitting room or home office.
To the rear, a generous lounge enjoys views of the garden through French doors that open onto the lawned rear garden—ideal for entertaining or relaxing. The spacious kitchen/dining room is well-equipped with a full range of fitted wall and base units and integrated appliances, including a washing machine, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, electric hob, oven, and microwave. A side door provides direct outdoor access.
An additional large reception room/bedroom is located at the front of the property, with access to a private bathroom featuring a shower, WC and sink. A separate hallway with its own side entrance makes this area perfect for an older relative, teenager, or as a potential annex.
Upstairs, there are four generously sized bedrooms. The master bedroom, located at the front, includes fitted wardrobes and a stylish en-suite shower room. The second double bedroom also faces the front, while two further good-sized bedrooms are positioned to the rear. A modern family bathroom with walk in shower, WC, and vanity sink unit completes the upstairs accommodation.
To the rear, the private garden is laid in lawn and fully enclosed—offering a secure and peaceful outdoor space.
Offered with no upward chain, this impressive home is ready for its next chapter and early viewing is highly recommended.

Upon entering through the porch, you're welcomed into a cosy lounge. The room features a stone-painted fireplace with a wood burner stove, serving as a charming focal point. Exposed timber beams enhance the character of the space, while the neutral décor creates a serene atmosphere. Oak laminate flooring, which matches the internal doors, adds warmth and continuity throughout.
The lounge windows are fitted with Venetian blinds, offering flexible control over natural light and privacy.
Connected to the lounge is the kitchen/diner, where the rustic charm continues with exposed ceiling beams. The kitchen is fitted with cream Shaker-style wall and base cabinets, offering a timeless, elegant look. Timber worktops add a touch of sophistication, including a breakfast bar that seats two.
Blending practicality with style, the kitchen features modern amenities such as an integrated oven with a 4-ring gas hob and stainless steel extractor above, plumbing for a washing machine, and a stainless steel sink and drainer positioned by the rear window. There's also space for a freestanding American-style fridge/freezer.
Green 'Metro' tiles serve as the splashback, paired with neutral tiled flooring and walls, creating a clean, polished finish. A door leads out to the rear garden, perfect for easy outdoor access.
Ascend the staircase to the first floor, where two bedrooms await. The front-facing bedroom echoes the lounge, featuring matching mullioned windows and ceiling beams that create a light and airy feel. Fitted wardrobes along one wall offer ample storage space, while the room's focal point is a stone chimney breast with an original grate fire, adding a touch of character and charm.
The second bedroom, overlooking woodland views at the rear, is neutrally decorated, providing a blank canvas for your personal touch. Built-in wardrobes along one side offer convenient storage.
Adjacent to the bedroom is a contemporary shower room, complete with a vanity bowl sink set on an oak counter with storage underneath, a toilet, and a shower enclosure with a glazed screen. Cream tiling adds a touch of warmth and elegance to the space.
Step Outside
At the rear, a quaint, low-maintenance garden awaits, featuring an artificial lawn. Enclosed by sturdy dry-stone walls and complemented by tasteful timber fencing, this charming outdoor space offers both privacy and visual appeal.
Directly across the road from the house is Tootle Park, a large open field perfect for enjoying outdoor activities and walking the dog.
Out & About
Harvey Street enjoys a fantastic location on the edge of rural countryside. Outdoor enthusiasts will love the proximity to Moss Bank Park, just a short walk away, while a scenic circular route along the West Pennine Way from Barrow Bridge through Smithills Woods offers another captivating option for nature lovers.
Everyday amenities are within easy reach, with a variety of bakeries, cafés, banks, shops, supermarkets, and post offices nearby. Major supermarkets like Morrisons and Asda are just a short drive away, ensuring convenience for your daily needs.
For dining out, local pubs off Halliwell Road, such as The Bob Smithy, are only a ten-minute drive away. Alternatively, enjoy a meal at Bake and Roast, located at the historic Smithills Hall, just a short stroll from the property.
Harvey Street is also well-connected to bus routes leading to Bolton and Horwich, offering easy public transportation options for residents.
Agent notes:
 Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested. Some photographs may include virtually staged furnishings and décor intended to illustrate potential layouts or styling.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed. Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Offered to the market with no onward chain, this well-maintained one-bedroom ground floor apartment presents a fantastic opportunity for first-time buyers, downsizers or investors seeking a ready-to-let property in a desirable and well-connected residential location.
The layout offers a generous lounge with large window overlooking the front garden, allowing for excellent natural light, and plenty of space for both seating and dining. The separate kitchen includes a range of wall and base units, integrated oven and hob, and room for freestanding appliances. A shower room with white suite and modern tiling completes the internal accommodation, alongside a good-sized double bedroom with peaceful rear outlook.
Outside, the apartment benefits from private front and rear entrances, a secure gated courtyard garden, and access to communal green spaces -- ideal for relaxing or entertaining in the warmer months. On-street parking is available nearby.
Situated in a popular residential area with a strong community feel, the property enjoys close proximity to local shops, supermarkets, and eateries, as well as well-regarded schools and healthcare facilities. Green space is plentiful in the surrounding area, with several parks and playing fields just a short walk away. For commuters, the property is ideally placed with easy access to regular bus routes and nearby rail stations, while road users benefit from strong links to the A6, M60 and wider Greater Manchester motorway network.
This is a low-maintenance, move-in-ready home in a sought-after area -- early viewing is highly recommended.
Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process
Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process:
Step 1
 - Register your interest
Step 2
 - Prepare your finances for the purchase
Step 3
 - Arrange a viewing
Step 4
 - Make an offer
Step 5
 - Secure your sale using our secure system
Step 6
 - Exchange and complete

about_property:
Modern Fifth Floor Apartment
Open Plan Living/ Kitchen/ Diner
One Fitted Double Bedroom
Modern Bathroom
Lift Access
Allocated Parking
Communal Gardens
No Chain
Stylish 1-Bed Fifth-Floor Apartment In Historic Holden Mill
Offered for sale with no onward chain, this immaculately presented fifth-floor apartment is nestled within the iconic Holden Mill, a beautifully restored Victorian cotton mill in the heart of Sharples. Seamlessly blending historic charm with contemporary design, this one-bedroom home offers stylish open-plan living in a prime location, close to daily amenities and transport links.
A Grand Entrance
Set on the cusp of the West Lancashire Moors, just off Blackburn Road, Holden Mill forms part of the exclusive Cottonworks gated development, where heritage architecture meets modern sophistication. Drive through the secure entrance and step into the impressive shared mill lobby, where the original character of the building is beautifully preserved. Collect your post and take either the stairs or the lift up to the fifth floor—your new home awaits.
Welcome Home
Step inside, where timber laminate flooring extends throughout, creating a seamless flow through the open-plan kitchen, dining, and living space. Light and airy, this thoughtfully designed area is perfect for both relaxing and entertaining.
In the kitchen, sleek white gloss cabinetry is arranged in an efficient L-shape, perfectly complemented by walnut worktops and crisp white splashback tiles. A full suite of integrated appliances—including an electric oven, hob with stainless steel extractor, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, and washing machine—ensures convenience and style go hand in hand.
A Peaceful Retreat
Beyond the living area, the spacious double bedroom is a cosy sanctuary, fitted with white glossy wardrobes and matching bedside tables for a polished, modern feel. Soft carpeting underfoot enhances the sense of warmth, while an internal window to the living space maintains the apartment’s bright and airy ambience.
Opposite, the sleek three-piece bathroom is designed for both function and style. A built-in bath with overhead shower and glazed screen sits alongside a pedestal sink and WC, all framed by a contemporary mix of dark and light tiling for a fresh, modern finish.
Explore the Area
Ideally located, this stunning apartment places you just moments from everyday essentials and leisure hotspots. A short stroll brings you to the shops, bars, and conveniences of Astley Bridge and Bromley Cross, with Asda supermarket just five minutes away on foot.
For commuters, Hall i’th’ Wood train station is a 20-minute walk, offering direct connections to Manchester, while a bus stop just outside the gates provides easy access into Bolton town centre.
Secure Parking & Gated Access
Enjoy peace of mind with private, secure parking in the basement car park, while visitors can take advantage of designated guest parking conveniently located at Entrance B.
A Stylish Home with Heritage Charm
Offering a unique blend of modern convenience and period character, this exceptional apartment is ready to move into with no onward chain. Whether you're a first-time buyer, professional, or investor, this is an opportunity not to be missed.
Agent notes:
 Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested. Some photographs may include virtually staged furnishings and décor intended to illustrate potential layouts or styling.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed. Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Positioned in a sought-after location, this extended semi-detached house offers versatile family living accommodation and a potential to extend further, subject to planning. The house is located within walking distance of Oftsed rated 'excellent' local schools, Bamford and Oulder Hill precincts, cafes, pubs and restaurants whilst having easy access to Rochdale/Bury town centres and the motorway network.
Internally, the deceptively spacious property offers three levels of living accommodation comprising of an entrance hall, downstairs wc, three reception rooms, a fitted kitchen with breakfast room, utility room, integral double garage, three bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. The property also benefits from having gas central heating and upvc double glazing throughout.
The family home affords a resin double driveway that sits in front of the double garage. There is the potential to convert the garage or extend above (subject to the relevant planning permissions). about_property:
Detached Family Home
Four Bedrooms (Three Doubles)
Stunning Family Living Kitchen
Downstairs Shower Room
Modern Family Bathroom
Superb Conservatory
Large Driveway With Garage
Fabulous Rear Garden
Sought-After Development
Backs Onto Pleasant Open Aspect
Occupying a generous plot in a highly desirable area of Hopwood, this immaculately presented four-bedroom detached family home offers the perfect balance of versatile living space, stylish finishes, and spacious outdoor areas – making it an ideal purchase for families looking to upsize or relocate to a more peaceful yet well-connected setting.
Tucked away on a quiet residential avenue, the home welcomes you with a large driveway, offering ample off-road parking and leading to an integral garage that provides excellent storage and utility potential.
Upon entering the property, you are greeted by a bright and spacious entrance hall, setting a warm and inviting tone. To the left, a modern downstairs shower room adds practicality to the ground floor layout – ideal for busy households or guests.
The main lounge is a generous and well-proportioned space, filled with natural light from two large windows providing a comfortable area for family relaxation. The standout feature of this home, however, is the superb open-plan family living kitchen to the rear. Thoughtfully designed to be the hub of the home, this contemporary space offers defined areas for cooking, dining, and informal seating – perfect for both everyday family life and entertaining. High-quality fitted units, integrated appliances, and ample worktop space make this kitchen as functional as it is stylish.
From the kitchen, you’ll find access to a separate utility room, ideal for laundry and additional storage, which helps keep the main kitchen area free-flowing and clutter-free. An opening leads directly from the family kitchen into a conservatory, currently used as an additional sitting area or playroom, whilst offering views of the garden.
Upstairs, the home continues to impress with four well-sized bedrooms, each offering flexibility for growing families, home offices, or guest accommodation. The modern family bathroom is finished to a high standard, featuring a sleek suite with a shower-over-bath, stylish tiling, and quality fixtures throughout.
To the rear, the property benefits from an expansive, private garden – a rare find in this location. Laid mainly to lawn with mature borders and a paved patio area for outdoor dining, the garden backs directly onto an open aspect, creating a tranquil and unspoiled outlook that’s perfect for both relaxation and play.
Situated within a sought-after and convenient location, the home enjoys easy access to a range of well-regarded schools, local shops, scenic parks, and excellent transport links via the M62 and nearby railway connections – making commuting to Manchester, Bury or Rochdale a breeze.

about_property:
Deceptively Spacious Terrace Property
Bay Fronted Lounge
Open Plan Modern Fitted Kitchen & Dining Space
Contemporary Bathroom Suite
Two Generous Double Bedrooms
Low Maintenance Garden to the Rear
Newly Installed Windows
Perfectly Located Close to Amenities & Excellent Transport Links
Nestled within a sought-after area of Peel Green, is this two bedroom terraced house, boasting a deceptively spacious open plan layout.
Entering into the tiled hallway which leads through to the open plan modern kitchen and dining room creating an excellent space to host. Divided by internal doors is the cosy bay fronted lounge complete with a log burner making a beautiful centre piece.
Ascending to the first floor of this fabulous property is two generally proportioned double bedrooms with ample space and natural light, complementing them is the contemporary fitted bathroom suite.
Stepping outside, the low maintenance garden to the rear provides a quiet space to relax, with a paved patio, and ever green artificial lawn along with a fitted bar, perfect for hosting summer BBQ’s. The property also benefits newly installed windows throughout the property enhance its energy efficiency and aesthetic appeal.
Positioned perfectly within close proximity to amenities and excellent transport links, this property offers the ultimate convenience for residents. Whether it's a quick trip to the local shops, a leisurely stroll in the nearby park, or an easy commute to work, everything you need is just a stone's throw away.
EPC Rating: D
Location
Peel Green is located within the western end of the M30 postcode and is well commutable to and from via the M60 motorway link (junction 13) alongside multiple bus routes. There are both ofsted rated Good and Outstanding educational & child care settings making this the ideal area for some families. Peel Green benefits from an Asda & Aldi supermarkets plus many other local mini markets. There is plenty of playing fields and a recreational ground which is home to the Local football and Rugby teams. The Trafford centre is located within walking distance from the area offering as well as Eccles Town Centre where there are Train, tram & bust stations.

about_property:
Open plan kitchen/dining/living room
Two spacious bedrooms
Ensuite to master bedroom
Further communal bathroom
Two parking spaces
The Tahoma apartment boasts a spacious open plan living/dining room overlooked by a stunning peninsula kitchen, two spacious bedrooms with luxurious en-suite and fitted wardrobes to the master.
The Marketing Suite is open 5 days a week Thursday - Monday 10.30am - 5.30pm. We invite you to come along and discuss your requirements with our Sales Advisor and view the details of these stunning apartments. Now selling with off-plan prices.
Own a piece of history
These apartments sit on the site of the Linotype factory which housed a revolutionary printing machine at the turn of the 20th Century and played a pivotal role in Manchester's industrial past. Today, Shelbourne Estates have sensitively restored the Engine House building to present 18 exclusive and distinctly unique luxury apartments, each boasting modern, high spec living, yet retaining many of the original architectural features that make these spectacular living spaces so highly sought after.
Location, Location
Set in the popular Oldfield Brow district, you are a short walk from the heart of Altrincham, brimming with a superb selection of restaurants and bars, both small independents and renowned chains, not forgetting the popular Altrincham Market for home brewed beer and live music. Hop on the tram at Altrincham or Navigation Road stations and your in Manchester City Centre within half an hour, ideal for commuting or social occasions.
Live in Luxury
At Shelbourne Estates, our philosophy is simple: We create beautifully crafted homes. That means premium comes as standard in every one of our homes from firm foundations to impressive finishes from world-renowned brands including:
Siemens appliances
Franke fixtures for a stylish kitchen finish
Luxury hotel style bathrooms by Villeroy and Boch
Porcelanosa ceramic wall tiling
Hammonds fitted wardrobes
Every Shelbourne home has labc Warranty. This means that your home is structurally protected for ten years after legal completion.

This modern three bedroom terraced house, presented to a show home standard throughout, is a hidden gem nestled in the popular Peel Green area. Perfect for families or first-time buyers, this property boasts an open plan layout on the ground floor, creating a spacious, airy feel. The generously proportioned lounge opens out to the rear garden, providing a seamless indoor-outdoor living experience.
On the first floor, you will find three well-proportioned bedrooms, ideal for accommodating a growing family or work from homes space. The modern family bathroom and guest W.C. Offer convenience and style, fitting seamlessly into the contemporary design of the house.
Notable features of this property include off-road parking for multiple cars, a rare find in this sought-after area, allowing for ease of access for both residents and visitors. Enjoy the sun-drenched rear garden, approximately 50ft in size, perfect for outdoor entertaining or simply relaxing in the summer months.
Complete with solar panels, this property offers eco-friendly benefits, reducing energy costs while contributing to a greener lifestyle. Surrounding the property are excellent amenities, including schools, shops, and transport links, making daily life convenient and enjoyable. Additionally, this home is located just a short walk from The Trafford Centre, ensuring endless options for shopping, dining, and entertainment.
EPC Rating: B
Location
Peel Green is located within the western end of the M30 postcode and is well commutable to and from via the M60 motorway link (junction 13) alongside multiple bus routes. There are both ofsted rated Good and Outstanding educational & child care settings making this the ideal area for some families. Peel Green benefits from an Asda & Aldi supermarkets plus many other local mini markets. There is plenty of playing fields and a recreational ground which is home to the Local football and Rugby teams. The Trafford centre is located within walking distance from the area offering as well as Eccles Town Centre where there are Train, tram & bust stations.

An exceptional opportunity to acquire this luxurious five-bedroom detached family home, occupying a prime position on one of Norden’s most sought-after developments.
Offering approximately 2,500sqft of high-specification living space, this beautifully appointed property has been finished to an impeccable standard with no expense spared, delivering a turnkey home ideal for modern family life.
The ground floor accommodation comprises a welcoming porch leading into a spacious entrance hall, a stylish guest WC, an elegant lounge, and a separate formal dining room. A spacious conservatory provides panoramic views over the landscaped rear garden whilst seamlessly connecting to outside.
The heart of the home is a stunning open-plan family living kitchen, complete with bespoke cabinetry, corian worktops, premium integrated appliances, central island, and relaxed seating area. A separate 'boot room' offers additional storage and laundry space.
Upstairs, the property boasts five well-proportioned bedrooms, including four doubles, with three featuring their own high-spec en-suites. A family bathroom serves the remaining bedrooms, all of which are tastefully decorated to the highest standard.
Outside, the rear garden is an entertainer’s dream, professionally landscaped and featuring a pergola-covered luxury hot tub, ambient lighting, and stylish paving. To the front, a substantial driveway provides ample off-road parking and leads to an integral double garage with electric door access, power and lighting.
Situated within walking distance of Norden village and its excellent amenities, this home also benefits from easy access to scenic countryside walks, top-performing local schools, and excellent transport links including the M62 motorway.
Rarely do homes of this quality become available in such a desirable location - early viewing is highly recommended.

about_property:
Executive Detached Home
Circa 1550 sq ft
Four Bedrooms, En Suite and Family Bathroom
Exclusive Development
Countrywide Build Quality
Huge Open Plan Kitchen
Situated in the heart of Standish on a recently finished and highly sought-after residential estate, 11 Grasslands is a beautifully appointed and stylish family home resting on a great plot. Completed by highly acclaimed builders ‘Countryside’ this quite beautiful family home provides a handsome exterior and a well thought out interior floor plan, extending to approximately 1550 sq ft. With the remainder of it’s NHBC guarantee, assuring peace of mind and ease of living, the current owners have tastefully presented the home.
The accommodation briefly comprises a welcoming entrance hallway, laid with Amtico flooring. With a handy store and access into the ground floor cloakroom, where the Amtico floor continues. Both the cosy living room and the live-in family friendly kitchen lead from the hallway. The lounge is light and bright and features a walk-in bay window. The beautifully appointed live-in kitchen, is perfect for family living and includes an extensive array of contemporary units and integrated appliances including a fridge/freezer, dishwasher, AEG ovens and a gas hob. The work surfaces are beautiful granite and the open plan layout of the room provides space for a dining and an additional seating area, perfect for more casual relaxing and leading directly through French doors into the garden. This impressive room is flooded with natural light and features not only large doors to the garden but also huge additional Velux roof lights in the seating area. Leading from the kitchen there is a handy utility room accommodating all of the home’s laundry facilities. The kitchen and utility room have both been fitted with Amtico flooring. The first floor of the home offers four excellent bedrooms, with the master enjoying a lovely walk-in bay and well-appointed en- suite bathroom. The four spacious bedrooms are ample to accommodate a growing family and the family bathroom features a four piece suite with walk-in shower.
The property rests on a lovely plot featuring an ample driveway to the side leading to the integral single garage, edged by lawned front gardens. The rear garden is secure and private and features a patio area, ideal for outdoor dining. Standish village is a short walk away with a wealth of shops, eateries and facilities. The thriving village centre features flagship local restaurants, doctors, dentist and two supermarkets. Local schools are in high demand as the village offers four ‘outstanding’ schools at both primary and secondary level, one within walking distance. There is excellent motorway and rail access and yet equally a short stroll will take you to the beautiful Douglas Valley and Haigh Country Estate.
Viewings of this superb family home are now welcomed.

about_property:
Beautifully Cared for Detached Home
Three Bedrooms (One to Ground Floor)
Gardens, Driveway and Parking
Circa 1410 sq ft
Immaculate Condition
Cul De Sac Location
Resting in this quiet cul de sac, this absolutely immaculate detached chalet style bungalow is presented to the highest of standards. The property offers versatile and flexible accommodation, which could easily be lived in on the ground floor if needed.
The property is close to the thriving village of Standish and offers a generous floor plan extending to circa 1410 sq ft.
The accommodation briefly comprises of an impressive entrance hallway featuring a returning staircase rising to the first floor and leading through to the rest of the accommodation. There is a ground floor bedroom positioned at the rear of the home and overlooking the rear garden. The large bright lounge is of a great size and centres around a feature fireplace hosing a living flame gas fire. There is the access through in to the dining room which offers patio doors and direct access outside. The kitchen flows from the dining room and is fitted with a range of wall and base units in light beech and includes an electric hob and oven, double eye level ovens and extractor hood. There is a handy breakfast bar, ideal for informal dining, feature beamed ceiling and access into an additional porch leading to the garden. The first floor offers two very generous double bedrooms, both with an excellent range of fitted furniture. The first floor is completed with a smart shower room, again of a good size, and including a walk-in shower, vanity wash hand basin and fitted w.c.
Externally, the property rests on an equally immaculate plot with a large paved driveway leading to the attached garage, lawns and a pedestrian path to the front door. The rear garden is paved for ease of maintenance and offers an ideal spot in which to take of advantage of the sunny garden. There are raised beds with planting, pedestrian access in to the garage and a wooden garden store.

There is close proximity to the M6 motorway which can be accessed, within just a couple of minutes, ensuring major commercial centres such as Manchester, Liverpool and Preston are within a reasonable commute.

Chain free, duplex apartment located in the a sought after location! Perfectly positioned between Monton Village & Ellesmere Park and surrounded by many more amenities & transport links.
This fabulous property comes complete with its own private entrance, spacious lounge, fitted kitchen & dining area and ample storage to the first floor. Whilst the second floor of this brilliant apartment offers two double bedrooms and a fitted bathroom.
The property is gas central heated and benefits from double glazing throughout, and benefits from parking externally for residents. This is perfectly located just a short walk from Monton Village, and Eccles centre where there is an array of shops, eateries and bus, train & tram stations.
EPC Rating: C
Location
Monton village is a highly sought after, thriving village within close proximity of Manchester City Centre. With boutique and independent retailers dotted along Monton Road, Monton’s range of shops give the area character – you can find a specialist craft beer bottle shop, a jewellers and a home and lifestyle shop along the main shopping street, to name but a few. With an amazing range of coffee shops, bars and restaurants, Monton is a great place to go out to eat. You’ll find bars with heated terraces suitable for alfresco dining, wine and cocktail bars and venues that provide live music – there is a real buzz around Monton! On the edge of Monton village is the Historic Bridgewater Canal, perfect for weekend walks. The picturesque Roe Green Loopline Heritage Trail is a convenient circular walk that begins and ends in Monton village, taking you along the canal towpath. Monton has schools of a consistently high standard, including Branwood Preparatory School and Monton Green Primary School which have consistently received Good Ofsted reports. Situated between the M602 and the A580 East Lancs Road, the village of Monton is only a 20 minute drive from Manchester city centre and a 10 minute drive from MediaCity. Monton village is serviced by rail services passing through the stations of Patricroft and Eccles, along the Manchester Victoria-Liverpool Lime Street railway line. From Patricroft Station it is only a 13 minute journey to Victoria, with around three trains an hour. Monton is also within walking distance of Eccles Metrolink Interchange, where you can travel across Greater Manchester.

There are beautiful communal spaces meaning that you can make the most of social occasions with family and friends, with the lounge making an ideal spot for relaxing and catching up with loved ones or having a quiet read. There are also beautiful, well-maintained landscaped gardens, ideal for any residents enjoyment yet without the upkeep. There are also several security features and additional communicative measures to provide peace of mind. An intelligent video-entry system and 24-hour emergency call system are always available.

The bedroom is again of a lovely size and leads into the purpose built walk-in wardrobe. There is a fantastic shower room leading from the hallway which consists of a large walk-in double shower, vanity wash hand basin and w.c. The apartment is finished with a further store room leading off the hallway.

about_property:
Recently Renovated Georgian Detached Home
Four Bedrooms and Two Reception Rooms
Circa 1804 Sq Ft and additional cellars of 591 sq ft
Off Road Parking and Gardens
Stylish Presentation Throughout
Stunning Wooden Sash Windows
Positioned within close proximity to Wigan Hospital and Haigh Halls Plantation Gates, No 1 New Lodge is a Grade 2 listed detached home which has recently undergone an extensive and complete refurbishment, sympathetic of a home of it’s era, whilst maintaining many of the original features and character of a home of it’s generation and breathing life and modern accents in to this handsome building. Believed to have been built in the early 1800’s this impressive Georgian building displays over 13 historic sash windows, all of which have been recently replaced. Extending to circa 1804 sq feet of living space with further cellar areas providing approximately 591 sq ft no expense has been spared in restoring this iconic building in to a carefree period family home.
The property has been taken back to the original brick and has benefitted from a complete refurbishment which includes rewiring, replumbing, decoration, flooring and replastering and of particular note are the beautiful new wooden sash windows, very much in keeping with the original building, and a stunning addition. There are of course new bathrooms and a smart new kitchen too. The outside spaces have also been relandscaped and whilst retaining the charm of a courtyard parking also offer off road parking, secured behind wooden gates.
The accommodation briefly comprises of a stunning entrance hallway with grand staircase to the first floor and retaining the original staircase and cornice. There are two excellent and well proportioned reception rooms, with high ceiling and an original display/ store cupboard. The kitchen which has also benefitted from a full refurbishment provides a stylish range of Shaker units, the original chimney breast and includes enough space for informal dining with access in to the rear garden.
The first floor provides four excellent bedroom and a newly fitted en suite shower room and an additional family bathroom.
There are further cellar rooms at the lower ground floor level which are ideal for storage, with potential to convert to a play room, office or other room, subject to meeting any required building or planning regulations
Externally the gardens are part walled and offer off road parking combined with newly laid patio and seating areas, lawns and raised planting beds.
The property is located with excellent easy access in to Wigan Town Centre, with the Royal Albert Edward Hospital also close by. There are great schools, the beautiful and historic Mesnes Park and Haigh Hall all within walking distance too. Commuters would have easy access to both the motorway and rail network.
Viewings of this impressive home offered with no onward chain and vacant possession, a ready to move in to home are now welcomed.

The current owners have created a quite wonderful property, with care and attention to detail to offer modern and turnkey accommodation crafted from an elegant 1930’s home. The standard and level of presentation are a true credit to them. The property rests on a private, elevated Southerly facing plot, and has a beautifully landscaped private rear garden.
The traditional double fronted property features accommodation, which extends to approximately 1646 sq ft and briefly comprises a traditional entrance via the original front door into a welcoming entrance hallway / reception area. Leading from the hallway there is access to the two front double reception rooms, both featuring beautiful walk-in bay windows and one currently utilised as a dining room and beautiful sitting room. The hallway also leads to the bedrooms situated at the rear of the home. The kitchen has been fitted out with a stunning range of units with a neutral finish and leads directly off the dining room, ideal for entertaining. Included within the kitchen are a range of units and offering space for the white goods. The room is finished with accented tiling and granite worksurfaces. There are three excellent bedrooms within this property, both offering South facing aspects, The master bedroom features an en suite shower room and fitted wardrobes, whilst bedroom two (currently utilised as a sitting room) leads into an attractive sun lounge leading directly to the garden. The internal accommodation is completed with a family bathroom suite.
The gardens from this property are equally as beautifully maintained and tended. Highlights include a large patio area leading from the house, perfect for al fresco dining, and bordered by gravelled paths and edged by mature planting, which offers privacy. The external space to the side of the home provides off road parking via a tarmac driveway and access to the impressive large detached garage, which could be converted to ancillary accommodation if required, and extends to over 33’ ft and currently including excellent storage and workshop area.
Standish village is a short drive away with a wealth of shops, eateries and facilities. The thriving village centre features flagship local restaurants, doctors, dentist and two supermarkets. Local schools are in high demand as the village offers four ‘outstanding’ schools at both primary and secondary level. There is excellent motorway and rail access and yet equally a short stroll will take you to the beautiful Douglas Valley and Haigh Country Estate.
Viewings of this beautiful home are recommended to appreciate the stylish and immaculate accommodation.

A rather rare commodity; we are often asked for the seemingly impossible - a stone cottage property with three double bedrooms, large gardens, plenty of parking, views down a valley to a stream, oh! And it has to be accessible! Stonelea on Bass Lane in Summerseat ticks all of those boxes and is indeed a bespoke country home and a rare opportunity. Built during the early 19th century Stonelea is a stone constructed, freehold semi detached country home having been meticulously restored and extended over the last 20 years to provide a beautiful family home. Set in gardens and grounds on Bass Lane close to the junction with the A56 and within a 'stones throw' of both the M66 entry and exit roads and yet there are views from most of the rooms down onto the gardens and beyond through the wooded valley, a good deal of which is within the ownership of the property. The current owners recently constructed a detached garage and store/workshop and laid a resin finished driveway to provide off road parking for up to five vehicles. The accommodation has combination gas fired central heating, upvc double glazing with (with working sash windows to the front) and the accommodation briefly comprises: Entrance porch, inner hall, lounge with woodburning stove, dining room, kitchen, rear lobby, guest cloakroom/w.c., conservatory, first floor landing, three double bedrooms (one with ensuite) and a main bathroom.
The property is served by main gas and electricity. Drainage is to a septic tank.

Spacious five bedroom home! Take a look at this extensive family home which spans over four floors! The property benefits from three/four reception rooms, extended kitchen/diner/lounge, bar, south facing garden, cellars for storage, three bathrooms, off-road parking and a garage!
Located close to good schooling, transport links and other local amenities.
To the ground floor there is a welcoming hallway, three reception rooms, modern fitted kitchen/diner/lounge which is big enough to fit a full size snooker table, downstairs shower room, utility and the bar.
To the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a four-piece bathroom suite.
To the third floor there two double bedrooms with one complete with an en-suite and a storage room to the front.
There is also the added benefit of a two chamber cellar for additional storage.
Externally to the front there is off-road parking for multiple cars with acces to the garage. To the rear there is a spacious laid to lawn garden which is south facing and benefits from the sun. There is also a courtyard behind the garage.
Call the office today to arrange your viewing!

Offered for sale by Hills Property Auctions. Should you view, offer, or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, Hills Property Auctions. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract of sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This time allows buyers to purchase with mortgage finance where necessary. The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £3,600 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to, and does not constitute part of the purchase price, however may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to provide proof of how the purchase will be funded along with id for verification. This property benefits from a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents & information relating to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, and therefore you are advised to complete your own due diligence prior to bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and Terms & Conditions of the sale are also contained within this pack. Any potential buyer may purchase a copy of the Buyer Information Pack at a cost of £99.00 including VAT. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price. Both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid may change without notice. To place a bid or for any further information please call the Auction Coordinator.

about_property:
Tucked away on a Quiet Cul De Sac is this Beautiful Detached Family Home, Built in 2021
Light & Airy, Open Plan Lounge & Dining Space with Floor to Ceiling Window and French Doors
Contemporary Two Tone Kitchen with Integrated Appliances
Six Generously Sized Bedrooms, offering Versatile Spaces over the Two Levels
Four Piece Family Bathroom to the Ground Floor, Three Piece Bathroom & En Suite Complementing the First Floor
Secure, Gated Off Road Parking for Multiple Cars & A 22 ft Detached Garage with Power
Wrap Around Well Kept Lawn, with Decked Seating Area outside the French Doors
Located in a Sought After Area, offering a Plethora of Amenities & Well Served by Public Transport Links and Motorway Links
Nestled within a peaceful cul-de-sac, this remarkable six bedroom detached house stands as a beacon of modern family living. Constructed in 2021 to the highest standards, this immaculate property boasts a harmonious blend of contemporary design and functionality.
Enter through the impressive entrance hallway, complete with underfloor heating that consistently runs throughout the lower level. The ground floor made up of the first four double bedrooms, all of which offer flexibility and versatility for various living arrangements. The open plan lounge and dining room, illuminates natural light through the floor to ceiling window and French doors. Further enhancing the living space, the sleek and stylish two tone kitchen, complete with integrated appliances is perfect for cooking enthusiast.
Heading up to the first floor of this amazing property, you will find endless storage with floor to ceiling fitted wardrobes built in to the landing space, from here you access the two, near 19ft bedrooms, one of which benefits from an en suite bathroom complete with a bath tub. Serving the second bedrooms is a three piece modern bathroom suite, whilst the ground floor is served by a sophisticated four piece family bathroom ensuring convenient and comfort for all occupants.
Ensuring privacy and security, the property provides gated off-road parking for multiple vehicles, as well as a 22 ft detached garage equipped with power supply, catering to all automotive needs. The well-maintained wrap-around lawn provides a picturesque backdrop, while a decked seating area outside the French doors offers a perfect spot for relaxation.
Situated in a highly sought-after area, this residence benefits from a wealth of amenities within easy reach. Residents can enjoy the convenience of well-served public transport links and effortless access to major motorways, ensuring seamless connectivity to the wider region.
In essence, this impeccable detached family home presents an unparallelled opportunity to embrace a lifestyle of comfort, style, and convenience. With its exceptional features and prime location, this property epitomises modern living at its finest.
EPC Rating: C
Location
A hidden gem of an area, Ellesmere park has a large conservation area and is within walking distance of the vibrant Monton village with its array of bars, cafes and eateries. Houses in this location are well-served by excellent transport links with the M602 and M60 motorways within a short 5-minute drive and the train and metro-link stations in Eccles offering direct access to Salford Quays, Media City and Manchester City Centre. Many people are drawn to the area due to its proximity to Salford Royal Hospital and MediaCityUK, the UK's first purpose built creative media hub on a 200-acre site located within Salford Quays - Manchester's established waterfront location which is home to the Lowry Outlet Mall, the highly regarded Lowry Theatre and the impressive Imperial War Museum. The site is an internationally significant centre for the media and creative industries with the UK's leading broadcast, media and technology companies. Slightly further afield, yet still within easy reach at less than two miles away, is the renowned Trafford Centre with its mixture of well-known brand names, leisure opportunities, cafés and restaurants. It’s a 20-minute car journey into Manchester city centre, with its myriad high-street retailers, independent boutiques, chic cafés, bars and restaurants. Worsley golf club is within a 10 minute walk and dukes drive offers excellent walks up to the picturesque Worsley village and access to the Historic Bridgewater Canal.
