Julie Twist Properties are delighted to present this 2nd floor apartment within the stunning Phoenix building. Phoenix is part of Capital & Centric's development, located right in the mix of the Piccadilly East neighbourhood. The apartment boasts exposed concrete and steel beams, high ceilings and huge floor-to-ceiling windows, allowing for plenty of natural light. The apartment comprises a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances which is open plan to the spacious living area. There are two generously sized double bedrooms, a main bathroom and an ensuite bathroom, both with modern finishes. This apartment also benefits from amenities such as a 24-hour concierge and access to a residents' garden which is complete with a fire pit, communal BBQs, communal Wi-Fi, all located in the development opposite.
Phoenix is in the heart of the City Centre, allowing easy access to Piccadilly Gardens and Market Street and only a 5 minute walk to Piccadilly train station and the Northern Quarter. The popular areas of Ancoats and New Islington Marina are also within easy walking distance, offering an array of trendy bars and restaurants and waterside outdoor space.

Located in the Prestigious Ellesmere Park

**Lovely Fived Bedroom Victorian Home Located in the Popular Ellesmere Park, Boasting High Ceilings, Three Reception Rooms, Three Bathrooms, a Garage and a Generous Garden to the Rear!**
As you enter the property you head into a grand, welcoming entrance hallway. From here, you willl find the large 20ft dining room, which leads through via an archway to the 15ft family lounge. As you head towards the rear of the property you will find an additional reception room, which provides access to the modern downstairs W/C, and the 14ft fitted kitchen.
On the first floor, from the landing you will find four well-proportioned bedrooms, with the main bedroom boasting a large 21ft! You will also find a large three-piece family bathroom, along with an additional shower room. On the top floor, there is a further double bedroom.
Externally, there is a driveway, providing off-road parking and leading to the garage at the side. There are generously-sized gardens to the front and rear.
Belgrave crescent is located within the popular Ellesmere park area, within walking distance of Salford Royal Hospital, Eccles town centre and the popular Monton village with its fine array of bars, restaurants and amenities. The area offers exceptional access to transport links, including the M602, the train line and metro-link offering direct access into Manchester, Salford Quays & MediaCityUk.
Viewing is highly recommended - get in touch to secure your viewing today!

For sale to cash buyers, This delightful one-bedroom ground floor apartment is located in a peaceful development exclusively for over 55's in Standish Village. Offering low-maintenance living, the apartment is set amidst well-maintained communal green spaces and benefits from ample parking in the designated car park.
Standish Village offers a wealth of conveniences, including: Doctors and dentists, Independent shops and supermarkets, and a variety of cafes and restaurants.
A welcoming entryway leading to all main rooms. There is a spacious and bright living area featuring a charming fireplace, perfect for relaxation. The kitchen is equipped with a range of wall and base units, laminated work surfaces, an integrated electric oven, and halogen hob. There is a generously sized bedroom, offering direct access to the en-suite shower room. The En-Suite Shower Room features a three-piece suite, including a WC, pedestal wash hand basin, and a shower cubicle with an electric shower unit.
The Communal Gardens are landscaped, offering serene green spaces and an attractive patio area. This apartment provides an excellent opportunity for downsizers or retirees seeking comfort, convenience, and community in an attractive and accessible location.
The property is offered with vacant possession.

about_property:
Impressive Detached Property
Offering approx 3051 sq. Feet of Accommodaton
Five Bedrooms
Two Reception Rooms and Conservatory
Open Plan Dining Kitchen
Driveway and Double Garage
Garden Room Currently being used as a Bar
Viewing is Highly Recommended
This detached home, located on this small and established cul de sac in the heart of Appley Bridge, is truly impressive, offering excellent space and a prime location. At approximately 3051 square feet it is certainly appealing for a large family. The layout which is not only well-designed, has also been much improved by the current clients throughout and additional features such as the bespoke garden bar certainly make this a home which is ready to move in to.
Briefly comprising a welcoming entrance hallway which leads into the ground floor living areas. There is a handy ground floor cloakroom leading off the hallway and a spacious living room which leads into the additional conservatory and dedicated dining room. The open plan kitchen and dining area, flowing seamlessly into the garden, creates a fantastic space for family gatherings or entertaining guests. The kitchen is fitted with an excellent range of sleek modern cabinetry including an integrated dishwasher, pan drawers and a Neff oven, grill and plate warmer, add convenience and style. An additional island offers space for informal dining and French doors lead to the wrap around garden, perfect for entertaining. The laundry area is discreetly hidden behind the smart units at the end of the kitchen. Quartz worksurface complete the contemporary look.
The first floor reveals four of the property’s bedrooms with two enjoying the Jack and Jill en-suite shower room, which has been updated in line with the modern touches in this home whilst a separate family bathroom, also which has been updated, caters for the rest of the needs of the family. It is also worth noting that there is a lovely open plan landing area in this design of property which would make an ideal study or reading area, filled with light via a Velux roof light. The second floor reveals a further large bedroom fitted with an extensive range of wardrobes and a huge four piece bathroom suite completes this floor. There is also under eaves space perfect for hiding large storage.
Externally, there is a tarmac driveway providing off road parking for a number of vehicles and leading to the attached garage. The garage is a pleasant surprise and has been recrafted into a very cool den/bar ideal for a teenage hangout however can easily be used as a garage if this is more of a requirement. The side and rear garden is mainly laid to lawn and has a decked patio area, ideal for outdoor dining. There is also a further handmade garden room. This would be perfect for anyone needing to work from home or to enjoy as it is currently used as a bar. It benefits from electrics and French doors leading to the garden.
The proximity to the village of Appley Bridge, with its array of amenities, adds further appeal to the property, and the village enjoys it’s own train station with direct links to both Southport and Manchester. The village offers canal side walks, ‘Fairy Glen’ and easy access to the motorway.
Overall, this home offers a harmonious blend of space, functionality, and convenience, making it a highly desirable option for potential buyers seeking a comfortable and well-appointed residence.
Viewings of this very impressive home are now invited.

Description
For sale is this impressive, detached house, located on the serene Mountwood Ashurst, Skelmersdale. This imposing property comes with a price tag of 'offers in excess of £295,000', providing excellent value for money considering its stature and amiable specification. The house is superbly presented throughout, guaranteeing a ready-to-move-in condition that harmoniously blends elegance with comfort.
This home is spread over two floors, with the entrance on the ground floor leading you into a welcoming porch. The ground floor boasts three well-proportioned reception rooms, including a spacious lounge, dining room, and breakfast area. Each room is smartly designed to ensure maximum use of natural light, providing a bright and airy feel across the house.
Furthermore, the house features a good size conservatory and a modern kitchen fitted with high-quality appliances and ample storage space. The practicality of this home extends to a convenient downstairs WC, making it comfortable for your guests and daily life.
On the first floor, the house consists of four generously proportioned bedrooms. These bedrooms exude a warm, homely feeling, perfect for relaxation and privacy. The master bedroom comes with an attached en-suite, providing an extra layer of convenience. A family bathroom is also available on this floor, elegantly designed with stylish fixtures and fittings.
Equally impressive is the property's external areas. The front and rear gardens are immaculately manicured, offering a peaceful and private space to enjoy outdoor living. A spacious driveway offers ample parking space for multiple vehicles, further enhancing the practical allure of this property.
The house holds a freehold tenure, adding to its appeal for those looking for a property for long term family living. To conclude, this fabulous house is indeed a family home that perfectly combines luxury, comfort, and practicality. Viewing is highly recommended to truly appreciate the exquisiteness of this magnificent property.

Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process
Our Premium Fast Sale Plus follows the below process:
Step 1
 - Register your interest
Step 2
 - Prepare your finances for the purchase
Step 3
 - Arrange a viewing
Step 4
 - Make an offer
Step 5
 - Secure your sale using our secure system
Step 6
 - Exchange and complete
Don't miss out on the chance to purchase this property. Call us today for further information and to arrange a viewing.
If you're interested in this property, we urge you to contact us immediately to arrange an early viewing and get the process started. This will help you to avoid missing out on this opportunity.

The heart of this home is its family living kitchen, featuring bespoke cabinetry, top-of-the-range integrated appliances, and quartz worktops. The island offers a casual dining space, while bi-folding doors connect seamlessly to the orangery. Bathed in natural light, the orangery provides a versatile space for entertaining or relaxing, with views over the landscaped rear garden. Underfloor heating and elegant French doors enhance the luxurious feel. The lounge is perfect for cosy family evenings, with a feature fireplace adding warmth to the home. A downstairs toilet completes the ground floor living accommodation.
Heading upstairs, there are four well-proportioned bedrooms all served by a stylish and modern shower room. Making this the perfect home for growing families!
The landscaped rear garden is an oasis of calm and privacy, with a patio area ideal for al fresco dining and ample lawn space for children to play. The front driveway comfortably accommodates multiple vehicles, leading to an integral garage.
Situated in the heart of Bamford, this detached family home is close to well-regarded schools, local amenities, and transport links. Enjoy countryside walks on your doorstep, while remaining within easy reach of Manchester and beyond.

Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures

o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £5,000. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.

No vendor chain! Locate estate agent are delighted to bring to the market this stunning, fully renovated and extended four-bedroom family home, perfectly positioned in a superb location close to excellent amenities and well-regarded schools. Offering generous and versatile living space, this property is ideal for modern family life.
Step inside to find an impressive open-plan layout, seamlessly combining style and practicality. The heart of the home is a spacious, light-filled kitchen, dining area and snug, perfect for entertaining. Several well-proportioned reception rooms provide flexible options for living, working, or relaxing.
To the upstairs are four beautifully presented bedrooms offer ample accommodation, including a luxurious principal suite with an en-suite bathroom. Two additional modern bathrooms ensure convenience for the whole family.
Externally to the front is ample off road parking. Whilst to the rear is a good sized garden with a South/Westerly facing aspect.
The property has been extended and fully renovated to an exceptional standard, blending contemporary finishes with thoughtful design throughout.
Situated in a highly desirable area, you'll enjoy easy access to local shops, cafes, and excellent transport links. Families will appreciate the proximity to sought-after schools, making this an ideal long-term home.
This property is offered with no vendor chain, allowing for a smooth and hassle-free move. Early viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate all this home has to offer.
To book your viewing contact the Locate team at our Urmston office.

about_property:
Fantastic Location
Five minutes to Stalybridge train station
Close to local walking routes and Dovestone reservoir
Kingtons Estate Agents are pleased to offer to the market this spacious two bedroom terraced house located on the ever popular Mottram Road, Stalybridge.
Situated in an ideal location for local transport routes, with Stalybridge train station just five minutes walk away and close to the motorway network. The local area offers a multitude of stunning rural walks, including the famous Dovestone Reservoir, Cheetham Park and Stamford Park. There are plenty of local restaurants and bars within walking distance, and local gyms and swimming pools just a couple of minutes walk. The historic area of Saddleworth with its museums, walks, cafes and restaurants are just 10 minutes drive away.
The property has a vestibule entrance, opening to a large lounge with picture window, spacious kitchen with porch to the rear. Two great size bedrooms and a bathroom with a large rear garden/yard.
This is an ideal first time buy or investment so get in touch now to arrange your private viewing.

Modern mid townhouse on select development
Formerly Walmersley Brewery from 1830
Thoughtfully and sympathetically restored c 2014
One of twenty five homes on the site

A beautifully presented modern townhouse forming part of Old Brewers Court located in Walmersley Bury. As the name suggests, Old Brewers Court was originally Walmersley Brewery, dating back to 1830. The site was comprehensively rebuilt and restored approximately 10 years ago and 25 homes were created in what is now a designated conservation area. Our vendors have been resident at the property for a number of years and their presentation and attention to detail is exemplary, internal viewing is essential! The accommodation is quite rare as there are 3 double sized bedrooms and living space over 3 floors. Needless to say there is combination gas fired central heating and upvc double glazing and the accommodation briefly comprises: Entrance hall, guest cloakroom/w.c., lounge with patio doors onto the rear courtyard garden, kitchen with Siematic fitted units and Neff appliances, utility room with pantry off, first floor landing, two double bedrooms, three piece bathroom, second floor landing with large storage cupboard and main bedroom with ensuite shower room. To the outside there is a courtyard garden/sitting area and a designated parking space.
Tenure Leasehold 250 years from 2014
Management Charge £32 per month

about_property:
Large plot just over 0.5 of an acre
Private road hosting just 10 dwellings
Golf course to the front
Manchester commuter belt with mainline train station around 1 mile by road
Connection to M61 around 2 miles
Bolton School just over 2 miles
Planning granted for the construction of a 10,000 square-foot home
High calibre location
Mains services connected to site and freehold
Large retail development conveniently positioned around 1.5 miles away
Understood to be constructed around 1940 and owned within the same family for over 50 years.
The plot is just over half an acre, and it is generally a level site and is of a regular shape. Many years ago, the family purchased an additional strip of land and so there is a greater width when compared to some similar homes within the vicinity. Main services are connected, and our clients have also acquired the freehold.
The current dwelling is a four bedroom detached which in itself is a pleasant size but equally modest when compared to some of the more recently constructed properties along the road. As such, we are happy to report that our clients have gained detailed planning to construct a ‘super home’ of 10,000 ft.².
As such, the lengthy and costly legwork has been completed and establishes a remarkable concept. If a buyer wished to create a smaller dwelling, this should therefore be achievable subject to the usual consents.
As you will see, there are a number of CGI images to illustrate the proposed build and no doubt the buyer who presents will have a desire to create a high calibre bespoke home safe in the knowledge that the postcode supports high value transactions.
The sellers inform us that the property is Freehold
Council Tax is Band G - £3,628.51
St Andrews Road is located just off Links Road and Chorley New Road. The high calibre address sits within the heart of Lostock and hosts large individual dwellings, many of which boasting a significant value. As such a buyer can be comfortable in the knowledge that the tone of value within the immediate area is at a high level.
Many people would wish to settle in the area to benefit from the outstanding transport infrastructure which includes junction 6 of the M61 (around 2 miles away) and Lostock train station (around1 mile away) which is on the mainline to Manchester. Bolton School is also a consistent reason for residents to settle within the area and it is worth noting that a bus route runs along the nearby Chorley New Road and that the school is just around 2 miles away.
In terms of shops and services, Horwich town centre and the Middlebrook leisure and retail development include a great variety of outlets from small independent traders to large supermarkets, whilst many locals consider Manchester as an appropriate distance to shop, work and socialise. There is a choice of 2 golf clubs practically on the doorstep with a further variety of gyms and racquet clubs which serve the area. In summary Links Road has a great family friendly package on offer in what has long been regarded as one of the area’s leading residential zones and as such an early viewing should be considered essential.

about_property:
This investment apartment on Talbot Road, Manchester, offers an excellent opportunity for investors seeking reliable returns, with an expected 9% yield. Located in a prime area of Manchester, the property benefits from the city's expanding economy, vibrant cultural scene, and robust rental market.
Talbot Road is perfectly positioned for tenants, with easy access to Manchester city centre, business districts, and key amenities. The area is close to major shopping, dining, and entertainment venues, ensuring it remains a desirable place to live for those looking to be in the heart of the action. The location is ideal for professionals and commuters, with easy access to key transport links.
Key Features:
-9% expected rental yield
-High demand from professionals and commuters
-Close to Manchester city centre and amenities
-Excellent transport links to city and beyond
-Ongoing regeneration and investment in Manchester
-Prime location for steady rental income
Manchester continues to see strong economic growth, driven by sectors like finance, media, technology, and education. This creates consistent demand for rental properties, as the city attracts a diverse range of tenants. Talbot Road benefits from excellent transport links, with nearby bus and tram services, and is within easy reach of Manchester Piccadilly Station, providing convenient connections to other parts of the city and beyond.
Ongoing regeneration and infrastructure improvements in Manchester make properties in this area a solid investment for long-term growth. With strong demand for rental accommodation, this apartment offers a secure income stream, while the potential for future capital growth in this rapidly developing city adds to its attractiveness.
For investors, this property presents a reliable opportunity to generate steady rental income, with an expected 9% yield reflecting the city's strong rental market and growth potential.

An exquisite gated family home located on arguably one of the most prestigious roads in Greater Manchester, Ringley Road. Sitting in mature grounds with views to the rear over the golf course and internally finished to a high standard throughout.
The spacious accommodation offers a traditional yet contemporary style and comprises of; entrance porch, hallway, WC, formal lounge/dining room, breakfast kitchen, pantry/utility room, family room, games room sitting room and a gym. To the first floor there are five double bedrooms, all of which have en-suite. The master also benefiting from a large dressing room and a Swedish sauna.
Externally there is a block paved driveway to the front, accessed via electrically operated gates which provides off road parking for multiple vehicles. To the rear is a paved patio area which is perfect for outdoor entertaining and a full sized tennis court. There are mature planted boarders around the full plot, retaining the privacy.

about_property:
Many local amenities
Must be viewed to appreciate!
Stunning and immaculate property
Modern kitchen and bathroom
Gas central heating and double glazing
Tenure: Freehold
Stylish and modern design
Low maintenance landscaped garden
Two good sized bedrooms
Millbrooke Estate Agents are thrilled to offer for sale this stylish mid terraced property, that's ideally situated on the popular Mosley Common Road, Boothstown. Built around 1888, the tenure of the property is freehold. Offered in excellent condition throughout and boasting two bedrooms and two reception rooms plus a modern kitchen and a newly fitted bathroom suite. Just a short walk into the heart of the village with shops, bars, restaurants, and a community centre/library. You will also have two fantastic primary schools within a short walk and nearby access to the Bridgewater Canal. Excellent transport links by car and bus with the M60 Ring Road and the A580 East Lancashire Road both just a short distance away.
The property benefits from gas central heating (combi boiler), upvc double glazing throughout, upgraded oak doors with designed fittings plus upgraded windows/door to the front elevation including Venetian shutters. Comprising a spacious lounge with a stove style electric fire, under-stair storage cupboard and a spacious dining room. The kitchen is located to the rear and finished with high gloss units, complementary surfaces, and an integral fridge/freezer. An enclosed stairway to the first floor and landing area leading to the large master bedroom. This stunning room includes fitted wardrobes and is a wealth of space. To the rear elevation is a second bedroom and a newly fitted three-piece bathroom suite.
Externally the property is elevated from the road where you will have access to ample on street parking, a low maintenance front garden and a low maintenance landscaped rear garden with a patio area, decking and an artificial lawn. Gated access from the rear of the property to the alleyway. Internal viewing is highly recommended!
Local Authority: Salford Council
Tax band: A (£1475.68 per annum for 2023 to 2024)

A four bedroom and two reception room home, which benefits from excellent ongoing maintenance and quality presentation.
There are a number of different house types within this cul-de-sac. This particular layout includes two living rooms and benefits from a substantial conservatory extension to the rear which by way of its design allows the main living room and kitchen to interconnect. It is worthy of note that the conservatory roof has been replaced with a modern insulated type roof and is also plumbed into the main central heating.
The current configuration has been produced to allow for individual spaces however should more significant open plan accommodation be desired this could be created without the need to further extend.
To the first floor there are four bedrooms two double and two single the fourth bedroom being currently fitted as a study. The en-suite to the fully fitted master bedroom has been modernised in recent years.
In summary this home has been very well cared for and would no doubt suit a growing family.
The seller informs us that the property is Freehold
Council Tax is Band E - £2,807.65

The accommodation briefly comprises a welcoming entrance hallway, a bright and spacious lounge featuring oak flooring and a muti fuel stove, and a well-appointed fitted kitchen.

Premium Fast Sale
The innovative Premium Fast Sale Plus method from Springbok Properties is a secure and straightforward way to buy property. It works like a typical sale, with a number of added benefits to the buyer.
Benefits
o Carefully implemented security measures
o A speedy process
o Realistically priced properties
o A Buy it Now option (ask for further information on this feature from our advisors)
o A significantly reduced chance of fall-throughs
o No risk of being "gazumped"
o The full focus of our highly motivated team
Springbok Properties' Premium Fast Sale Plus puts you in the driving seat thanks to our fast and secure methods.
All properties are competitively priced and carefully managed by motivated sellers for a quick, stress-free transaction.
Deposit
Sales can be secured with a reservation deposit of £2,500. This forms part of the final purchase price and is not an extra cost.
This deposit ensures that the property is taken off the market as soon as a sale is agreed. It is then exclusively reserved for you, eliminating gazumping, time wasting and financial loss.
An administration fee of £396 is required in order to draw up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller. This gives the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a pre-agreed timeframe.
Exclusivity
Following the payment of the above amount, Springbok Properties will facilitate a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 12 weeks). During this time, surveys should be arranged and preparations made for the exchange of contracts. The property will be reserved, so there will be no risk of gazumping.
Process

Located just off Chorley New Road and therefore well placed for two of the towns major transport links.

about_property:
Detached House
Four Large Bedrooms
Approx 1/4 Acre Plot
Outbuildings
Over 2200 Sq Ft
Located within Aspull Village
Nestled in an elevated position in the highly sought-after Aspull Village, this versatile four bedroom property offers spacious living and a wealth of outdoor space. Set on a generous 1/4 acre plot, this home is perfect for families seeking a blend of tranquil surroundings and convenience.
This individual property is accessed via a driveway with double gates, leading to a front garden filled with mature trees and shrubs. The expansive rear garden features a raised lawn, and a variety of outbuildings, including a large greenhouse, shed, and additional storage building. The double and single detached garages provide versatile use for vehicles, storage, or workshop space.
Step inside to a welcoming cloakroom with a WC and sink, offering practical convenience. The large front lounge is a standout feature, boasting a bay window and a gas fireplace that creates a cozy atmosphere.
The study provides a perfect home office space, complete with built-in shelving. The inner hallway offers side access, ideal for everyday use.
The utility/boot room is plumbed for a washing machine and dryer and features shelving for additional storage. The kitchen dining room is well-appointed with fitted units, including a dishwasher, fridge freezer, oven, grill, and hob. This space seamlessly connects to the conservatory, which features French doors opening onto the beautiful garden, creating a perfect space for entertaining or enjoying the outdoors.
The spacious master bedroom at the front of the house includes fitted wardrobes and a modern en-suite with a shower, WC, sink, and bidet.
A second large double bedroom also faces the front, offering plenty of space for furnishings. The big bedroom to the rear of the property enjoys garden views, while the smaller double bedroom to the front remains well-sized.
A large storage cupboard on the landing provides extra practicality. The family bathroom includes a bath with overhead shower, WC, sink, and a bidet, maintaining the home's traditional charm.
Aspull Village offers a welcoming community feel, with excellent local schools, shops, and amenities nearby. Beautiful walks and green spaces are on your doorstep, while transport links offer easy access to surrounding areas and beyond.

Of beautifully designed living space. Entering through the main entrance on the private road, Globe Lane off Blackburn Road, you're greeted by a convenient porch that leads into a generous dining room—an inviting space ideal for both entertaining and daily living. From here, the home unfolds effortlessly, showcasing a perfect balance of period charm and modern comfort.
Spacious & Characterful Living Areas
Designed with both style and practicality in mind, the ground floor exudes character with original timber-beamed ceilings and a thoughtful layout. The generous living room extends across the width of the house, illuminated by two large leaded windows to the front and one to the side, filling the space with natural light. The neutral décor provides a timeless backdrop, while a striking original fireplace with a wood-burning stove sits against a statement wall adorned in Morris & Co 'Seaweed Haines' wallpaper, adding a touch of heritage charm.
Opposite the dining room, the well-appointed kitchen is both stylish and highly functional. Featuring grey-green timber grain-effect shaker-style units arranged in a practical u-shape, it offers ample storage and workspace, complemented by timber-style worktops. The ceramic sink and drainer, positioned under the window, provides a lovely view over the rear garden. Modern appliances, including an integrated electric oven, four-ring gas hob with concealed extractor, dishwasher, fridge, and freezer, ensure convenience, while a separate utility room with a WC is neatly tucked to the side for added practicality.
Three Beautiful Bedrooms & a Stunning Four-Piece Bathroom
The first floor offers three well-proportioned bedrooms, each filled with light and charm. The main bedroom, features a striking original stone fireplace, a beautiful feature wall, and two built-in wardrobes adding both character and functionality.
The spacious four-piece family bathroom is designed with a luxurious feel, comprising a WC, wall-mounted vanity sink, panelled bath, and a separate glazed-screen shower—a perfect space to unwind after a long day.
Converted Attic – A Flexible & Inviting Space
A staircase leads to the second floor, where a converted loft space offers endless possibilities. Split into two distinct areas, including a large attic room and an adjoining loft storage space, this versatile floor could serve as a home office, guest bedroom, or creative studio. Velux-style windows bring in natural light and fabulous views over the moors, while eaves storage maximises practicality without compromising style.
Cottage-Style Gardens & Prime Village Location
Step outside into the charming, well-kept cottage-style garden, where a paved patio leads up to a raised area with a shed at the rear—a perfect retreat for relaxing or entertaining. Thoughtfully landscaped with mature planting and inviting seating areas, the garden provides a peaceful escape, despite the home's prime location in the village of Egerton. With no direct neighbours at the rear of the property, it offers exceptional privacy and a wonderfully quiet setting. Additionally, there is potential to create a parking space where the shed is currently located, providing added convenience if desired.
Perfectly situated for easy access to local amenities, stunning countryside walks, and excellent schools, this home combines traditional charm with modern convenience. With immaculate presentation, spacious interiors, and an enviable location, this rare and characterful property is a fantastic opportunity to own a true piece of Egerton’s history.
Agent notes:
 Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested. Some photographs may include virtually staged furnishings and décor intended to illustrate potential layouts or styling.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed. Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Ravens Wood is a high calibre, modern development positioned just off Chorley New Road within the heart of Heaton and provides access to many of the important characteristics features associated with the area. There is popular schooling, both in the form of both state and private education. Many people settle within this facility locale as Bolton School is just around 1 mile away.
There is a popular group of bars and restaurants in the area, together with a great variety of sports facilities.
The area in general provides excellent access to surrounding countryside, which also includes the Doffcocker Lodge Nature Reserve, which is just over 1 mile away and a satellite view of the area will display the vast array of open green space. The town is located with particularly good access towards the West Pennine Moors, which attracts people from far and wide.
There is also an excellent infrastructure for travel, which includes a motorway link in around 3 miles and a mainline train station in around 1 mile. As such, many locals consider Manchester an appropriate a convenient distance to work and socialise.

Nestled in the vibrant Centre of Bolton, this beautifully presented one-bedroom, furnished apartment offers an excellent opportunity for investors seeking a buy-to-let property. Boasting a prime location, secure on-site parking, and the advantage of being available chain-free, this property is a must-see for those looking for convenience and modern living.
Positioned within close reach of a variety of local amenities, including shops, supermarkets, restaurants, and cafes, the apartment also benefits from proximity to well-regarded schools and leisure facilities. Additionally, the area is well-served by excellent road networks and public transport links, providing easy access to Bolton town centre and beyond, making it ideal for commuters.
The accommodation itself is thoughtfully designed, featuring a welcoming entrance hallway that leads into a bright and spacious open-plan kitchen and living area. The contemporary kitchen is fitted with modern units and integrated appliances, perfect for cooking and entertaining. The double bedroom is well-proportioned and offers a comfortable retreat, while the stylish shower room is finished to a high standard, providing a sleek and functional space.
There is a current tenant in the property paying £9540.00 per annum and it will be sold with this tenancy in place. The apartment also has a secure car parking space.
With its fantastic location and turnkey appeal, this apartment presents an outstanding opportunity to step onto the property ladder or expand an investment portfolio.
Lifestyle Sales and Lettings urge interested parties to arrange an internal inspection as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

This exceptional residence seamlessly blends period charm with modern luxury, offering an ideal family home with generous living spaces and high-quality finishes throughout.
Stepping inside, you are welcomed by an inviting entrance hall, adorned with intricate cornicing and panelling, setting the tone for the exquisite features found throughout. The spacious formal lounge, bathed in natural light from its elegant bay window, boasts a feature fireplace and high ceilings, creating a warm yet grand ambience. A second reception room provides further versatile living space, ideal as a formal dining area, home office, or cosy sitting room.
At the heart of the home lies the stunning breakfast kitchen, expertly designed to combine style and practicality. With bespoke cabinetry, premium integrated appliances, and a central island, this space is perfect for entertaining and family gatherings. The adjoining open-plan play area enjoys picturesque garden views, with bi-folding doors leading directly to the expansive gardens, ideal for alfresco dining. A separate utility room, thoughtfully designed with additional storage and space for laundry appliances, ensures practicality without compromising on style. Additionally, a modern downstairs WC provides added convenience for guests.
The first floor hosts three generously proportioned bedrooms, all beautifully presented with period detailing and ample storage. The luxurious family bathroom is finished to an exceptional standard, featuring a freestanding bath and walk-in shower. The principal bedroom further benefits from an elegant en-suite and walk-in wardrobe, adding a touch of indulgence to this remarkable home.
Externally, the extensive gardens are a true highlight, offering manicured lawns, mature planting, and a private aspect that enhances the home’s sense of tranquillity. The resin driveway with EV charging point offers ample off-road parking for family members and guests, while the property’s prime location ensures easy access to excellent local schools, shops, and transport links. Additionally, there is cctv on the front and back of the home for added security.
A truly distinguished home offering timeless elegance and contemporary comfort – viewing is highly recommended.

about_property:
Semi Detached Family Home
Three Spacious Double Bedrooms
Two Elegant Reception Rooms
Large, Modern Kitchen With Ample Storage
Separate Utility Room For Added Convenience
Retains Period Charm With Modern Updates
Recently Renovated And Move-In Ready
Well-Maintained Garden With Vegetable And Fruit Patches
Potential To Extend (Loft And Rear) With Planning Permission
Walking Distance To Bolton School And Local Amenities
A Perfect Blend Of Timeless Charm & Modern Comfort
A Perfect Blend of Timeless Charm & Modern Comfort
Step into this exquisite 1920s semi-detached home, where the timeless charm of the era seamlessly blends with modern comforts. Recently renovated and ready for you to move in, this spacious family home offers three double bedrooms, two reception rooms, and a large kitchen with a separate utility area. Every detail has been thoughtfully considered to preserve the period character while integrating contemporary essentials.
The front of the property is framed by hedgerows, creating a private and inviting atmosphere. A paved driveway offers convenient parking for one vehicle, leading you to the front door of this delightful home.
Elegant & Spacious Living
From the moment you enter, the warmth and charm of this home are immediately apparent. The porch features tropical Art Deco 'Grace Water Blue' wallpaper, setting the tone for the rest of the property.
The two reception rooms provide ample space for both relaxation and entertaining. High ceilings, period details, original doors and handles, and tasteful décor create a welcoming atmosphere. Large windows allow natural light to flood in, brightening the entire space. The dining room boasts deep picture rails, period putty-pink walls adorned with floral shabby chic wallcovering, a feature fireplace with a tiled hearth, and wide-plank timber laminate flooring. The living room showcases a wide bay window with views over the front garden, dark blue walls to picture rail height with white above, and a stone fireplace with a gas fire. The full wall behind the fire is decorated with Hestia mustard wisteria-style wallpaper.
The kitchen, located at the rear of the house, features grey painted cabinets, a white granite-effect worktop, a double stainless steel sink under the rear window with a view of the garden, plumbing for a dishwasher, and a white bird-patterned wallpaper. An original ornamental fire adds character, and walnut laminate flooring completes the space. The kitchen also includes room for a freestanding fridge/freezer, a separate cooking area with an electric oven, a 4-ring gas hob, and a stainless steel extractor above, with white metro tiles as the splashback. A separate utility room adds convenience and practicality.
Comfortable & Stylish Bedrooms
Climb the stairs, passing a half-landing window, and you’ll reach a spacious landing painted in putty pink with burnt sienna Nouveau-style wallpaper at the head of the staircase.
Upstairs, three double bedrooms offer peaceful retreats, each designed to maximize space and light. The spacious front-facing master bedroom is decorated with bird wallpaper at picture rail height, bright green behind the bed, and plenty of room for a full set of furniture. The second bedroom, also to the front is painted in a vibrant orange with original floorboards. The third bedroom, overlooking the rear garden, features forest green to picture rail height and pink above, with treated original floorboards.
The recently refurbished bathroom exudes luxury, with a stunning roll-top bath and overhead shower, a glazed screen, a stylish wall-hung deep blue vanity unit, and a separate WC. The marble-effect wall tiling and Moroccan-style flooring tiles add to the elegant feel.
A Garden to Enjoy
The outdoor space is just as impressive as the interior. The rear garden is well-maintained and low-maintenance, featuring a large paved patio and dedicated vegetable and fruit patches for those who enjoy growing their own produce. A split-level patio area provides the perfect setting for outdoor dining or relaxing in a peaceful atmosphere. The garden is enclosed with timber fencing, making it ideal for children and pets. There is also a large shed that houses a motorcycle/bikes with a ground anchor inside for added security. This can be accessed from the front or rear of the property.
A Fantastic Location
Situated on a desirable street in a friendly, welcoming neighbourhood, this home is just moments away from an award-winning pizza restaurant, a charming deli, and a beloved coffee shop. Bolton School and local primary schools are within walking distance, making it a fantastic choice for families.
Exciting Potential
With the right planning permissions, there’s the potential to extend into the loft, as some neighbouring properties have done. There’s also the possibility of a rear extension, allowing new owners to enhance this beautiful home further to meet their needs.
This home offers the perfect combination of charm, comfort, and practicality in a sought-after location. Viewing is highly recommended.
Agent notes:
 Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested. Some photographs may include virtually staged furnishings and décor intended to illustrate potential layouts or styling.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed. Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Modernised in last 3 1⁄2 years
0.3 distance to Lostock train station
Substantial open plan, kitchen and living area plus separate snug/gaming room.
Two of the bedrooms in particular are very large
Low maintenance, rear garden designed for entertaining
Fantastic, curb appeal with double apex
Separate utility and generous garage
Potential to create additional ensuite
Located just off Regent Road
The Home:
Our clients purchased this property just over three years ago from a family who had owned the property since its initial construction. Whilst the property had been well cared for during the lengthy ownership, aesthetically and layout wise the home was dated and subsequently a significant program of modernisation has taken place with a reconfiguration and an extension having now been completed.
The result is a stunning home with modern curb appeal by way of double apex roofline, neutral rendering and anthracite windows. The driveway has been enlarged to accommodate family sized parking whilst the garage has been retained. There is scope for further conversion should additional ground floor space or bedroom be required. The two primary bedrooms with their vaulted ceilings should allow this home to stand out from the crowd.
This truly is one not to be missed and an early viewing is recommended.
The property is Freehold
Council Tax is Band F - £3,318.18
The Area:
Morris Fold Drive is located just off Regent Road which is located within the heart of Lostock and is seen by many as one of the more prestigious roads within the area. A particularly strong feature of the road is access to Lostock train station which is around 0.3 miles away and links to Manchester and its airport.
Lostock County Primary School is just a few minutes from the property and the train station itself and many people buy within this area seeking good access to the private schooling on offer within the town (Bolton School is just over 2 miles away). Whilst the train station is well placed, Junction 5 and 6 of the M61 are also easily accessible. The closest commercial centre is within the out-of-town retail complex close to the Toughsheet Community Stadium at the Middlebrook retail complex which includes a number of supermarkets and large outlets together with gym, bowling alley, cinema, restaurants etc. There are also two golf courses and a tennis club within easy walking distance.
Many locals also consider Manchester and the Trafford Centre as an appropriate distance for both socialising and work. Whilst many of these features are ideal for living within a commuter belt of a large city, the town also boasts very popular countryside including a stretch of the West Pennine Moors and Winter Hill.

This fabulous extended property is perfectly nestled between the charming villages of Monton and Worsley, where you will find an array of shops, bars and restaurants; furthermore you are within walking distance to shops, parks and local schools. Situated on a generous plot and offers ample living space along with a private sun drenched rear garden, making this a perfect property for first time buyers, families and even investors.
Entering in through the hallway, the property leads through to the open plan lounge and dining room with French doors opening on to the rear garden. The fitted kitchen offers ample storage and work surfaces space. Across from the kitchen is the third reception room which offers a versatile living space suitable for your individual needs.
Ascending to the first floor you will find three generously proportioned bedrooms, the master with the original fireplace. Complementing the three bedrooms is the family bathroom suite, complete with corner tub.
Convenience is key with off-road parking available for multiple cars, meaning parking will never be an issue. The private rear garden, with its patio and lawn, offers a peaceful outdoor space to bask in the sun through the summer months.
Don't miss out on the opportunity to make this exceptional property your own. Whether you are looking for a family home, first time buy or a sound investment, this property ticks all the boxes. Contact us today to secure your viewing

Location
Winton is a desirable residential area located between both Monton & Worsley villages which are just a short walk away. Benefitting from St Gilberts & St Patricks schools which have both consistently been rated outstanding by ofsted making this a perfect area for families, along with the amazing award winning Winton Park, and Cleavelys Athletics Track. The M30 8 postcode is easily accessible via great motorway links (M60, M602) and is further connected to outside the area via the frequent running of trains from Patricroft and Eccles to Victoria station in Manchester taking just a 13 minute journey. There is a local Lidl supermarket situated on Worsley Road supplying all the necessities for a weekly shop. You can take a short drive to The Trafford Centre which would take around 10 minutes by car or roughly 20 minutes via bus.

The Strand is positioned just off Stocks Park Drive and is approximately half a mile outside Horwich town centre and is a well-established and highly regarded development. There are a combination of most house types, and many people are attracted to the estate due to the convenient location which allows good access to the shops and services both within the town centre and at the Middlebrook Leisure and Retail complex. There is an excellent transport infrastructure which includes Junction 6 of the M61 (around 2.5 miles away) and Horwich Parkway train station which is on the main line through to Manchester. Stylish Three Bedroom Detached Home
Completed By Morris Homes
Beautiful Presentation Throughout
En Suite to the Master Bedroom

Popular Estate within walking Distance of Standish Village
Nestled on this premier estate on the edge of a peaceful cul-de-sac, this exceptional family home was recently completed by the renowned Morris Homes. This handsome property offers thoughtfully designed living space, which perfectly balances modern convenience in a sought-after location. It is stylishly presented throughout and in ready to move in to condition.
Upon entry, a bright and welcoming hallway with Herringbone lvt flooring leads to a spacious cloakroom comprising a wash hand basin and w.c. And staircase rising to the first floor. On one side of the property is an elegant lounge which features three picture windows filling the room with natural light and the flowing stunning LTV flooring. At the heart of the home lies the open-plan dining kitchen, bathed in natural light from two windows and French doors leading to the garden. The kitchen is beautifully finished with sleek units, contrasting worktops, integrated appliances, a gas hob, and Karndean flooring. The French doors leading to the garden make the space ideal for entertaining and enjoying the outdoor space in the upcoming months.
Upstairs, three well-sized bedrooms provide ample space for family living. The main bedroom enjoys triple, the same beautiful flooring running through the home and a stylish en-suite with a double shower, vanity wash hand basin and w.c. Two further double bedrooms and a luxurious family bathroom complete the first floor rooms.
Externally, the property benefits from a private driveway to the rear of the home and as it rests on a corner plot it benefits from wrap around front gardens and a rear garden offers a large patio area, perfect for outdoor dining, along with a secure lawned space.
Located in the heart of Standish, this home is ideally positioned for excellent schools, transport links, and a vibrant village community with independent shops, popular eateries, and the historic St. Wilfrid’s Church.
Early viewings are highly recommended to appreciate the stylish presentation and quality of this exceptional home

A double fronted stone cottage which is a real break from the norm and offers accommodation that can suit a wide variety of family dynamics. Numbers 18 and 19 Bottom o'th Moor have been merged to create Spindle Cottage which is a large dwelling whose size is not so obvious from the exterior.
There is great flexibility of accommodation which can be utilised in a variety of ways. In summary, the layout is as follows; the ground floor includes a dining kitchen fitted with bespoke units and granite surfaces and three living areas. There is a large cellar room with regular head height that is used as a utility/store/boot room. The first floor includes two bedrooms (one with large ensuite) and the main bathroom. The second floor includes two further bedrooms and a store room. All the rear facing rooms enjoy the superb open aspect, initially over fields and then far reaching views beyond.
The property is Freehold
Council Tax is Band C - £1,935.20
Bottom o'th Moor is a high calibre address around a mile and a half from Horwich town centre and around two and a half miles from junction 6 of the M61 and Horwich Parkway train station. This station is on the mainline to central Manchester and Manchester airport.
The area manages to strike a lovely balance of these convenient amenities with superb access to the surrounding countryside and therefore the location tends to attract people who enjoy spending time outdoors whilst requiring the convenience of having transport links to a city.
There are footpaths leading immediately from the road with access towards High Rid reservoir, and the nearby Georges Lane is one of the main routes towards Rivington Pike and its associated moorland. Many locals consider Manchester and the Trafford Centre an appropriate distance to shop and socialise and is therefore another great attribute to the area.

about_property:
Charming Detached Farmhouse
360° Countryside Views With 2.72-Acre Field & Six Separate Garden Areas
To The Main House: Five Bedroom/ Three Reception/ Four Bathrooms
Additional One-Bedroom Studio, One-Bedroom Cottage And Two-Bedroom Cottage; Each Furnished With Bathroom, Lounge And Kitchen.
Flexible Accommodation Ideal For Large Families, Airbnb Rental Or Self-Contained Business Units
Private Gated Driveway & Parking For At Least Six Cars
Total Floor Space Approx 2270 Sq. Ft.
No Chain
5-Bed Detached Property With 2 Separate Annex Properties (Total 8 Bedrooms)
Substantial Family Home Set In A Picturesque Location
Escape the hustle and bustle of modern life and rediscover the restorative charms of the countryside at Holme Fold Farm, in Farnworth.
A home filled with rich history, that is of the land, Holme Fold Farm is a true character home, brimming with original features including centuries’ old, exposed beams.
Dating back to 1830, this former farmhouse has so much potential; with spacious rooms, a studio annex and two independent cottages, its flexibility is limitless – from family home with ample guest accommodation to hotel, farm, smallholding, lifestyle business; the versatility of the buildings and 2.7 acres of land cannot be underestimated.
A warm welcome
Pull through the bespoke iron gates and along a lengthy driveway, where there is ample parking for at least six cars, before making your way to the porch entrance, where a multifuel stove provides a buffer of warmth as you step indoors away from the elements.
To the right, make your way into the sitting room, where an incredible carved wood and redbrick original fireplace houses a gas fire. Currently used as a study, this cosy room features handsome exposed beams to the ceiling, with quality, hardwearing carpet underfoot. On windy days, shut the door to the world and feel the solidity of the thick stone walls, retaining warmth in winter and keeping a cool interior in the summer months.
Wine and dine
Opening up from the sitting room is the dining room, where a traditional look, real-flame gas fire adds rustic glow. Deep set windows frame views out over the courtyard whilst beams overhead – sourced from ancient ships – infuse this characterful room with olde worlde warmth.
Conveniently connected to the dining room, follow the easy flow of Holme Fold Farm through to the kitchen, where original flagstone flooring adds authentic farmhouse charm underfoot. Practical and robust, this flooring is perfectly in keeping with the country-style cabinetry that surrounds, providing plenty of storage.
Traditional touches
Overhead, in the white painted beams, original meat hooks can still be spied. With plenty of space for freestanding appliances beneath the solid oak worktops, there is ample potential to update this kitchen, with scope to open it up to the studio apartment beyond, creating a modern open-plan dining-kitchen. Views extend over the cobblestone courtyard, filled with colour and planted with flowers, trees and shrubs.
Ideal for family living, room leads on from room at Holme Fold Farm, with the kitchen conveniently connecting to the front lounge.
A superbly sized family room, modern spotlighting balances against the original beams inlaid within the ceiling above. Warmth fills the room from the stove, set within a handsome exposed redbrick surround, whilst views extend over the front garden.
Bedtime beckons
Completing the loop of the home, ascend the stairs from the sitting room to arrive on the upstairs landing, where recently fitted pale grey carpets harmonise with the white walls for a calming feel.
On the left, discover bedroom four, a good-sized double bedroom offering incredible views over the front of the home, with fields unfurling as far as the eye can see. A sunny, south-facing room, catch the sunrise and sunsets from this bedroom, and spy deer roaming the dew-covered meadows.
Freshen up in the bathroom opposite, beautifully proportioned and furnished with a traditional clawfoot bathtub, shower, wash basin with traditional taps and WC. Resin flooring, impervious to water, is practical underfoot. Pale grey and white tones mingle with rustic black beams.
Coming out of here, turn right to arrive at bedroom three, another good size double framing views out over the courtyard.
Room for all
Opposite, the largest bedroom awaits, bright and airy, and following the same soothing grey and white decorative motif as the preceding bedrooms. Furnished in traditional fashion, this bedroom is a true sanctuary.
Further along the landing, sneak a peek at the fitted storage, before arriving at bedroom two on the left, a room with ample storage and served by its own shower room ensuite.
Overlooking the courtyard to the rear, also furnished with a soothing shower room ensuite, is a sixth bedroom. Dressed in white and grey, each bedroom and bathroom has its own fresh, contemporary feel.
Rental potential
With six bedrooms and so much space in the main home, consider the potential of the studio one-bedroom annex, one-bedroom cottage and two-bedroom cottage which also come with Holme Fold Farm; each furnished with bathroom, lounge and kitchen.
Ideal as overspill accommodation for large families, for Airbnb rental or even as self-contained business units, the potential is vast.
Outdoor living
Outside, a coal shed and cycle shed provide plenty of storage (an old-fashioned door in the rear garden, once used for coal deliveries is a hint to the 1800s origins of the home).
Six areas of garden provide different pockets of privacy in which to relax, unwind and appreciate the peaceful rural setting of Holme Fold Farm. Perfect for children’s games, a formally planted area accompanies a picnicking area with bench seating. Wildlife is in abundance, encouraged by mature trees and hedging, which also provide privacy and shelter.
Owner quote: “You could have your own swimming pool, gym or llama farm; all the potential is there.”
Make your way to the 2.72-acre field, a sufficient size for two horses, and survey the sublime surroundings. Observe the 320-degree open country views, taking in the distinct beauty of six counties, including snow-capped moorlands and sunny meadows. Watch the new year fireworks beneath a blanket and with a flask of mulled wine.
Additional outbuildings include a barn currently used for storage and a large shipping container, used as a lock up.
On your doorstep
Enjoy the peace and quiet of the countryside at Holme Fold Farm, surrounded by fields and where at night you can sit out and hear the bats flitting about, replaced by the piercing cries of buzzards in the daytime.
Rurality and refuge come replete with convenience and connectivity, with five supermarkets close by, the nearest only eight minutes away.
Dip into the hustle and bustle of the world with a trip to the cinema, only 15 minutes’ drive from the door, whilst the Middlebrook Retail Park is just over ten minutes’ drive away.
Families are well served by a plethora of local primary, state and secondary schools, whilst the independent Bolton School is also less than 15 minutes’ drive away.
Commute with ease; the motorway junction is only five minutes from the door – though you’d never know it. The vast greenery of Great Lever and Farnworth Golf Club provides a buffer between Holme Fold Farm and the Royal Bolton Hospital – a mere five or so minutes’ drive away.
Owner quote: “One minute you’re in a semi-rural world; the next you can be in suburbia surrounded by modern life.”
For those who love character properties and are looking for the flexibility to build their own life around them, Holme Fold Farm is a versatile oasis of calm, wherein you can escape the inflexibility of modern life. Not just a home, it’s a lifestyle; and it’s ready for its next adventure.
Agent notes:
 Important Notice for Buyers
We do our best to make sure our property details are accurate and reliable, but they do not form part of any offer or contract and should not be relied upon as statements of fact. Measurements, photographs, floor plans, and any services or appliances listed are for guidance only — they may not be exact or tested. Some photographs may include virtually staged furnishings and décor intended to illustrate potential layouts or styling.
Fixtures & Fittings
Any fixtures and fittings not specifically mentioned in the property details should be agreed separately with the seller.
Anti-Money Laundering (aml) & Buyer id Checks
To comply with legal requirements, we must verify the identity of all buyers before we can move forward with a sale. We’ll also need proof of funds and details of your instructed solicitor at this stage. At Newton & Co, we use a trusted third-party provider to complete these checks securely and quickly. There’s a small, non-refundable fee of £25 per person (or £50 if you’re buying through a company), which is paid directly to us when you’re ready to proceed. Please note, we can’t issue a memorandum of sale until these checks are complete — so the sooner they’re done, the sooner we can help you secure your new home.
Relationship Disclosure
In line with Section 21 of the Estate Agents Act 1979, we must declare if the owner of a property is related to anyone at Newton & Co. If that’s ever the case, we’ll always let you know.
Referral Fees
We may recommend trusted partners for extra services you might need — such as conveyancing, mortgage advice, insurance, or surveys. Sometimes we receive a small referral fee for introducing you to these providers. You’re under no obligation to use them and you’re always welcome to choose your own.

Cooper Street is positioned just off Lee Lane and provides a superb balance of access into the town centre but from a cul-de-sac residential street. Houses on Cooper Street rarely come to the market due to the pleasant and convenient nature of its location. Many people look to settle in Horwich due to the transport infrastructure which includes Horwich Parkway and Blackrod train stations which link into Manchester and junction 6 M61. Horwich town centre offers a wide selection of shops, cafes and restaurants, many of which are independently owned, yet is also only a 10-minute drive from Middlebrook Retail and Leisure Park. For those who enjoy spending time outdoors the moors around Rivington Pike and Winter Hill are conveniently positioned and provide an impressive backdrop to the town itself. Anyone who has their search criteria set to good access to the countryside, excellent transport links and handy for day-to-day shops should look no further than Cooper Street.

Welcoming to the market this fabulous two bedroom terraced house situated on a quiet cul de sac within Eccles, surrounded by excellent local amenities. This property boasts two reception rooms, a fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms, and a three-piece bathroom suite installed in 2022. With low maintenance gardens to the front and rear.
Stepping through the front door into the entrance hallway which leads through to the spacious bay fronted lounge, continuing down the hall into the second reception rooms and the fitted kitchen which currently is separate, however has the potential to knock through and create a modern day living open plan kitchen, living and dining space.
Heading to the first floor, you will find the two generously sized double bedrooms both complete with the original fitted cast iron fireplaces, mixing the old with the new with its modern décor. Complementing the two bedrooms is the lovely contemporary fitted bathroom suite which was installed just a few years ago.
Externally the property benefits from low maintenance gardens to the front and rear which benefits from beautiful York paving stones, which offers a peaceful spot to sit and enjoy the fresh air. There is a wooden shed fitted and gated access to the shared communal alleyway.
This property is conveniently located within walking distance to The Trafford Centre, residents can enjoy shopping, dining, and entertainment options just a stone's throw away. The property is well-served by public transport and motorway links, ensuring easy access to surrounding areas for work or leisure.

For sale via Pearson Ferrier Auctions starting Tuesday 9th September, bidding will be on the Pearson Ferrier website and you can register to bid now. A detached bungalow situated in a quiet cul de sac on a corner plot close to Ramsbottom centre. The property comprises three bedrooms, lounge, kitchen/diner, bathroom, W.C. And hallway. Externally the property is on a corner plot with gardens all round and also has a driveway and garage. The property is both gas central heated and double glazed. Contact Pearson Ferrier to arrange your viewing. about_property:
Link-Detached Family Home
Prime Boothstown Location
Two Reception Rooms
Single Garage and Driveway Parking
Private Rear Garden
Spacious Living Accommodation
Excellent Commuter Links
Shops and Amenities Nearby
Fully Fitted Kitchen and Separate Utility Room
Millbrooke Estate Agents are delighted to offer for sale this well presented, spacious, three-bedroom link detached family home, ideally situated on a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of Boothstown, just a short stroll to local shops, bars, restaurants, family pubs and local community centre.
To the ground floor there is an entrance porch leading to a spacious, bright and airy lounge. A generous fitted kitchen/diner offers ample space for all the family with a further dining room situated to the rear of the property. There is also a separate utility room and downstairs WC to complete the ground floor accommodation.
Stairs from the lounge lead to the first floor where you will find three generous bedrooms and a modern family bathroom suite. The landing also provides a useful storage cupboard.
Externally, there is a driveway to the front of the property with a small lawned area, and to the rear there is a private fenced garden with patio area and the additional benefit of not being overlooked.
This lovely home occupies an enviable position on Southdown Drive, tucked away on a quiet cul-de-sac yet within walking distance to the village with an abundance of amenities including St Andrew's Primary School - which has an Outstanding Ofsted report, beautiful walks close by, including the Boothstown Marina on the Bridgewater Canal. Additionally the property has excellent transport links and is within easy reach of the East Lancashire Road (A580), the M60, M62 & M602 motorways.
This lovely family home offers very generous living accommodation within an ideal location and must be viewed early to avoid disappointment!
EPC Rating: E

about_property:
Semi-Detached House
Walking Distance to Local Shops and Transport Links
Front and Rear Gardens
Prime Boothstown Location
Three Bedrooms and Family Bathroom
Driveway Parking & Garage
Beautifully Presented Interior
Additional Loft Room
Spacious Family Room
Stylish Fitted Kitchen
Tenure: Leasehold
Millbrooke are delighted to bring to the market this beautiful semi-detached home offering flexible and well-proportioned living space, situated within the popular and highly convenient setting of Boothstown.
This beautiful family home is in ‘move in’ condition, nestled within a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of Boothstown. Upon entering the property you are greeted by a light and bright entrance hallway with downstairs WC and convenient under-stairs storage. The stylish kitchen with integrated appliances can be found to the rear elevation, with access to a vast, splendid, open plan family room - offering the perfect space for entertaining and relaxing, with doors leading to the rear garden. An additional reception room is also located on the ground floor offering another generous space for the family to enjoy quality time.
Stairs to the first floor take you to a landing, leading to two double bedrooms - both with fitted wardrobes, a further bedroom / study, and a stunning wet room. The loft has been converted to provide further accommodation, completing this impressive, internal living space.
Externally, the property is garden fronted with a block paved drive and garage offering ample off road parking. The generous rear gardens are laid to lawn with a patio area, offering excellent space for relaxing, children’s play and al-fresco entertaining.
Boothstown is a sought-after location close to Worsley. Popular for its close access to the East Lancashire Road (A580), the M60, M62 & M602 motorways. This property is well positioned for all local amenities, St Andrew's Primary School which has an Outstanding Ofsted report and sought after because it hosts some beautiful walks close by - including down by the Boothstown Marina on the Bridgewater Canal. With trendy cafe bars, pubs and restaurants providing pleasant places to socialise.
Rarely do homes of this type and quality remain on the market for long and as such, an early internal viewing is strongly advised to avoid disappointment.

about_property:
Idyllic End Terraced Cottage
Two Good Sized Bedrooms
Two Reception Rooms and Farmhouse Style Kitchen
Character Filled Accommodation
Resting on a Pretty and Extensive Plot
Off Road Parking and Garage
Viewing is Highly Recommended
8 The Nook is an idyllic countryside cottage nestled along this quaint little street in the heart of Appley Bridge. The home rests on a pretty and extensive plot which offers superb tiered landscaped gardens and has the added benefit of extensive gated and cobbled parking and an additional garage.
The home has been extended now offering over 1,065 sq ft of beautifully appointed living space, filled with character and light, bright rooms. Inside, the home effortlessly blends traditional charm with modern comfort. The interior features two inviting reception rooms, each complete with open fireplaces and period detailing throughout. The dining room features the staircase rising to the first floor and an open exposed brick fireplace, which provides a warm welcome. The main lounge boasts an impressive exposed stone wall featuring a gas stove creating the perfect space for cosy evenings in, yet filled with natural light via the picture windows. At the rear lies a cottage style farmhouse kitchen, complete with granite worktops, a Belfast sink, integrated oven and hob and room for informal dining. The kitchen provides access to the garden, perfect for relaxing with lunch or evening drinks.
Upstairs, the property offers two charming bedrooms retaining their period character. The main bedroom is of a lovely size and enjoys views over The Nook, whilst the rear bedroom features a range of built-in wardrobes. The family shower room has been recently refitted with a high end traditional suite including a corner shower unit, high-level cistern WC, traditional vanity sink and heated towel rail.
The Nook is set on an extensive plot—a truly enchanting English country garden that feels like something from the pages of a magazine. A winding arched pathway leads to the front of the cottage, shared with the adjoining property, while to the rear, expansive lawns, mature planting and shrubs create a serene and private retreat. The garden also has a charming Summer House —perfect for quiet moments or entertaining. There is secure gated and cobbled and gravelled parking for a number of vehicles to the front of the property and also leading to the integral garage.
This is a rare opportunity to acquire a home that combines rustic elegance, modern refinement, and a genuine sense of tranquillity in a sought-after countryside setting.
